Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: it burns, and is awful for sensitive and dry skin

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
The gel peel was easy to apply and because it is such a deep color you can't really miss in applying an even coat.
That being said, I first applied the chemical and waited 9 minutes, but nothing happened. I mean no itch or warming sensation at all.
I do not have super sensitive skin, but my skin is sensitive. I waited 48 hours, but nothing peeled or changed at all. I put on a second time to give it a second chance, but there was still no change. I bought it because of all the hype from the reviews, but this product is just hype. The price I paid for it and the seller I bought it from were the only positive things I can say about the product.
I am a white male at the age of 46.
Just to make sure anyone understands that I truly tested this product. The area I tried the product on was my face and the other was my private area to try and get rid of hyper pigmentation. I left it on my private area for 45 minutes to just make sure that the product is a waste of time.
People are buying this product for two main reasons. First, the cheap price that makes it inexpensive to buy and the other being all the high rated reviews saying that this product works so good.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It's been a long journey for me to give you this review. Like you, I wanted so badly for this product to work, and bought it expecting results. First few times I used it I did as directed, left on for 10 mins and did once a week. Did not notice any change any of those times, so I started using it twice a week and still didnt see results. SO I upped my usage to every other day, and left on for 2 mins longer than it says to, and finally started to see a clearer complexion overall. Like you, I saw the bad reviews on here and so I ended up buying another directly from their website (cheaper on there too!) and used it for the first time last night. WOW, it was like night and day. It burnt the crap out of my face properly like an acid peel is intended to, and I woke up with phenomenal results. Such good results that I had to put in my review, its only 7:40 a.m. Do not buy this inferior product, go directly to the website. You are wasting your time if you buy from here. Pretty sure all the people seeing results with this product are all experiencing the placebo effect.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I’m very familiar with aha products… the directions say to leave on no more than 10 minutes. Normally I have difficulty waiting the full 10 minutes because I have sensitive skin. I can leave this product on overnight (and have) with zero tingling, as well as zero benefit. Very disappointing. Will have to go out of my way calling customer support to return. Not happy

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I tried this product out because I thought it would help me with my acne and it had amazing reviews. The first time I tried it was fine, but then the second time I tried it there was EXTREME discomfort. It was the worst pain I have ever felt on my face, and I couldn't leave it on for more than a minute because I was in so much pain.

I am so lucky because it did not give me a chemical burn, but NO ONE should buy this product! There are too many chemicals for the average face. After I took it off, I researched more about it and there are a lot of people who have been in my situation, or had it WAY worse. Anyways, save your money. Just because social media says its good, it isn't.

I ALSO tried to get a refund on the product, and they said I can't. So that is also very fun...

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I never really considered myself someone with particularly delicate skin. I'd say my skin type is "normal", with a slightly oilier t-zone than cheek area. For context, I'm 35, white, female. I was hoping for a brightening peel that would pep up my dull, winter-weary skin. This took off my whole winter-weary face. I experienced light tingling during use but nothing significant, washed it off, it wasn't until an hour later that my skin started to get red and puffy accompanied by a severe burning sensation. I tried washing my face again and applying face oil but nothing helped. My face was raw and red for 2-3 days, followed by ungodly peeling (luckily no sustained scarring). I have other products from this line and have tried other peels from other brands; this is the only time I've had such a painful, alarming reaction. Seems to work for a lot of people, but my experience was pretty horrendous.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
This product is just not for me, unfortunately. I have oily, acne prone skin, with little sensitivity to pretty much any skincare product but this product I had such a sensitivity to, sadly. The first time I used this, everything was fine, no reaction, left on for 10 minutes, an hour later my face was itchy. I thought nothing of it, but I did notice that the cystic acne on the side of my face was noticeably worse. The second time I used this, the itching was immediate and intense! I washed it off as soon as I could, and could not be more mortified. Thankfully, nothing happened to my skin, but who knows what would have happened had I not washed it off immediately. Right now, I think I’ll just stick to personal microdermabrasion and vitamin a.
Don’t let this review scare you, because I know so many people who like this product, but be cautious of what you could be allergic to!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I'm 42 and actively treating sun damage accumulated during my 20s. I've been using 10% AHA (Paula's Choice) on a weekly basis, for about a year now, to help with uneven texture and dry, rough patches - with noticeable results. I was ready for something stronger. I bought this and left it on for 10 minutes the first time since 30% AHA seemed serious, but didn't notice any results. The second time I left it on for 20 minutes, but still no difference in my skin. The third time I left it on for 45 minutes before rinsing it off in the shower. I felt nothing. My skin did not feel any softer as I rinsed the product off. I regularly use other products by The Ordinary that I purchased from Sephora (Buffet, Granactive Retinol, HA Moisturizer, Rosehip Oil Serum) and those have been game changers for me. This should have been much stronger. Complete waste of $$$.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I was so excited to try this peel. I don't have abnormally sensitive skin and get enzyme facials once a month without issues. I tried this on Sunday evening, left it on for 8 minutes - did not experience any tingling or any discomfort, was careful when I washed it off and applied a good moisturizer afterwards. Monday my skin felt a little dry, so I used a heavier cream during the day (one that I use often). When I woke up Tuesday morning, I had a rash all around my lower face kind of like a beard! It's super itchy and irritated still. I'm putting fresh aloe vera pulp on it hoping that it will calm it down and promote healing...guess I should have done a patch test before smearing it all over my face.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It really sucked to see that my order had finally shipped, just to check the mail and it was damaged! I was really excited to use this product as I have seen so many good reviews on tiktok! I was originally suppose to receive the product 6/4, but did not receive it until 6/15. Which tells me it is a high demand and probably great product! Only I won’t get a chance to find out.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Not for everyone - I started using this about two weeks ago. Following the instructions strictly, I have used it 3 times. I felt slight irritation but that's very common with this product. Result - THIS SPOILED MY SKIN. My skin used to be very smooth in texture, after first application I noticed bumps and pimples on my face which wasn't there before. With continuous use, it worsened the perfectly fine skin I had before. It didn't feel just like purging, this product made me break out really bad with acne and cysts. I love other ordinary products I have tried. So I think it's AHA - BHA in general which didn't suit /work for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So I have super sensitive skin, and I knew it was a possibility trying this product, HOWEVER I was completely bamboozled when it worked perfectly the first time! It was amazing, didn’t tingle or anything. About a week and a half later I used it again, upon applying it burned the ever living crap out of my face. I don’t know what was different? It has done the same every time I have applied since and I would have to immediate wipe it off. I wish my skin wasn’t so needy so I could use this product to its full potential :/

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This did nothing for my skin. No peeling, no help with discoloration nothing. It didn't matter how long I left it on it was like having deep purple dye on my face. If that's the look your going for do it. But I consider this a waste of coin. Would I buy it again?. That's a big no.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So I was really excited to try this product out because I've suffered from acne and wanted to use this product to help with the marks and scars left behind, but when I took off the mask, nothing happened. And I don't mean that like I expected for this product to take a layer of my skin off in just application, its just that I felt no tingling, stinging, or any sensation, and when I removed the mask it didn't even leave my face red like my other chemical mask peels. I don't know if I'm doing something wrong, or if it's the product itself, but I was really let down.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I'm thoroughly disappointed with this product. Thus is a review from someone who does not have sensitive skin: I have oily/normal skin. I heard the hype and thought I should check it out.

The last time I had a pimple or breakout was about 6 months ago. I decided to buy this for my black heads, but instead of helping my skin this product gave me a pimple and and skin breakout. I suggest you do not buy this overpriced and skin irritating product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I saw an ad about this product on IG and I immediately bought it on Amazon, however it doesnt do what it says it does. Been trying this product for almost 2 months now and even though it’s an uncomfortable product to leave on your face because it stings and doesn’t smell nice I kept using it until my acne got worse and my skin looks awful. I’m not sure if this is actually the real product but real or not, it doesn’t work.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: A burning sensation and it was not easy to peel off. I purchased on the recommendation of a dermatologist. Used it once and that’s it. Also, I didn’t see any evidence of dirt or clogged pores pulled off of my skin. However, I did have to wipe it away instead of peeling it off so that could be the reason. Nonetheless it’s in my cabinet taking up space.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: The reviews I read about this product, said there’s a tingle , I felt absolutely nothing. It’s a little unsettling, because I also remember a review that said they purchased this product through amazon and also had no tingle or results. So they purchased it through someone else and the product was totally different, and she did feel the tingle and she also seen results. So I’ll give it a few more try’s and if no results, I will be asking for a refund.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I really wanted to love this product after reading all the reviews but after using it twice, I tried to return. I was unable to as the seller doesn't offer returns. I followed the directions, leaving it on for ten minutes at a time, no more than twice a week. It really burns so it feels like its working but I didn't experience any peeling or flakiness after. There has been no improvement in using this product and it was really a waste for me. I would not recommend.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I've ordered this same product from both ulta and sephora but ordered from amazon for faster delivery.
I' am very familiar with how this product is suppose to feel on the skin, the texture of the liquid and color.
I gave the product I received from amazon the benefit of doubt and waited to see if there are any results and none. I felt absolutely nothing on my skin and no changes.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Have used before and this isn’t even close to the same product. It was pink water instead of red serum. You are supposed to drop it onto your face and smooth it on but this is literally liquid so it runs right off. I even tried putting it on my fingers with even less luck. Very frustrating and obviously not the real thing. I will go back to ordering from Sephora. It is actually cheaper there.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I ordered this product from amazon and tried it a few times with absolutely no burning or tingling and saw zero results. I read so many great reviews and decided to order it directly from sephora. The consistancy and color are not even the same and the product I got from sephora actually tingles and I have seen some good results.so far. Not sure what product amazon is selling but it is definitely not the same.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I wish I paid more attention to all the reviews on here. There was some sort of disclaimer stating that there is not a plastic seal type thing on the bottle. Perhaps that is why the merchandise arrived looking like the pictures. Live and learn right? This is why it’s best for everyone to order from the actual company, or at least purchase from Ulta and Sephora.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
First time I used it, my skin looked great and glowed. Second time I used it, my skin became angry and broke out like I’ve never ever seen even in my teens.
Now my skin is a mess full of cystic acne. This stuff is strong and will bring everything up to the surface. Not sure if it’s worth it. I stopped using it. Skin is healing. Ugh.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I have only been using this for about a month and have not been impressed so far.

I have had several break-outs and hope it is simply due to the "purging process".

Edit as of 7-22....I just used this again and my face broke out with cystic acne within two days.
Do yourself a favor and try the Generation Clay Ultra Violet Brightening Purple Clay Mask if you want a solid alternative.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So I raced home on my lunch break because I saw my package had been delivered. I was very excited. Until I opened it. The lid was off not at all sealed and there was solution all over the Box I have pictures if I can figure out how to post them. Not impressed and not even sure I will put on my face

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
Many people are complaining about this product
I used it beforehand with no problems and was happy but this particular bottle I don’t know if they changed the formula or what but it burned my skin. Red patch everywhere. Unbearable
Too bad I can’t be refunded . Will not be buying again. Don’t trust it any longer

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I don’t notice any difference in my skin after using this product. I leave it on for no more than 10 minutes and wash it off as directed, but my skin looks exactly the same as before I applied the product.
This does sting upon applying it to my face, but it doesn’t last long.
I just feel like this product really fell flat and didn’t live up to its claims.

Save your money on this one.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Never seen a GlySal combo dark brown. I’m an esthetician in California and work with many professional AHA BHA peels. This is not good. I also have resilient skin and can take higher than 30% glycolic acid. This really burned. Further on my resilient skin a 30% should not flake or peel. Glycolic penetrates beyond the epidermis to work below. This isn’t a worthy product and they don’t allow you to return. Hmm wonder why.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: My skin is a little sensitive but more dry for the most part and I have some discoloration so I was excited to try out this product. But boy was it a big mistake. I couldn’t even leave it on for 2 mins without it intensely burning. I took it off immediately and it has now left my skin very red and splotchy. My face is burning as I type this. This product isn’t for everyone.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I have used this product twice and cannot see or feel a difference in my skin. I have used peeling solutions before, usually right after your skin is soft and you can see a difference. I don't know if i recieved a defective bottle or what, but there is no difference between using this or putting water on my face.
Not buying again.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: DO NOT BUY. I used it today and it gave me horrible chemical burn, my face stings and is stained bright red. Directions say to use for no more than 10 minutes, this happened after only 3 minutes of use. Not sure if this is the real product or not but it is a complete waste of money.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It did nothing for me but make a mess it was the messiest thing I’ve ever experienced it was hard to put on without dripping all over the place when it was on it was dripping all over the place it was a mess and it did nothing for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have this for a few weeks now and it does nothing for me. I will continue to use and maybe apply more in my skin. I think this is just one of those products where “individual results may vary.” But if you don’t mind spending $13 bucks, try it. I’m really into skincare and you have to experiment to see what works!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Like others said, this is not the real product. Ordered from both amazon and Sephora, very different. While the amazon one is thicker, dark reddish-brown, nearly scentless, and no stinging/tingling sensation, the Sephora one is more liquid, a brighter red, has a certain smell, and stings. I believe the Sephora one is the genuine product and recommend buying from them instead.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I’m sorry but this was honestly the worst product so far , I only used it twice and my face broke out
So bad in the next two days... haven’t used it since. My face got clearer but the acne had gotten worse after I brought this product

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I don;t know if I just got a bad bottle, but this did nothing for me. Many of the reviews (and a few friends) mentioned a burning sensation if you leave it on too long. I do not have that. I left it on for 15 minutes and nothing...I really just wonder if the bottle is bad for some reason...

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Nothing! I have been using this product for over a week, daily, and have seen nothing. The people writing reviews seem to like it but I have seen no change in any way at all. I will keep using it for another week or so and update my review if there are any changes.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I would put two stars because my sister said it wasn’t bad on her skin but it was terrible on mine. It burned my skin and left red bumps. It itches and just burned for an hour. I do not recommend if you have sensitive skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I didn’t feel any sensation like burning or tingling. The same peeling solution I purchased from Ulta another day I felt the sensation. And the product I ordered from Amazon, after putting on face it’s feel like I’m putting soap, it’s like white structure.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Used this for 4 weeks straight and wasn't seeing any difference so stopped using it. After I stopped, I saw no difference of my skin getting worse without the use of this peel so I opted to stay not using a harsh chemical peel on my skin

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I bought this product on here because I thought the one my sister had ran out. Ordered it but, turns out she did still have hers. I compared the two and her box was totally different the real one was more of a matte box and was wider, the smell was completely different as well:/

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have ordered this product from amazon before and the consistency of the peel was thicker, and a darker shade of red. My most recent Bottle is a light red, seems watered down, and there is no sensation on my skin from the acids contained in the peel like there was with other bottles.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I don't know if I had an allergic reaction to this, or if it is normal, but my cheeks got very red and bumpy after using this. I gave it 1 star because I think if you have a reaction to a product there should be a way to return it or get a refund. Unfortunate.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: The best face mask ever, IF purchased from the right seller. I don’t know what I received but it wasn’t The Ordinary masks that first tingles, cleans and leaves your pores invisible when you wash it off. The consistency was watery too instead of thick.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I couldn't leave this on for more than 5 seconds. I used as directed and on contact my skin IMMEDIATELY started burning. Like, unbearable burning. I don't have sensitive skin, either. I'm kinda disappointed that this isn't working for me and I definitely wasted money.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product was delivered with a broken seal and a strong scent. I was super excited to get it but disappointed in the delivery of it. Please be careful when ordering from people on Amazon.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I used this twice (about one week between uses). Made me break out really badly :( or at least made my closed comedones and pimples much more visible and that was very problematic for me as I am a chronic picker and popper. Big setback. Threw it in the trash.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It was okay but not what I expected based on the advertisements.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I purchased a few Ordinary products from Amazon. I have since stopped doing that as all of them were not only more expensive then purchasing from Deciem, but also seemed very different and I ended up throwing them out.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I love The Ordinary products. They are of excellent quality for a low price. But the problem was that I bought one product and received another! I ordered The Ordinary Peeling Solutions AHA 30% + BHA 2% and received Granactive Retinoid 5% in Squalane. I'm very disappointed because they put a wrong sticker in the product box.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I ordered as Christmas presents because a friend recommended. What a pain- all the bottles were in horrible condition- no plastic preventing bottles from opening (clearly). Now a waste of my time to deal with returning!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: BURNS!!! Like crazy, learned my lesson. Not for people with SENSITIVE SKIN!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I bought this due to seeing it on every social media platform however, when I used it the first time my skin was burning!!!! It was unbelievably painful and had to get rid of it.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
Buen my skin... after the second use my skin was burn and is the only product I’m using at this time!!!

I used it as recommended and still burn me...

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is amazing! The reason I’m giving it a 1 Star is because you can buy this at Ulta for literally 1/3 of the price. I can’t believe I paid triple the price for the same product!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is not original, it smells like cheap perfume, it paints your face what the original peeling does not. It is a danger that there are people who sell fake products and threaten health. Be very careful when buying. It's not reliable.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I think this is a used product. It wasn’t filled. No seal and when I applied it became like a soapy consistency and was goopy , is that normal ? Plus better to buy directly from site or other retailer. I just don’t trust placing this on my face

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This price is ridiculous I got the original for way less (this is three times what it actually costs) at a reputable make up and skin care store. It makes no sense to pay this much. Already returned.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I broke out in a rash. It’s been a week and I have little bumps all over my face. I only left it on for 4 minutes. I’m bummed because so many others had good luck with the product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I think I got the bad reseller product. No stinging, no redness, no peeling... no reaction. 13 minutes
I will buy from the ordinary site and let y’all know.
Can’t really say waste of money cause it was so cheap

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I ordered this because I was excited to try it the product inside seems to be fine but on the outside it looks like some soap spilled it’s really disgusting and unprofessional.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is over priced, it only cost 7 dollars at Ulta, and Sephora, plus I did not feel anything different and my face also didn't peel I have been using it for about a month now.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Does not work . Does not peel . Doesn't do anything . Just looks like it works but it actually doesn't do anything and I've tried a ton of great products that work so I know the difference . Tried this 4xs no results

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: fraudulent product with some sort of detergent added.. just order from ordinary website to avoid the return hassle

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product was not authentic. It was diluted and watery. It did not tingle or provide any result. Later found the genuine product selks at Ulta for only $6.00

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I usually buy my ordinary products directly from ulta but I thought I try Amazon it looks the same kinda works the same but the smell could make you gag 🤪

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
The packaging and product is very similar to the Ordinary brand, but the price is double. It has the frosted eye dropper glass bottle and the wine red colored peeling solution. The solution is supposed to exfoliate and make your skin softer and instruction states to leave on for 10 minutes and nothing longer, then rise with luke warm water afterwards.

This is a chemical peel. The ingredients are alphahydroxy acid (AHA) and beta hydroxy acid (BHA), keyword acid so ALWAYS do a spot test on your skin first and have an acide neutralizer and try to protect your sensitive skin like around the eyes and lips with petroleum jelly like vaseline.

The peel wasn't as strong as the one I have used before. It was slightly tingling but not much. I advise avoiding the sun if possible or making sure to apply sunscreen in the applied areas.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I so truly wanted to love this product (like so truly wanted to love Niacinamide 10% + Zinc, Natural Moisturizing Factors, Resveratrol 3% + FA 3% etc) but seems to be a running theme w TO products.

Tacky sticky texture (WHY?), caused immediate irritation with no visible resurfacing of textural irregularities, made skin flushed and irritated. The whole clear dropper vial + burgundy color is cute if you’re a 15yo girl wanting to feel trendy.

But if you’re looking for true reduction in pore congestion, irregular texture and tone... stay away from this product. Try Paula’s Choice BHA Liquid or dive into DIY skincare.

(Rant: Running theme with Deciem/The Ordinary products... Big ambition, poor execution. Flaunt high %s of active ingredients but don’t house them within a base/delivery system that effectively delivers those actives’ effects to the skin. Not a fan of any of their products. Plus dropper Vials need to go... always buy from a brand that uses airless vacuum pump bottles. Try SkinActives)

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Let me start by saying I had successfully used this product before many times with no problem and great results. However after following recommended application instructions this last time it seemed much more harsh. I didn't leave it on for even half as long as I usually did because it was burning my skin so badly. My face was shiny and red for a couple days after washing it off and painfully dry so I had to constantly moisturize until the damage healed. I still have a small patch under my right eye from it months later. It may just be that I had a bad reaction to it, but to me it's not worth the risk of additional skin damage, so I will be leaving facial peels to the professionals from now on.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I used this product for the very first time a couple of days ago and at first it stung a little so I thought it was because I had water on my face (even though I dried it well) I left it on for like 8 minutes and washed it off. I followed up with my normal face moisturizer. I have combination skin leaning towards it being more oily. So I use a moisturizer for oily skin. It felt all fine and good but I woke up to a bad breakout like I never had before. I thought it was because I was about to be on my period but nooo this product messed my face up. Will never buy again. It may have worked for other but it ruined my face. Careful.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I used this without testing it and it gave me a really bad rash. The rash was not visible on plain sight but more like internally. My skin did not peel or have a glossier effect afterwards - not sure what to make of this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I had high expectations for this peel, especially since it was my first TO purchase, but haven't seen any drastic improvements in my sensitive, acne-prone skin over the 4 months that i have been using it. For the first 3 months, I used it twice weekly for 10-15 minutes and now I use it once weekly. My skin tingles while the peel is on my face, but it is bearable. Blackheads are still there after I neutralize the peel with warm water, and I haven't noticed lightening of areas with hyperpigmentation nor increased healing of or prevention of acne. I haven't experienced any peeling or dryness. However, my skin does feel smoother after using. I will not repurchase, and will try another brand's peel once I finish this bottle.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I purchased the one on the left from Amazon and then I went to Ulta and purchased the same item the one on the right. I read the reviews and was expecting to feel something from the peeling solution. When I tried the purchase from Amazon I did not feel any tingling or notice any real effect on my face. The consistency and color is the same however, when I used the bottle from Ulta I felt the tingle and notice a difference in the am. Im not sure what is going on with the Amazon purchase as I am not a chemist.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: not here to bash , i think the product is too strong for me . whenever i apply it , it begins to have a slight burning feeling , after i ignore it long enough it goes away but i know skincare shouldnt burn you . i was hoping it would help my skin but i guess im gonna need something a lot more gentle . (i also found it left my skin dry n had a weird smell idk if thats how it always smells but its just like a really sour berry kind of smell)

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
First night, I applied per instructions and left it on for seven minutes. Next day no results. Second day left it on ten minutes. No tingling, next day, no effect. Third day, 20 minutes. Next day nothing. It has been four days since last (20 minute) application. I can;t see any difference.
I gave it two stars because the packaging, branding is very appealing and because it only cost $14.00.
I would be REALLY mad if I had thrown away $60 or $70 or $80. So disappointed

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I know I have sensitive and reactive skin but even my derm says I have thick skin bc of my tretinoin use. FYI, thick skin is what we want.

Still, I don’t know how anyone can stand having this on their skin for longer than 10 seconds. I just can’t, I’ve tried and failed every time.

I’m pleased others can tolerate it though; because the benefits I’ve seen are incredible. It’s not the product’s fault; it’s my skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Honestly haven't noticed a difference. The burn is minimal, if noticeable at all. Anything that promises you results only after using it for several weeks is something I would typically suspect. Since this is an at home chemical peel that is supposed to exfoliate and advertises itself as a particularly intense one - I'd expect /something/ after 1-3 uses. I even ignored the warnings and used it every day for a week, hoping it'd do something but no.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have oily skin - it's not sensitive - yet this stuff ruined my skin! It made it peel and itch around the mouth/chin area. At first I thought that it was from the retinol so I stopped using that but it kept happening and the day after I had used it. Be careful around your eyes and your mouth ladies!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I always test new cosmetic treatments by using them only on one half of my face, because my complexion goes through cycles regardless of which treatments I'm using and I can't always be sure that changes are due to the product. After six and a half weeks of twice-weekly use, nobody could guess which side it was. My teen used it too and thought maybe it helped her. On the positive side, it didn't hurt and did no damage.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I came across this in a Buzzfeed article. I've been learning how to take care of my combination skin using more chemical exfoliates rather than abrasive because my skin scars unfortunately well. While this product felt like it was working the first two times (a gentle burning sensation) I haven't really noticed a difference in the texture of my skin. However, I've only been using it about two or three months, twice a week, and not totally consistently.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I’ve used the ordinary before and got wonderful results after the first use! I believe I got a bad batch or a return that someone filled up with some crap! I’m not happy about this at all

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Unfortunately didn’t work for me

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Not very potent

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Beware if you have sensitive skin! I was okay when I initially used this product. However, after long term use of this peel, my skin started reacting very BADLY! The areas I applied the product became very red and inflamed. I had very bad contact dermatitis that lasted for 5 months and doctors told me it almost looked like a chemical burn. I had to do a complete purge of all my skincare products because the bad dermatitis this product gave me wouldnt heal. If you are new to this product, I would just apply it to a small area of your skin and just do a patch test. Everyones skin is different, and Im just the one who reacts terribly to this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
*I bought from a store not Amazon, seems people were getting fakes (plus it's $8 in store)
Tried it for a few weeks, my skin was softer right after, but I have yet to see any difference with pigment changes, or fine line/scars ect, in reality I feel like I'm seeing brown pigment more than when I started, plus my skin is breaking out with little bumps mainly around the jaw line, and then my skin is very dry and flaky around my temples.
Maybe if I had major acne scarring I would see a difference, so it may work better for others who have more problematic skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I'm not new to AHA. I've been using a milder AHA serum and BHA regularly. The 4 times I tried this The Ordinary AHA 30 mask, I broke out with pimples each time. I don't normally get pimples except 1 or 2 a month. The pimples appeared the day after I used the mask and they appeared in odd places, like around my eyebrows or in places I normally never get pimples. I also got a few cystic pimples too and I almost NEVER get those. I don't think this is any kind of purging since I'm not new to exfoliation and exfoliate regularly. I really wanted this to work but it just made my skin worst than it ever was to begin with.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I love this product and the company, but it costs wayyy too much on here. If you go to Ulta you can get the same product for EIGHT DOLLARS! This product is very likely to be fake.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I really wanted to like this but I just can't use it anymore.
Pros: Decreases Sebaceous Filaments for about 24 hours (then they come back, unfortunately)
Cons: BURNS. SO bad. I feel like my skin is on freakin fire when I used this and it cherry red for the next day or 2 after using. My skin is fairly sensitive and I have acne and most likely rosacea. Didn't help my acne scars/PIH after going through 2 1/2 bottles. Formula stains everything so be careful!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I cant say if it works or not because as soon as I put it on,it burned so bad I instantly wiped it off...it really hurt my face...lol

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Cheaper at Ulta ($7.20) and you get guaranteed authenticity. Why pay more and risk it?

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Hasn't worked so far... Still have my uneven skin tone with enlarged pores, blackheads and acne scars here and there. Nothing has happened for me with use of this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I love the product but why are you charging twice what the website does?

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Not great for POC.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I was extremely excited to use this product as the reviews were great. There was supposed to be NO burning or irritation but the second I put this product on it became unbearable. I thought it burned because it was a new product but after doing lots of research you should've felt no burning. I found that the areas on my face where I felt few to no burning occurring were the following... My nose and chin. The areas where some burning occurred were the following... My forehead and left cheek. And lastly, the areas where lots of burning occurred were the following...My right cheek. As I was inspecting my face I started seeing where the places it burned the most there were pimples and/or scratches. As the bottle reads it says to NOT use on broken skin which in those areas my skin was broken. When I used it yesterday the pain was terrible and I couldn't keep this product on for longer than 1 minute. But this morning when I used it I did small amounts and applied it with my finger. The burning lasted only a few seconds then went away. I keep it on for 5 minutes instead of 10 because I feel as if 10 is a bit accesive. The burning never lasted when I took the product of my face was just red but no further burning. My overall opinion is this seems like it works for many people but for some not so well. It looks like many people have different experiences with this product but mostly they are good so I do recommend this product just not for people with sensitive skin also only keep on for about 5 minutes and apply on places that do not a lot of breakages. As I wish my experience was better I now know that "The ordinary peeling solution" Is not right for my skin but maybe yours. If irritation occurs I suggest you try to understand why and if it continues then discontinue use. I am no dermatologist but I believe I have some good feedback for you. Hope you found this helpful have a nice day and stay safe.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have oily, acne prone skin. This product was hyped up so I gave it a try because I love lots of other products from this brand and it’s so affordable it’s amazing. However, I determined my skin is way too sensitive for this treatment. I attempted it twice to be sure I was using it right and it irritated my skin so much it hurt (bad redness & stinging sensation). I’ve never had that type of reaction with a skincare product. Anyway, maybe I AM using it wrong, I’m not sure, but I’ll stick to my basic face masks and acne creams lol. I know it works for a lot of people, just not for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Did literally nothing for my skin with consistent use. I feel like it's a fake product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I don't see difference on my skin after using this product

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Either this isn't actually The Ordinary Peeling Solution, or it just doesn't live up to the hype. Either way I noticed no difference in my skin

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I used it every 2 week for expected any change in my skin but nothing work.even last time it burn my chin skin and give me so much dry skin

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: But my 14 year old granddaughter loves it! Saw a difference in one day!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I left it on my skin for 6 mins and still it burned my skin on cheeks. And u don not have sensitive skin at all. Stay away.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I don't have a very honest opinion

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Everybody looks this stuff. It made me face very red. It did make my skin look nice in some ways, but I think that's just because it was exfoliated. I could get a similar result from scrubbing my face hard. I didn't see an improvement in my skin or pores over time.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I got barely there peeling and my son got no peeling at all. I ended purchasing the glycolic acid, haven't tried it yet so see it I'll get better results from that. The glycolic acid was strongly recommended tho.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Didn’t break coming in but gave me the biggest break out.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Product is good but whtsup with the price its ridiculous

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Product works okay. I noticed a difference in skin texture but that was about it! Not worth the price on Amazon AT ALL. It's marked up ridiculously high. The price has increased again since I bought it, no way is this tiny bottle worth that much.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I purchased this for a friend and she didn’t read the instructions, and has over used this product, so now some of her skin on her face is discolored and peeling off. Please read the instructions to any products you buy before using them. She may have permanently damaged her face due to not reading the instructions properly.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Oh well it looks like blood and it stings like my skin going to bleed

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I’m not new to chemical peels. I use them occasionally. My skin is oily but still sensitive as I have eczema. I have a lot of very large clogged pores and the appearance of textured skin. I also have uneven skin tone from poor blood circulation (lots of redness) which makes my skin look dull. As for texture/ occasional breakouts from eczema this did absolutely nothing. In terms of brightening my skin tone and giving me better blood circulation, this was a very quick fix! Sad it didn’t do much for large pores and textured skin on my part, but did offer a quicker method for exfoliating/ brightening/ evening my skin tone. So if you’re a little more experienced with chemical peels you might need to try something stronger but if you’re only looking for smaller fixes, this product is great to use if you need a quick fix. Note: it did tingle/ burn within first minute of application but it felt more of an itch for me. But as I mentioned this isn’t my very first chemical peel so it wasn’t the worst I’ve experienced. This is great for those using a chemical peel for the first time :)

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I saw reviews on this a lot of places and decided to try it out, I’ve used it 3 times in 2 weeks and it does make my skin super soft after applying moisturizer after it. But I did not get any burning sensation or see any bennefits other than softer face.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
The pictures I included start immediately after rinsing off the product, the day after the peel, and three days after the peel.

This product worked great, but I haven’t seen many people showing what could happen either. I don’t have sensitive skin and I don’t over exfoliate. I left the peel on for five minutes because it was my first time and it HURT. My skin looked awful the day after the peel and I had to take extra care of my chin area to avoid hyperpigmentation. This product works for sure, BUT BE CAREFUL!!!!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I've only used this once so far. I'll come back and give a better review later. I have very oily skin and lots of sebum and dry patches. All the reviews I read for this product (oily skin) were good so I thought I would try it...I do love the Ordinary! You can leave it on 2-10 min max. I did not feel any tingling while it was on and wore for the full 10 min. While I was rinsing it off with the directed lukewarm water, that's when it stung a tiny bit but not awful. The patch of dry skin around my chin was gone but there was still more texture than I was hoping for. I'm not giving up though, I'm sure it takes more than once to show better results.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
My skin is sensitive and somewhat reactive. It is a product with which you have to be very careful, if I think it can help with the appearance of pores and very important that the skin is well, that is, does not have dryness patches, any kind of irritation and of course do not apply with any active product either before or after at least two days.
I had a small dryness patch and apply the product for 8 minutes, the skin in that area became irritated, I had to apply desonide and/or castor oil.I
do not think I will buy the product again, I will try it on the feet since there the skin is much stronger. I'll go on with my mechanical scrubs.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I had heard great things about this peeling solution. Everyone said it made their skin super soft. I have extremely dry skin that gets rough after a couple days. The first time I tried it, I followed the directions to a T. I washed my face, made sure it was dry, didn't leave it on more then 10 minutes, etc. My skin felt slightly smoother but nothing great. Second time I used it, I exfoliated with a facial scrub and left on for a little more than 10 minutes. Got better results that time but still not as smooth as I expected. I don't know if it gets better the more you use it or if my skin is just too rough and I'm expecting too much from this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Reading the reviews and ingredients and doing my research, I felt that this product would be great. Upon receipt, it was just as described and a good portion of product. I read the directions and used as stated (the smell is pleasant, but the product is quite runny, very watery). I applied it, left it on for 10-15 mins and washed off; there was skin tightening after my face dried (nothing painful nor unpleasant). The tightness gave the assumption that something was happening, however, after using for a month and some weeks, I saw no visible change to my skin. It may be that I need to use the product longer, but I was unimpressed.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
Love the product. I have moderate eczema and was able to use this without any flare ups, which is nearly miraculous. You’ll definitely see results in regard to brightening and smoothness of skin, even after the first usage. That being said, I was a little annoyed at myself for not just getting it from Sephora, considering it was literally twice(and then some) the cost here. $7.95 vs. $16.
The price gauging is why this product is getting three stars. Will not be buying from this particular seller again.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have naturally acne free skin however, I needed a peel for discoloration and to remove dull skin. This wasn’t for me clearly because the first day I applied it..it kinda stung (nothing I couldn’t handle) and when I removed it and put moisturizer I was glowing but I NEVER PEELED! I’ve tried it several times after .. even left it on for 15 minutes and still no peeling. I’m considering using this on a wet face because that may be the only way I’d get a result?? I must have a bad batch or maybe some of these reviews are sponsored.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Honestly I don’t see the hype over this product. It made my skin worse. This product can be dangerous, my friend got chemical burns from it and if you use it and don’t use sunscreen you can ruin your skin. Not to mention it burns when you use it. In my case it made me breakout 2 days after using it. Personally I wouldn’t recommend this and it’s not really worth the money. It leaves your skin looking great!... for two days.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: My skin has some pretty big pores in the TZone and one of this product and it's promoter's claims is that it helps reduce the look of these pores. After using it every other day for a month I have not noticed any difference in my skin's texture or the size of the pores. My skin does feel refreshed and moisturized as heck after and I feel like a total badass warrior maiden painting my face in the blood of my enemies while applying it which is pretty great.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: After reading all the reviews I expected stinging and glowing skin. I got neither sadly. I’ve used AHAs before and have always experienced the stinging. My concern is that I received my package at 8:30pm so that means it was sitting on a UPS truck all day at 150 degrees and I’m not sure how heat affects the product. When I received the package everything is in was extremely hot. I would buy again maybe to make sure that maybe the product was ruined in transit.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
This product is so amazing! One of the best things I have put on my face. Results after the first use! Please follow the directions exactly, and if you have sensitive skin maybe shorten the time.

UPDATE:

Although I still feel like this product is amazing I find that it works the best the first few times it is used and then it seems to lose most efficacy. I don’t know why this is exactly but it doesn’t do much for my skin after, let’s say, 5 times of use.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It works but not as well as I expected. I didn't find that it burned that bad. The first time I used it my skin peeled a little the next day, nothing crazy. After that it didn't peel anymore. It gave my skin a nice glow the day after then it looked a little dry the days following. I felt I had to used a lot of product to counter the effects which made me unhappy.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
My skin:
combination - dries out from products easily, but also gets slightly oily easily too
acne-prone (mostly closed comedones, some blackheads)

I've used this product for a few months now - about once a week. It feels really good to put on, slight sting, and it looks cool too!

However, I'm not sure that I'm really seeing much results. I bought this to combat my closed comedones because of the cell turnover. I might try something that has a higher BHA content.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Unfortunately I can't say much since I only use it once and that's because my skin didn't react well to the product. Well, it turns out that my skin is sensitive and I didn't know it, so it's NOT FOR SENSITIVE SKIN. What I like is the fact that it's a mask, but keep in mind before buying, read all about this product on The Ordinary's website first.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So, I've pretty deep acne scars, and I've recently been looking for ways to eliminate them completely (or as best I could). I came across this product after reading about the benefits of at-home chemical peels. Unfortunately, I'm not sure if this stuff did anything for me. 3 weeks in, and there's little difference. My skin didn't even react to it like others have claimed. Moving on...

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I wish I could say great things but I saw nothing special after first use. Feels much like a moisture mask, while I was expecting a more intense peeling mask. I've used it for 4 days and while it's a nice product; I see no peeling or even brightening effects. I'm going to use it as suggested until the product runs out and update my review.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I felt like it didn't do much. It didn't really peel my skin either and I applied it all over my face and left it on for 10 minutes. It did burn a lot after I put it on but that was expected. Probably not the product for me and would not buy again.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It's very effective at causing you to purge, if you're interested in clearing out your skin quick. However, the level of acidity is no joke and should be handled with extreme care. I have not been able to use acids (AHA, vitamin C serum, etc) as often as I once was without major irritation, and it's been 2 months.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: so love this product so much BUT i should’ve done my research first. The price is way higher on amazon. I got at second bottle at ulta for $7. Also the bottle from ulta looks to be a little different color so i’m not sure if amazon is selling the exact thing. I recommend this product but if you’re trying to save money look elsewhere.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: The packaging on the outside and inside was damaged. The fact that the inner packaging was ripped made me skeptical on the products validity or that it was tampered with. Still went ahead and tried it, it slightly foamed when I applied it but that could be due to user error hopefully? Other than that it felt normal use no over burning.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: My feet turned very red I stopped using it

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Like but don’t love. It doesn’t hold up to other peels I’ve used!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is okay, it burns when applied and I don’t see a huge difference in my skin when used. Overall I think this is too strong for most skin types, I have combination acne prone skin. I won’t be buying again.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I liked this at first. It was good the first few times I used it, but then I don’t think it did anything. I left it on a little longer and felt it was just fine. My skin felt smoother directly after, but the overall changes weren’t there for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I been using it for twice a week and it burns!! But im a picker!! So what did i expect lol.. its ok! I have to do more research on this product. Because my skin doesnt peel or havent seen a difference in texture. Good add on to my skin care.. i like their brand..

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I’ve only been using twice in 2 weeks and I noticed it’s hurting my skin more and more. I woke up and my skin was irritated maybe it’s just not use to acids haha but I still have hopes for this because I really want to get rid of my discoloration 😔

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I’ve used this product for a few months now, it looks cool and does give a bit of a tingle affect. Rather than that I haven’t noticed any changes with my skin. It doesn’t do anything for me, and I won’t be buying this product again

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I was looking forward for it because of all the miracle results shared by everyone but somehow i feel it’s very much hyped. It’s a simple peeling solution, doesn’t work to reduce pores or anything like that. I haven’t even seen any reduction in dark spots also. Not very impressive.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I guess I like this product. However, through my 20's and early 30's I would acquire 70% glycolics via a professional. I do leave this specific product on for 20 to 30 minutes usually. I would suggest you acclimate to this product prior to following suit, especially if you are just becoming familiar with glycolics.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I bought this product after it went viral on Tik Tok. Definitely a product that should be used sparingly, it works well. Might be a little overrated for what it does.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Very good mini peel that did cause a slight discomfort the first time I used it, but fine afterwards. For me, it made my skin baby smooth after rinsing. If I did it at bedtime, though, I wake up with ok skin even after applying a water mask overnight. I would use before going out and definitely slather in the sunscreen.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So far I have used this for three weeks. I only use it once a week and the next day my cheeks are super soft but my T zone is left with open acne and redness. Also it STINGS. Like I have to clench my jaw and fists to distract from the stinging

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I was really hoping to like this product but a few times after using it I just couldn’t take the burning it’s very uncomfortable. Not sure if it’s just my skin or the product is supposed to do that.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I didn't realize the the original price for this product was originally 7$. In Ulta, you can buy at a cheaper price. I wanna say I was scam a bit of money, but the product is legit and I love it. Overall, buy this product on Ulta, not on Amazon.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: if you use this once a week like it says ur fine but if u like me a ur forgetful might not be the product for you because i forgot 2 weeks and it gave me chemical burns

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is good but it's not to be combined with Vit. C or Niacinamide for ppl who are skin of color. It will burn the skin & WILL cause hyperpigmentation !! I had a bad burning experience with this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Great product, but very overpriced... It's barely $7.50 from Sephora. Sucks that I'm paying for Prime delivery and still am charged a shipping fee computed into the sale price. Next time I'm going directly to The Ordinary website and skipping the middle man.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have normal skin I don't use sensitive anything. This product kind of burns. Also if you leave it on longer than recommended you are going to have a pink face for a few hours. Not a repeat buyer after this.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I am a high end makeup artist stylist that needs to know which products work and are the best for myself and my clients. This product is wonderful, which is why my rating here is higher than it should be. Now please trust me here... ONLY!! Order this product from Sephora or the actual Ordinary web site. If you order it from here, you will never be certain your product is the real deal and some amazon sellers double the price for a product that may be real or fake. I’m not bashing all sellers, but I do still recommend not taking any risk with your skin on any skincare lines and potentially wasting money during hard times. I love Amazon for so much, but buy with caution and read all reviews. There are a few on this very product that prove my point.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I've heard a lot about this product through social media so I was very excited to try it out! However, I was shocked when I saw the price! Almost 20 bucks for this little bottle! If you look on Sephora, it's only 7!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So when you first put this mask on, you might think it’s blood because it’s so liquidy and red! Definitely one of the most unique masks I’ve worn, but also I am unsure how to feel about it because of the stinging feeling when you put it on. I only left it on for under 10mins as directed, but it was stinging and rather itchy, even when I washed it off. The second time I used the mask however, I steamed my face beforehand, and it was a lot less uncomfortable especially when washed off, but it still stung. I put moisturizer on immediately after and my face felt soft after. I would recommend steaming your face before using this mask to open your pores. I will try using this more to provide more updates, but for now 3/5.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
Make sure to test this product on a patch of skin.

For me it turned my skin red and literally burned my face. I was in a bit of pain.

Heard great things but proceed with caution.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It's good, but I recommend that you use products prescribed by a specialist... Since there are products that mash the skin and ruin your skin.

ReviewText:
It burns when it's on. I have seen somewhere to use it for half the time on the instructions and I did. Half a minute in, I felt the burning sensation. I thought it would be normal since it's a powerful mask but I developed small bumps and some pimples afterwards.

I could be purging though since it's an acid but I stopped using because I could get the same desired results from other serums.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
