ReviewText: Very good peeling acid. I really like that it has a pink/fushia tint so that you know what areas it has been applied to. For a 30% concentration I found that it was rather mild, it does not itch as much as other acids i have used in the past. I think it is a good option for those with more sensitive skin. But it is strong, i would not recommend leaving it on more than the specified 10minutes! It could dry out skin. So far it has not caused redness or peeling on my face. I apply it to dry clean skin, leave on for 10 MINUTES, and rinse with coldwater. Afterwards I apply some vitamin C serun and a moisturizer. I have noticed some fading of old acne spots over the past 2 weeks, so I am quite happy with this purchase.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have tried almost everything to get rid of my acne and somethings helped a little but man this was a game changer. When I put it on I had fears it was gonna burn because my skin can be sensitive sometimes and I have combination skin part of it being oily and others dry but it wasn’t really painful if anything the same amount of pain as popping a small zit if anything. The only thing I recommend is use a moisturizer after and when you first get it if your skin is sensitive start at 5 mins then go up a min each time till you get to ten min but other than that this stuff is gold!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
So I am ALL ABOUT REVIEWS!! PLEASE READ!
I read these reviews before I purchased this, because I wanted to see results. Unfortunately I forgot to take a before picture, but believe me when I tell you that IT REALLY WORKS. A lot of people said that this was a fake product because it was different from the original one and it didn’t “burn” like the “real” product. I also bought the actual product from the ordinary website to compare. THEY ARE THE EXACT SAME!!!! Sometimes it doesn’t burn and sometimes it does. It really depends on the day or if I popped a pimple prior to putting the solution on. THIS IS A REAL PRODUCT!!! And it works wonders!!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Probably the best chemical exfoliating mask out there. A little goes a long ways. Take heed if you have extra sensitive skin as this stuff can burn a little, which bottle says not to leave on for longer than 10 min and no more than twice a week. Leaves my skin glowing, smooth and cuts down on my breakouts.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I was skeptical of ordering something new, such as a face product, online... However, all the reviews say this is amazing... so after letting it sit in my cart for MONTHS... I finally purchased. I LOVE this! I try to use it every Sunday night, and my skin feels incredible afterwards. I feel like I have a glow, and my skin is beaming the next day. I highly recommend. I actually have two friends who use it now too. I will have to upload a picture because I know I love seeing pictures on reviews! This is a great purchase!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Very good product buy it and stop spending money on another product that doesn't work. Too bad I won't buy it again because there are no stains

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: almost finished my first bottle. I have combination skin, but more on the oily side. I have adult hormone related acne and my cyctic breakouts turn into hyper pigmentation and I find that chemical exfoliates help to brighten the scarring. I have tried other peels that were stronger and my skin is pretty tough but I like the ability to use this a few times a week and not having that feeling of burning during the process. consistency is thick so its not drippy and messy. if you use a fan brush its easy to apply evenly without a mess or wasting product. I find it better to apply a second coat of it about halfway through. I am already placing another order for my 2nd bottle.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: If you have bad acne this is greattt for you. You don’t have to use it too often either for it to work. Now I only have to use it when I start to feel a break out. It goes away once I use this.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
My skin has been looking awful lately. Clogged/large pores, redness, scarring, bumpy complexion. Gross. I've tried everything - washes, masks, oils, topicals. Nothing helped. Very frustrating.

I bought this on a whim figuring I have nothing to lose. After I bought it - I realized there were different strengths, so I was a little nervous about burns. I tried it for the first time last night. Left it on for almost 10 minutes. (It didn't burn at all.) Rinsed and applied vitamin e as a moisturizer and went to bed.

This morning - my skin looks significantly better. It looks much clearer/smoother across my cheeks and nose. Redness and large pores seem to have reduced. I think I've found my skin saver.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Nothing seemed to work on my skin which is both bumpy in spots and has large pores in others. This product is AMAZING. I've been using once to twice a week for about two months and my pores are smaller, the bumps are smaller, and the texture of my skin is smoother (wish I'd taken a before picture so I can show you the difference). I am seriously so happy because I was desperate and was going to drop a large sum on getting a professional chemical peel but this is an expensive yet very effective way to get the same results! It leaves my face red for about 12-24 hours after but this is a small price to pay for such good results!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Makes my skin feel great. I try not to use it actually as much as it recommends because I do other things with my face like hanacure masks and all that so I don't want to totally dry out my skin. But the few times I have used it I really like how my complexion feels and looks. I don't know if its all this product or a combination of things I do but it's still nice. It doesn't feel uncomfortable. I think the derma e mask feels a lot more painful than this lol. It didn't stain my skin or anything. I didn't notice any peeling or redness after.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have very oily skin, milia, and a lot of enlarged pores from messing with my face. I've used this twice now and both times I visibly saw the appearance of my pores decrease, and one of my large milia (this sucker was massive) shrank so much that noone believed it was there the next day when I pointed it out. The product didn't tingle and worked fine for my friend's sensitive dry skin. I really like it so far, it does what it says, contains pure ingredients at higher concentrations than most brands, and is such a fraction of the price. Love this and I plan on looking for more products like it from theordinary.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Ok so I normally do not leave reviews for products but I HAD to for this. If you’re picky about buying products and worried about them not working or breaking you out like I am, then please read this. I am prone to breakouts sometimes, especially during that time of the month. I have some old acne scarring from high school and this has been the only thing that will work for my skin! I use it once a week because I do have very sensitive skin. Overall, I love this product and I highly recommend. Sorry I don’t have pictures!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So i ordered. This couole weeks ago now i wanted to see bow long it would take to see any difference or is it all talk but i couldnt believe this but my skin is so soft smooth makeup looks better on my face looks less bumpy than it did before like i was covering uo a bunch of pimples. Make sure your face is dry and clean when applying but you feel small amount of tingling after a min or two i like it it lets me know its working ! If your thinking should you buy this trust me you wo t regret it!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Solution is easy to use and works well

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: When I put it on for the first time I really didn't know what to expect. Will my face slough off? Will I be left with nothing but a Kruger face? Will it do anything at all? My first time I barely put any on and I left it on for just 4 minutes and WHOA could I feel the difference as soon as it came off. I highly recommend this product. It doesn't come with all of the "fluff" that a lot of beauty products come with (e.g. vegan fed sea algae and caffeinated quinoa sprouts for maximum glow!) and it's reasonably priced. I love it! My only advice is to take it easy the first couple of applications.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I suffer from hormonal acne so I didn't think that anything topical would really work for me. However, I would like to say that I was pleasantly surprised by this product. Everytime I use it (about once a week) the days after, my skin is soft, bright and incredibly moisturized.

I use with the Ordinary hyaluronic acid as a serum afterwards, along with a CeraVe moisturizer and I can say that my skin is the best it's ever been. Also the burn is not too much, compared to some other products I've used as a prescription from a dermatologist. I would definetly buy it again.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This is amazing. I’ve recommended it to a lot of my friends already. I definitely see a noticeable difference, especially when it comes to the wrinkles on my forehead. My skin feels so soft and smooth after using it. I will admit, it isn’t terribly comfortable while you have it on, but it’s bearable. It stings a bit, and almost kind of itches almost like hair bleach might feel on your scalp. I haven’t experienced any issues with over drying, redness etc. I will absolutely buy this again.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: i don't find it to be as strong as it's described. I love it still... I think it's effective and does the job well - and it didn't burn my skin. The price point is also amazing. I went to SEPHORA looking for the product because it's advertised on their site, but one of the associates told me they don't carry it in the store because it's a "low-end" product? What that means? Nonetheless I found it here. I am happy now. I only use it once a week. I imagine for virgin skin this product may be too much for first time use.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product has done WONDERS for my skin! I started breaking out a few months back due to severe stress and anxiety. I started forming some cystic acne in places I had never broke out before! Until recently I discovered this gem, I used this twice a week for about 3 weeks straight and saw results within the first week of use! Disclaimer: do not use on popped zits. It will burn and turn into a scar! Only use on non open areas. Other than that it has drastically helped me and my appearance!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Non-irritating and works so well. Perfect for dark pigmentation and dark spots.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is absolutely amazing. I just used it last night for the 3rd time and I'm absolutely in love. I have issue with closed comedones on my chin and jawline and nothing had seem to help, including other chemical exfoliants. After 3 uses all those little bumps are almost gone! The first 2 times I used it I only left it on for 4 minutes, and the 3rd time I left it on for 5 minutes. I think its really important to slowly work up to the 10 minute duration. I have already ordered 2 other products from The Ordinary website. Their website is about half the price as here, but you have to wait for the items to be delivered.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I saw instant results with this product. My face was visibly smoother and my makeup went on so much better after just one use. I’m really excited to see how my skin looks after a few months of use. My skin tingled a bit at first, when I but the mask on, but after a minute or two of wearing the mask I forgot that it was on and the minutes went by very quickly. I’m 100% sure that I’ll be buying this mask over and over again. Totally love it!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have that type of skin that nothing works with it, proactive, cetaphil, L’Oréal, neutrogena, clinique, I could go on and I still always had black heads and pimples on my forehead/cheek. I saw this from TikTok, used the amt that’s shown in the pic the first few weeks and then really saturated my face with it these past 2 weeks and my skin has never been greater. I use other products like aloe and vitamin e, honey serum, cetaphil moisturizer and almond liquid after and use twice weekly instead of once. This product does not disappoint, I recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have only used this peel 1 time.. it left my cheeks a little red, but that is normal, they say .. After I rinsed the peeling solution off, I dab a little Marula Oil on my face..I would most definitely buy again 🙂

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: LOVE this peel but it’s too expensive on amazon. Was shocked to see it was almost 2/3 the price I paid for the first one I got on here. Highly recommend it if you have skin that is used to acids/want anti-aging/look refreshed. If you don’t, use/start with over the counter acids because if you use this right away for the 10 minutes indicated, you *WILL* get chemical burns and/or scars on your face!!!!!! BEWARE!!!!! I use this on my keratosis pilaris affected areas during the winter months and bikini area 10 days before a Brazilian. It’s an INCREDIBLE product- just be very careful & educate yourself/acclimate your skin to it first!!!!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I love this exfoliator. I'm not going to lie it stings a bit but once you rinse this off your skin feels smooth and looks clearer. I am used to using an AHA so I started with twice a week but went down to once a week because my skin was peeling more than I wanted and was starting to get a bit dry (I have oily combo skin so that should tell you how strong this is). It does exactly what it says it will do and I will continue to buy this every time I run out. It's one of the best chemical exfoliators I have used in a while.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This peeling mask is incredible. Does the job of products that are 4-5x as expensive. It does burn for a second when first applying, try to save exfoliating for either a day or two before applying or the day after applying. Don't apply to broken skin! Strangers were literally complimenting my skin for a week afterwards. It minimized my pores, smoothed out the texture of my skin and made it look luminous. It looks a little bit like blood but thats part of the fun. I have recommended this to everyone I know. I would recommend using this no more than once a week and for no longer than 10 mins.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: omg...this product is soooo good!! I had a lot of second thoughts about this exfoliant. And I did my reading and watched videos on it so I was convinced it worked. I am normally not a 5 star rater but on this I will give it all the way. My skin has never been so glowy and smooth in my life. Yes at first it stings a little but it goes away in a couple of seconds. I use this twice a week and leave it on for 10 minutes after I wash my face and I rinse it off then do my skin care routine as usual.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I loved it, I use it twice a week 10 minutes as it says in the instructions and I'm fascinated. I'll order it again.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It looks a little scary when you put it on, but this is a great light peel for at-home use. I did notice just a little bit of flaking about four days after my first use, but nothing major. That said, it really helps clarify your skin tone. I believe it may even have some effect on minor lines and wrinkles. I've had more intensive peels in the past, and this is a great maintenance version. You will feel some minor tingling when you put it on, but it's definitely not unmanageable. For the price, you really can't beat it. I

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
This is a great home peel that lives up to its word. My face is more dewy after using it and the fine lines (especially on my forehead) have decreased. My skin just overall feels so much better after using this. I do follow up after rinsing it off with a light moisturizer. My skin looks so good, i could go out with next to no make up on (i'd have to put mascara on, but i digress.... )
Great product and you don't need to use a lot per use, so totally worth the money!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I was so skeptical about getting this product because of the reviews. I even thought it was a fake because I felt no tingling. I compared it to YouTube videos to see if the bottle, product or something showed as a fake, I even bought another one straight from their labs to check... turned out it was 100% real. I was relieved!
I'm that 10-20% of the people that don't feel burning or barely any tingling.
I have been using for 2-3 weeks, just 3-4 times and it's a game changer.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I have been struggling for YEARS with blackheads on and around my nose and hormonal acne on my chin! I finally hit my breaking point the my forehead started breaking out too. I haven't had a breakout like this in my entire life! I never have bad skin. I finally broke down and got this products along with a new face wash and it COMPLETELY cleared my blackheads overnight and improved my acne!
Make sure to read the directions and don't put it on any wounds though, it was a bit itchy and may burn a lot if on compromised skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I read several reviews on The Ordinary products and they have excellent reviews. This chemical peel had great reviews on Google and YouTube. I suggest watching a few You Tube videos on how to use to this product before slapping it on your face. My face immediately felt softer after I washed it off. I am only going to use it once a week and back it up with The Ordinary's Hyaluronic Acid for wrinkles and lines around my eyes. I also take a daily dose of Collagen Peptides.

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Honestly, this rules. I have tried some $$$$ peels and this works better than any of them...AND for a fraction of the price. I noticed a difference after the first use and the benefits only get better the longer you continue to use it. This is powerful stuff so I don't use this any more than once a week - that's more than enough. It lightens or eliminates any sunspots or discoloration on your skin and makes your face feel soooooo smooth. After I rinse this off, there is some redness to my skin (temporary) but also a certain clarity. I can't totally explain it, you just have to experience it for yourself. It just works wonders!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I cannot tell you how much I LOVE this stuff! I saw it on a Buzzfeed post and decided to check it out and now it is the cornerstone of my skin care routine. I've tried tons and tons of products for my face and have been disappointed because I never saw any results. I've seen the fine lines on my forehead reduced and my skin tone is much more even. Ive also recently added the Niacinamide from The Ordinary and my skin is just glowing! If you're thinking about trying any of their products, do it!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have the type of skin where as long as I prevent clogs from forming it will stay clear but once I start getting a little clogged pores they will turn into cystic acne. My skin is very tolerant of acids so for me it did not burn and using this a couple times a week makes my skin incredibly soft and seems to dissolve any minor clogs and improve texture. One of the best products I’ve bought in recent memory I recommend it to all my friends but I believe you can get it cheaper on the company’s website

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is the holy grail. I've used it every sunday because you can't use it more than once a week, but my skin is so clear now it's unbelievable. However, I also use the ordinary toner a few times a week and CeraVe flaming cleanser almost every day. While I don't have any tingling sensation or bad reactions, I do not recommend this for sensitive skin as it's a strong product, especially those who haven't used AHA before. I do encourage people to use this in their routine as it's helped my skin immensely!

Product Name: The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution, Advanced Exfoliating Peel for Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I've been using this product for about 2 months and I love it! I've struggled with acne since high school, with severe flare ups happening every once in a while when my face gets used to my regular acne treatment products. This was just what I needed to remove all the extra dead skin cells that had been clogging my pores and causing more breakouts. My face reacts badly to abrasive exfoliators and this mask is the perfect chemical exfoliant for sensitive skin. I have already repurchased it! Highly recommend for those with acne prone skin in need of a good exfoliant!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Love The Ordinary so want to try the Hyaluronic Acid. Ordered it over 3 weeks ago and still waiting. When will it arrive??

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
Quality =bad
Don’t buy this product it’s not good! When you put it in your face

Every face come white it’s not good quality

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Feels sticky and tacky! They dont allow returns/refunds. Going in the garbage!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Item arrived with glass bottle broken and serum all inside the package, unusable.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: The product arrived broken upon arrival.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: BUYER BEWARE!!! This item is not eligible for return! If you get a product that most likely has been tampered with, your money is gone.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
Of course the packaging is nice. It's the product inside that SUCKS. I had a good thing going with other brand but I had heard so much from a few people I thought had their skin care on another level.

Zero hydration, it feels like dish soap. And, if I try to later anything with it.. it balls up, gets gooey.. little globs.

Before I started my previous regimen, I had blackheads in my T-zone. Now, they're back with a vengeance. I gave it 3ish weeks to see if my skin would settle down due to it being a new product for my skin, but I've had it.

Ordinary, you are SUBPAR.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Maybe everyone else on the planet can use Hyaluronic Acid but not me. This is the 2nd Hyaluronic serum I've tried and while it didn't make my face itch like crazy like the first one, this made me look way older? My pores were visible, just the entire skin texture looked worse and aged. My face wasn't smooth anymore and I couldn't figure out why, until I stopped using this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Ugh! The consistency of the product was soapy so I should have known better than to put it on my face let alone keep it on my face overnight. I DO NOT have sensitive skin, AM NOT prone to acne or have any other skin conditions however woke up with a rash on my neck and chest. My face (thank god) was not affected as bad, just a little on my forehead. Anyway point being: if the product you receive has a soapy consistency think twice about putting it on your skin and keep in mind that not everyone received a soapy product—apparently it’s a crap shoot. Good luck!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I will finish the bottle but don't see a difference won't re purchase

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This product didn't help my skin at all. It actually looks dryer. The vendor doesn't allow returns or refunds. I'm disappointed

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: It doesn’t seem to moisturize and sits on top of my skin leaving a gritty film that if you brush off skin seems to roll up in crumbs. At first I thought it wasn’t combining well with other skin care but I finally tried it alone and still got weird texture. I also noticed a drip that dried on outside of bottle was white.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I buy this all of the time and when I opened the last 2 pack I ordered the oil was brown and smelled horrible. Very disappointing!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
I typically use SkinMedica HA5 serum with hyaluronic acid, decided to see if it is really worth the $180 price tag & try something different…

Within the first week I was completely broken out, with a blotchy/rough skin texture?! I do have sensitive/oily skin and knew I was taking a risk with trying a cheap, lower quality product

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
The product is ok it makes your face retain moisture but actually doing anything more is not happening at least for me. Still all the fine lines still in place.
My skin had always been soft and smooth. Aging is where the fine wrinkles come into play.
I believe it's fine as a moisturizing treatment but anything else seems to be placebo effect...
Meaning if you believe it enough you start thinking it's going to.
I will use up it's cheap enough to purchase and it does feel moist.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: So frustrating. I ordered this product once before and it was fine. The second time I ordered it, the item arrived opened, had a different smell, and was discolored. The worst part is that it is not eligible for return or replacement.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I have sensitive skin and this gave me a swollen, red face, scaley skin, and some minor hives. I used it for a week and a half to see if my skin would eventually get used to the product, but after that time period my skin still couldn’t handle this product. If you have sensitive skin, or have had reactions to other serums this might not be for you!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: My daughter used this producted and it made her break out in a hive and her face started to peel. I would not recommend this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This is NOT the same product you would get at Ulta or The Ordinary website. I’ve been using this product for years, and this is the first time I’ve bought it on Amazon, and not only does the serum feel completely different than usually, but it made my face break out and has made my skin extremely dry. This product is a fraud

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
This stuff is NASTY ive been using Hyaluronic acid for years and due to the thins bran new hipe i decided to try it.
It leaves a residue on your skin and after it dries it flakes off. You cant apply your regular moisturizer on top because it starts to flake is sooo nasty and useless. I saw no results what so ever

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I liked the product UNTIL they decided to up the price, A LOT. Sorry Ordinary, your product is no longer worth the price.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Leaves my skin glossy and with a dry sensation- complete opposite of moisturizing. I’ve waited extended periods of time to apply moisturizer after applying the hyaluronic acid as instructed and the moisturizer ends up peeling off because of the hyaluronic acid. I have even used multiple moisturizers to test the product and I end up with the same peeling results. Very poor experience with this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I would not recommend this product. I have heard good reviews of this product when ordered from the company itself, but what I received... I was not impressed with. When you rub in the product it suds up like there is soap in it, and it leaves your face very sticky. I love a good hyaluronic acid serum, but this one just isnt going to cut it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This product may work very well for others, but for me, it caused cystic acne outbreaks. I have fair and sensitive skin, and this product is not my friend. When I initially used the product, I experienced a breakout and attributed it to monthly changes. Yet, as I continued to use the product, the breakouts persisted. I'll be moving on to another hyaluronic acid.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: DO NOT BUY!! I thought it was going to help my skin I put the product on and 2 min later it just looks like dead skin is peeling but it’s just the product when you put it on it just crumbles on your face it does not even do anything!! I would give it a 0

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
1- copy cat product? the label says “made in Canada”, but it was shipped from China.
2- doesn’t feel the same as the one purchased prior to COVID
3- I won’t buy again unless The Original confirms it’s an authentic product
4- It’s a bit thick and sticky. Make up pills when appliover. I just use it at night

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I had purchased this from Sephora first and had no problem with it. When I purchased from Amazon due to Sephora being sold out, I am not sure if it was because of the time of year, but the product dried my skin out completely to the point where my chin was flaking. I stopped using it and my skin has been better since.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I totally regret this purchase. It made my face itch. I do not have sensitive skin, but there's a chance I was allergic to this. Just make sure you don't have any issues with Hyaluronic Acid before you pay for this because you can't return it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: So I was excited for this product. Unfortunately, it's not at all moisturizing - I've now heard from some dermatologists that using HA topically doesn't work; maybe that's the problem,maybe it's something else. Worse though is the fact that it sells at half the price from The Ordinary website. I had figured I would be getting a deal on Amazon.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I don't know if it's expired, but when I put it on after a while I feel a lot of small debris on my face. I don't know if this product isn't original but before I used it and that didn't happen.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
Hello, the product is good, but the dropper is so bad that from the first time I could not close it well, which makes my product not well maintained in the necessary conditions you need.
I wouldn't comrpar it again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: The bottle was opened and ALL the product had spilled out and saturated the box. It was a complete mess. It also damaged the other products box that was packed with it. Very dissatisfied..and Im finding out now that there isnt any kind of return policy..do not recommend

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I haven't used this long enough to evaluate its skin plumping effectiveness, but since it makes any products applied over it go all clumpy (and I allowed it ample time to dry, and did not use more than a couple drops), I find it pretty worthless. It is not a returnable item, so for me it was just a waste of money.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: When it came I opened it and it was broken and all the product was gone and I can't even get a refund do yeah

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I used the ordinary serum for years but this one is definitely a defective batch… it burnt my chin badly for first application itself.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

I didn’t take ut seriously until I open the package and found the glass bottle neck was smashed and all the liquid leaking out. I have to do nothing but throw the smashed glass away, and almost hurt my hand!!! IReally terrible experience.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: My skin was clear before using this product. I’ve been using for a week and I now have deep, hot, painful acne all over my cheeks and chin. Nothing else in my life has changed, so I know it’s this product. Not even seeing a real change in my skin, either.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This product is horrible for sensitive skin. It burned my face and left it peeling for weeks after I even stopped using it. Was cheap but would rather may more money for a better quality product than this one

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Not hydrating at all. In fact, pulled more moisture OUT of my skin. Also "pills" when layering other products. Very disappointed. And does not accept returns. I'm unsatisfied. A waste of money

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This product is supposed to be moisturizing, not dry on my face like a mask and then proceed to leave white flaky patches all over me. Is this even the ordinary???????? I am so disappointed.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: To sum up my experience with this product: I have learned that HA is a high maintenance acid if you have dry skin or live in a dry climate. I originally bought this product because everywhere I went, I heard all about how HA is soooo hydrating and it plumps up your skin, and as a very dry-skinned girl, I was excited for it. Nobody told me it was gonna be this hard to use. The fact of the matter is, HA molecules bind to water molecules in the air which is what brings the "hydrating" effect to your skin. Now this sounds great BUT, if you live in an extremely dry state like me (Arizona), there is not a lot of water molecules in the air for the HA to bind to. Instead, the acid actually pulls water out of your skin to bind to, which has a temporary hydrating effect but ultimately dehydrates the skin more. If you are a dry-skinned girl like me, living in a dry environment, give Hyaluronic Acid a hard pass. Unless you want to be drinking a ton more water everyday and spending every waking minute with your face in a humidifier.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I've tried many Hyaluronic acids and this one was so so. I was not impressed at all. It's not a bad option if you're looking for a cheaper alternative but don't expect much from this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: After using this product for a couple of weeks I noticed my skin seemed even drier. I did some research and found that while hyaluronic acid can be great for a lot of people, if you live in a dry environment it can actually make your skin drier. This is because if it can't draw moisture from the air to work, it will actually start taking it from your skin (google, there are lots of good blog posts on this). So, I had to stop using this and once I did my skin improved. I do wish the company would be clearer about this potential side effect as I really thought I was doing something great for my skin and didn't understand that I could actually end up with even drier skin than before. I recommend testing in a small area for several days before using all over your face.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
Play Video

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This product has a thick gooey consistency. It’s a great price compared to other more expensive products but I don’t like the way it dries on my skin. It doesn’t feel like my skin actually absorbs any of the product but actually just sits on the surface of my skin and dries very sticky. The product pills when you try to put any other product on your face like primer, foundation or moisturizer. I’ve used other HA’s and never had this problem. I’m disappointed because I was excited about the price and all the wonderful reviews. But I will not be purchasing this again. I also purchased the Niacinamide serum and iI have the same issues with it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: So, this product does a good job at minimizing pores. But if you want to have nice skin all day, don’t buy it. It peels off. I’ve tried it without moisturizer on top, with moisturizer on top. I did a face scrub beforehand. And it still peels. You’ll leave the house thinking you look great and then you’ll look in the mirror 30 minutes later and you’ll have white flakes all over your face.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I don’t love it. It doesn’t feel like it’s giving my skin extra moisture at all, it feels heavy on my skin like it can’t breathe even when I only use a little. My face routine has always been a serum, facial oil, then vitamin c moisturizer at night and this serum does not work well with other products. It seems to get grainy under other products. The “Buffet” by this same company, The Ordinary, is 10000000x better in my opinion and I’ll definitely be switching back to that ASAP.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
These products have changed my life!!! I’ve always like skincare, but was to lazy/cheap to truly invest in good skincare products, or have a daily routine. I read about The Original in some social network, and was intrigued. I just recently turned 30, and my face was begging for some care, so I tried them out. I did not regret it... these products gave life to my skin! After a few weeks, I noticed my skin is brighter, full of color, super soft, and clear. Just check out which routine best fits your skincare needs, and you’re set.

This product in particular helped bring my skin back to life. It was looking a bit ashy, and tended to dry. This product helps lock moisture in, and makes you skin look plump and healthy. It’s not overnight, but you can clearly see the results after a few weeks.

I want to give this a 10-star review, but the truth is that this product is 3x more expensive in Amazon than it is at The Original’s website. On the plus side, you’ll get your products much faster... but I would rather wait a couple more days and pay a third of the price.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: It’s a good product, just not what I was hoping for with 2% Hyaluronic Acid. Love the concept of the ingredients. The frosted bottle gives an upscale feel. However, the dropper is less than expected as the product drips out before you can reach your face. I replaced the dropped with one from my previous product snd it was a little better. The product doesn’t drip or run out if my replacement dropper, but it is stringy for sone reason. The product seems to be drying even though it’s 2% HA. Had high hopes, reasonably priced, love the concept, the product just doesn’t perform well for me. The packaging functionality didn’t work well for me as well. HOWEVER, I am impressed that the seller reached out for feedback ‘before’ I wrote a review. Shared same concerns with them. Their response was thank you only. I shared with them that I will be reviewing products and writing about them on my blog and website, and hope my feedback improves their product as I would like it to be as expected. I will watch this company and look for improvements, if any are made I may buy again. Otherwise I’ll pass.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: It smells bad. It Doesn't Look Original

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I am not feeling any difference in my skin after using the product.

ReviewText: So this product is not what I expected so far. I need to give it more time to give a fair review but so far I feel like I can honestly say that I am a little disappointed in the level of moisture I receive with each use. I use the product according to product directions and it doesn’t really leave my face as supple and moisturized as other hyaluronic formulas. I’ll continue to use until empty and if I notice drastic changes I’ll update. The presentation isn’t the best, the dropper often leaks out onto the sides and a lot of product is wasted because the seal between the cap and the dropper itself is not the best.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I'm a huge fan of glossier's supers and this one just didn't cut for me in comparison to super bounce. It doesn't sink into my skin as easily and leaves a sticky film on my skin. I think if you just want to use it at night or not have it be used before you moisturize (it pills!) then it's definitely cheap and other people seem to like it. It's not my favorite though and I wouldn't repurchase it because I like using hyaluronic acid as part of priming my skin for the day.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I loved this serum for the first couple of weeks that I used it. It is very hydrating and seemed like it was really helping my super dry skin. However, after I was using it for a while it started to pill on my skin and flake off. I'm going to use this until I finish the bottle because it still hydrates my skin, but I probably won't repurchase. Maybe this is because of how I stored it or something.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
Had high expectations on this one... probably because it is so popular in social media, I've seen way too many breakouts, my skin still dry, so don't see the miracle effect everyone is talking about.

I recommend EVA products instead, I did see an improvement in my skin:
- Dark spots
- Redness
- Moisture
- Glow

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I guess hyluronic acid is not for me. It made my acne prone skin worse and I also had little red rash like bumps added. Great. I’m never buying this again. However- I do appreciate that the Ordinary has such a break down of active ingredients so you can truly find which one works for you (though it involves a lot of trial and error)

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: It's very hard to explain it, but hyaluronic acid works in a way that attracts humidity from the environment. In this case, it's highly concentrated that makes your skin dry because there is not enough humidity outside. It's not serum and you might want to mix it with other serums as well.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
At first the stickiness can be sort of surprising but it goes away after a minute or so. I can’t really tell if it’s working yet but I’ve only been using it for a week. I’ll have to report back after I use it for a longer period of time but wanted to put my initial thoughts out there.

- Stickiness is kind of annoying and not the most pleasant feeling in the morning.
- Haven’t seen any boost in moisture + plumpness on my face (I’m combination skin, but lean on the dryer side if I don’t moisturize properly)
- Works fine under make-up but I don’t wear a lot
- Works well with TO’s Retinol 2% (I use it at night and this in the morning)

So far I’m very meh?! But I’m going to keep trying.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Good but a bit expensive for the actual price

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
I had heard great things about this serum, so decided to try it out (without realising it is only £5.90 on The Ordinary's website). I use it twice a day after cleansing my face and before moisturizing.

This serum definitely makes the skin look plumper, younger, and healthier. It glides onto the skin easily. However, it can feel sticky and as if it hasn't fully absorbed, and sometimes seems to flake off, especially if worn under make-up. Possibly I was using too much. I must admit, it's a good value for money, but I am going to try other serums in the same price range.

I think I would have been more impressed if it hadn't been hailed as a skincare-Godsend by friends and forums.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I have already used several ordinary products but this hyaluronic acid has failed to convince me, I have not noticed more relaxed or plumped skin, like fresh water.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
This is a really nice serum that gives you a feeling of freshness when waking up and before to go to bed. It doesn't have smell which is good because is less chemicals in it but, perhaps because the hyaluronic acid percentage is around 2%, it's not really effective against age signs. Well I wasn't expecting a miracle but if you hold your hopes on it pass it on.
It's a nice primer before other creams and it maybe does something who knows.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I have rosacea and previously had perioral dermatitis. This formula is really moisturizing, but I wouldn't recommend it to people with sensitive skin. I thought that because it is a simple formulation it wouldn't irritate my skin, but I was wrong. I had to stop using it after 2 days because my PD was coming back.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Gut

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin

ReviewText: Not sure if the this hyaluronic acid is meant to be less runny/more stick than other HA products. It was more like a concentrated serum. I bought different HA from Deciem directly and it's more liquid than a serum. Also not too sure if it did the magic. My skin felt the same.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I know this works for a lot if people but it doesn’t for me. It has made my skin really dry and irritated and if anything makes fine lines appear worse. It is probably just a skin type thing and I have sensitive skin so this maybe why it has affected mine this way but I had to stop using it. If it suits your skin it’s a great price and does feel nice on the skin but just didn’t work for my skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: So this dries quickly and make's my skin feel very dry. Plus you have to be really careful what you put over the top of it otherwise it will 'bobble' or 'pill.' Which is of course hopeless for make-up. No kind of oil based moisturiser will mix with it. Somebody put in their review they had previously used Eucerin's hyaluronic serum, and that this made a good replacement. Don't be fooled- it doesn't!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This works great! The bottle is really small though and i wish there was more, but I haven't ever had a problem with it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I started using this product a few weeks ago and started seeing a little result so I will definitely be purchasing everything else to go with this to get better result. The texture of the product I not much. The ingredients definitely gree with my pores appearance is brighten

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I bought this because I ran out of my usual face lotion, since it had hyal. in it. It seems to be doing pretty well. It’s a small bottle though, and runs out pretty quick. It was light weight and the texture was nice. Absorbed fast.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
Originally I left a review that this product does not absorb - I was using it incorrectly. When you're wrong, you're wrong! My bad.

What I learned: You BARELY need to use any of this product. Potentially just a drop for my entire face. I thought I would need much more because my skin is on the drier side, but I think my smaller pores don't allow this serum to absorb as quickly as I assumed. Since I was using too much, it wasn't absorbing before it began to dry, if that makes sense.
I waited a while to update my review, and am leaving 4 stars because while it is moisturizing, it is not much different from a lotion or light cream for me. Usually serums make a noticeable difference within a month, and I haven't really seen much change. I also still need to apply my usual moisturizer, etc., which I thought wouldn't be necessary each night after using this serum.
I recommend trying it though, because everyone is different. Just remember a little goes a long way, and use something like a quartz roller to apply it (so you know it isn't being absorbed by your fingers - plus, the sanitary stone application vs using my hands seems to keep my skin happier!)

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I’ve been wanting to try The Ordinary’s version of HA & happened to find this at the low price of $9.00 so I grabbed it. This is moisturizing & applies nicely. It’s a thicker serum. I didn’t need very much to cover my face. There is a stickiness present so I can see if too much is applied a problem could exist in the skin regime so heads up. The bottle this comes in is very unique & fancy. The dropper is nice & is dispenses nicely. I’ve been a CeraVe HA user for years. Honestly this is nothing better than CeraVe. I’m happy I purchased it at a low price. I recommend it but this is nothing special & once I’m done with it I’ll revert back to using CeraVe which comes with facial benefits the Oridnary HA doesn’t offer.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I love this product a lot. I’ve been using it for a year. The one thing I don’t like about it is how sticky it is so maybe if that could be changed I think that would be awesome. Other than that it’s so cheap and it works so well on my skin. The ordinary is one of my favorite brands and I love it so so much this serum is my favorite product ever. I recommend for younger skin and people that don’t wanna pay a lot of money for a serum!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: It was nice to use for blemish that would randomly pop up.. # Teen Wolf.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I have eczema, aging skin, and live in harsh winter environment. This product is the best for all my skin issues without inflaming my rosacea. The only problem is i need more of it to hydrate fully and it goes much quicker than other similar products I’ve tried. It would be better if they offered larger sizing but other than that It’s the best I’ve found without breaking the bank!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I use this for my face and it’s amazing makes my face look glowey and I use it after toner but I will say that it has a effect on making your face a little stick feeling almost as someone poured syrup on your face but after moisturizer it goes back to normal

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: When I first tried this, I attempted to return it because it was sticky. They wouldn't let me return it, so I gave it another try. It's actually very hydrating and after I did some research I learned all the benefits and while it hydrates it also removes dead skin, and helps with aging! I use a couple drops with my evening moisturizer, after I use The Ordinary Glycolic Acid Toning Solution. The two work really well together. The serum goes on sticky, but once it dries, it's no longer sticky. I took this picture of my hands to show the difference. On the right, you can see dead skin and dry hands - on the left, you can see the dead skin is gone and looks hydrated and smooth! It's quite cheaper on Sephora, but I purchased it through Amazon because of free/fast shipping with Prime.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This product is great. If you're thinking your skin is magically be a shine of beauty in a day or week, no. No product works like that. Its not a moisturizer. Get out of the shower, dry face, put it on, waite til it dries then put on a reitnol moisturizer such as Olay Luminous/ or Regenergist. Give it a few months. I use it in the am only. I originally bought it for my teenage son for his acne. It lessened his acne. Then he stopped using it. He will learn. Great product for the price and NO PERFUMES.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This product is economically priced (cheapest "luxury" brand), comes nicely packaged and is intensely hydrating. I've been using this as a first step for my skincare and it has helped immensely. My skin is so dry and inflamed 75% of the time, and this has added hydration and "bounce" to my skin. The downside is that it has a very sticky consistency and pills like CRAZY. By the time you're done with moisturizer and makeup, you see whitish residue from pilling on your face and de-pilling is messy. It's fine for your night time routine, but cannot incorporate this during the day because of all the pilling.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This serum works great. Leaves skin feeling hydrated, soft and glowing.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I like it and feels very light which is great for my oily skin. It does have a bit of a sticky texture but not so much and I have not experienced any pilling. I think it works best when mixed with other products instead of applying it by itself. For example, mix it with the Ordinary Buffet or any other serum, or product. I removed one star because the dropper does not function properly. The product drips without me even squeezing the dropper.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Seems comparable to other hyalauronic acid products I have paid much more for. I have only been using this product for a few days, but so far I am very happy with it! I am older (late 50s) so I put this on under my moisturizer to get sufficient moisture results for my skin. I will keep using this product . . .

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: The product itself is great and has awesome reviews, but when I opened my package, the box it came in looked tampered with or opened. The serum didn’t seem like anything was missing, but it was just odd. I’ll probably buy skin care products from the business site from now on.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: My skin loves this, it’s super hydrating and feels great. However, it does tend to “pill” up under makeup, which is why I only give it 4 out of 5. It’s definitely not a good look. I would recommend just using this at night, and skipping it if you plan on wearing makeup later

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: It’s the mini bottle I was expecting the regular 60 ml bottle because of the price, this mini is supposed to cost $6 at Sephora. Just keep it mind don’t let them fool you, at the photo you can see the used one and the mini version that arrived

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: The serum has a sticky, tacky hand feel to it but it does the job. The bottle is twice the size and half the price as Glossier's Super Bounce and I get out of it what I'm looking for. My skin looks great and I can deal with the 15 seconds of tackiness when I use it for this price & overall quality. I don't wear makeup so I can't offer insight on how it wears under makeup.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I want to like this product more but it’s consistency is too thick and sticky for me. I mix it with another more watery serum and it works better. Not my favorite so far but can’t go wrong with hyaluronic acid and b5.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I love the ordinary. This was great. Super refreshing on skin and seems to work well

ReviewText: Didn’t find this to make any difference whatsoever in how my skin looked, but this summer I got a bad sunburn so I slathered this on my face and it made a dramatic difference in my healing time. And while I did peel a little, it was nothing like I expected. I will definitely keep it around for sunburns in the summer.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: For the price it is a really good product. I see less wrinkles in my face, you just need to be consistent and know how to apply it on your face.

ReviewText: I really like this non greasy and refreshing serum, however, it costs less than $7 on other sites, like the one that rhymes with "Snephora". So why on earth would you buy any of the Ordinary products on Amazon? I'm going over to the other site to buy some for my mom, as she likes it, too.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Been using it about a week and have seen a difference in appearance. I notice it most when I'm wearing makeup oddly. My tinted moisturizer goes on much more smoothly and has a more refined finish. My face is also very soft to the touch now. It feels very drying around my mouth, so I avoid that area. Pretty pleased with it so far.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I love to use the Ordinary for my skincare. I have tried several of their products, and the best things I like about them is their affordable prices and quality. This serum is thick but lightweight, and absorbs fairly quickly while leaving a smooth layer on top. I use it every night before bed, and I wake up every morning with my skin feeling super soft, hydrated, and plump. This has been great for combating dry skin in the winter, and to fix my skin barrier after using exfoliating products and other harsher products. Definitely would recommend, it gives you glassy skin that you will love!

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Not greasy but moisturizing. Worth every penny.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Best serum for dry skin no breakout loved it

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
This stuff is really great if you have oily or acne prone skin because chances are (if you do), you're not using an adequate moisturizer (it's so hard to find a decent moisturizer when you have acne prone and/or oily skin!!!). I use moisturizer, but the "moisturizer" I use in the AM isn't a very good moisturizer and mostly works as an SPF... That's where this stuff comes in. It can plump up and moisturize your skin without making you oily, irritating your skin, or breaking you out. I really love it!

I like to mix a couple drops with my B3 serum and apply it FIRST, before anything else. You only need a little or it will pill up. These days, I usually apply moisturizer/spf and a couple drops of The Ordinary Resveratrol 3% + Ferulic Acid 3% Antioxidant 1 fl oz / 30ml afterwards (the resveratrol helps keep my skin clear).

I usually purchase this on DECIEM's site because I buy other products there too but I purchased it here this time because it was the only thing I was ordering and (as usual) DECIEM was "experiencing a high volume of orders" etc and I didn't want to wait a week for it (even when they're not swamped with orders it takes a week).

The price on amazon fluctuates constantly but that day, it was definitely more expensive here on amazon but I had gift credit here and wanted 2 day shipping so it worked out in that case. I think it's $6.95 on DECIEM but when you include shipping (which is over $5 from what i remember) it might not be that much cheaper than amazon (again, the price fluctuates here).

ETA: I started using the O's The Ordinary Buffet 30ml a while ago (love it SO MUCH) and it seems worth mentioning that if you're looking for something with more antioxidants (or "anti-aging" properties) than this 2% hyaluronic acid serum Buffet is worth trying. It's got hyaluronic acid too, but it's also got a bunch of peptides and slightly more moisture (of course this also creates more potential to irritate and clog pores but I don't seem to get any problems from these products because they're so stripped down).

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
I waited until I'd been using this two months before posting, as it takes 6-8 weeks for new skin cells to emerge. I see a definite, significant improvement in fine lines, not only on my face, but on my hands, where I also applied it. Do note:

• It is NOT a moisturizer. Reviewers who complained it left their skin dry were obviously not using hydrating products after applying hyaluronic acid. Unless your skin is very oily, use a moisturizer with any hyaluronic acid product.

• As with any topical skincare product, you should try it on a small patch of skin first to see how you react. Mild tingling is normal. If your skin truly burns, you're sensitive or allergic and should discontinue use.

• Tips for use: apply to skin and gently stroke until the product is absorbed. It may feel tacky at first: that's normal. Keep massaging lightly until the tackiness is gone, about 1 minute. Then apply a moisturizer. And give it time: it takes 6-8 weeks to see results because it takes that long for new skin cells to emerge.

I'm about to order my second bottle. Use it correctly and be patient: it does work.

Product Name: The Ordinary Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5, Multi-Depth Hydration Serum for Plumper, Smoother Skin
