ReviewText: I didnt see any difference on my skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
I bought this to replace my Pixi Glow Tonic, which has is 5% glycolic acid. Thought that the Ordinary would have better ingredients and value. I have oily skin with occasional hormonal acne and whiteheads. I don't consider my skin sensitive, but I try to use simple soothing products to protect my skin barrier.

It stung when I used it for the first time, swiping it on with a cotton pad about 3x a week. Due to the higher level of glycolic acid than I'm used to, I thought that over time I would get used to it, but I started breaking out, getting bigger painful acne and small bumps. Thinking I was just purging, I continued to use it for about 4-5 weeks, but I got more painful acne, and decided it wasn't worth in. When I stopped using it, my skin returned to normal and the painful acne went away.

Because a ton of people like it, I'd say give it a shot. It just didn't work for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I have been using this for about 3 months and I can see the results, it works really well with clearing dark spots but after some time nothing changes, otherwise it’s a good product

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I should have known this would be too strong for my skin. I used the BHA serum once a week and it worked great so I thought my skin could handle this, but once a day is too much for it. My skin got completely rubbed raw and actually burned. I couldn’t put any products on my skin (including cleansers and moisturizers) for two whole weeks while it recovered. If you have sensitive skin, be very cautious with this product or just try a different one.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone

I read that this helped minimize pores and give the skin that nice healthy glow but basically I spent money on something that seems to be more of a gimic. Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: This is not advised for melanated skin. Glycolic acid is a small molecule that penetrates the skin more sharply than e.g. Salicylic. Can result in hyperpigmentation. Not a risk I'm willing to take. Returned. Product arrived fine, no leaks and well packaged.

ReviewText:
I bought this product the same time I bought another ordinary brand product (a toner) and usually using products from the same brand together works so I thought I’d try it out.

I used this product every other day as it suggests but even with every other day I felt like it was super harsh on my skin and causing breakouts. I switched from this product back to another toner that is made with less harsh chemicals and it did better for my skin than this did. I don’t consider myself to have sensitive skin either, but this toner definitely isn’t for everybody.

I also didnt like how it’s not a spray bottle and instead something you have to have a cotton pad or something to wipe with, because I feel like that can cause so much waste.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
I’m embarking on a journey with slightly cheaper skincare (which is not ideal considering my peri-menopausal, ageing and changing skin but the economy in the UK is what it is). Anyway, I bought this some months back as a much cheaper alternative to dermalogica, and a slightly cheaper alternative to pixi vitamin c toner.
I’ve not been disappointed but it’s too astringent on my skin. It shouldn’t be used as a regular twice daily toner. Maybe on younger skin but not on changing, ageing skin. As a 20 something I’d have loved this compared to my Clinique regimen for its value.
I like to know my cleanser has done its job and I have used exfoliates weekly, regularly for years but this alone is too astringent for the winter and for sun exposed skin in my opinion and at my age.
Overuse promoted breakouts and excess oils to be produced. And I was stuck having either well exfoliated and almost glowing skin (over producing oils to repair) with flaky, oily breakouts or dull dry skin.
I’ve still got loads left and try to avoid using it on my face unless I have an oily hormonal breakout I want to dry up.
My teenager suffers from some back acne and occasionally around their shin and mouth and a few days sweeping this over their skin does help to dry things up.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
Go for it you want to treat your acne scars and marks.
Be mindful to use it in the evenings only!!! It's an acid and can cause sensitivity on the skin. During the days, avoid the use and ALWAYS WEAR A SUNSCREEN!!!!
Never use on broken or irritated skin (it adds on irritation).
Can use it daily. However, if sensitivity persists, recommended to use 2 - 3 times a week ( PM ) !!!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
This toner has been a game-changer for both my skin and hair. For my skin, it gently exfoliates, leaving my complexion brighter, smoother, and more even. I’ve noticed fewer blemishes and fine lines. For my scalp, I’ve been using it as a mild exfoliant—helping to reduce buildup and improve texture without irritation.

Start slow if you have sensitive skin, as it can be potent. Overall, an excellent multitasking product that improves both skin and scalp health—just be sure to apply sunscreen for extra protection!

This is my honest review, brands are over rated.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I could hardly believe it when I saw the price on a 7% glycolic, so I was excited to try this. Overall, I rate this product good, not great. I get clogged pores in the crease of my nose and I'm in the middle of a well-coordinated attack on melasma, so glycolic is essential to my routine. This toner did a great job keeping my pores clear and it did provide exfoliation - just not to the extent other brands at a 7% concentration did. If you're looking for some light, surface level skin care or preventative skin care, this is a good product for you. If you are looking to combat deeper skin issues, you might want to kick it up a notch with a higher quality product. I use this toner twice a day without any irritation or peeling, but more sensitive skin might react poorly to so much use.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: A good product to use daily at night time!

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: This toner is actually my first experience with any toner and this summer I had a bad sebum over production break out. I have an oily T mark combination skin type. And I kid you not, the first time I used it. I felt a major difference on my face, I felt less oily and just over all fresh. It may sting a little at first but you barely even notice it. Within a week, along with other skin care products, it helped reduce any future sebum provoked acne breakouts and does a great job at preventing them! Recommend it!

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: Very good. Recommended product 90% if it works slow but it works 👍

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
Amazing! I love it and it's drastically reduced black heads and made my pores smaller. Make sure to slowly work this into you routine starting one-two nights a week. If you have sensitive skin, it might burn. If it's overly painful, stop. Your skin cannot tolerate it. Be aware this is a chemic exfoliant. Only use at night. Follow with sunscreen in the morning ALWAYS.

OTHER THAN THAT, ANOTHER GREAT ORDINARY PRODUCT.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I've been using it for a few weeks and I noticed a glow on my face almost immediately, but that might just be because of the acidity and a simple ACV might have the same effect. In conjunction with the glow, it's also made my skin smoother. The pores have also decreased in size and I have fewer blackheads. Recently though my diet has not been great and I broke out, so don't think this will cover acne that results from poor health

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: Good presentation. I'm just rehearsing it, but it looks good.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: An excellent dupe of the Pixi Glow Tonic. Reduces the appearance of my pores and plumps my skin. Over time the overall appearance of my skin has improved dramatically. Definitely for night use only!! AHAs increase sun sensitivity so definitely wash your face in the morning and use sunscreen or at the very least an SPF foundation (speaking from experience here.) The only thing I don’t like about this product is that it is a little bit drying, but nothing a good moisturizer can’t fix.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: Product is overall great. I've been using it for about a week now and my little bumps have gone away! Use it at night - it'll sting but that's how you know it's working, and only use it once a day. Great product and will 100% buy it again, but I'm going to buy it from The Ordinary website instead. After I ordered it, I found out it was half the price compared to Amazon. Granted, it probably came in half of the time.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
i used to use a 5% glycolic toner and this one does sting a little more when i put it on, but after just a few days, my skin feels so much softer and smoother. my makeup applies and looks so much better. i do not find that it leaves a thick coating like some other reviewers mentioned. i use it at night and then apply a very moisturizing cream before bed.
it does not have a scent. it did make my skin sun-sensitive.

ReviewText: The Ordinary Glycolic toner 7% Solution is little bit too strong for starter like me. It stings for nearly 15 minutes. I can only use it once a week.I wish they make it in lower level , like 4, 5 % for beginners so the skin can acclimate ,from 5% to 20% over the time. Hopefully.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
I have been using Glycolic Acid from The Ordinary brand for a while and have had a mixed experience in my search for more radiant and smoother skin. Here are my pros and cons:

Pros:
1. Skin renewal: Glycolic Acid has been shown to be effective in exfoliating and renewing the skin. With continued use, I have noticed an improvement in my skin texture and a reduction in the appearance of small imperfections and enlarged pores.

2. Ease of use: The solution-like presentation makes the application simple. It's easy to incorporate into my skincare routine, and only a small amount is needed to cover my entire face.

3. Affordable Price: The Ordinary is known for offering high-quality products at affordable prices, and Glycolic Acid is no exception. It's a cheaper option compared to other similar treatments on the market.

Cons:
1. Initial sensitivity: At first, I experienced a slight redness and burning after application. This is common with products that contain glycolic acid, but can be an inconvenience for those with sensitive skin.

2. It can be strong for some: As I increased the frequency of use, I noticed that my skin became more sensitive and, at times, I experienced dryness and peeling. It is important to be careful when adjusting the frequency of use according to individual skin tolerance.

3. Variable results: While I have seen improvements in my skin texture, the results can be variable. Some may notice more drastic changes than others, depending on their skin type and specific needs.

In short, Glycolic Acid from The Ordinary is a skin care product that offers promising results in terms of skin renewal and improved texture. However, it is important to take into account the individual sensitivity of the skin and adjust the use accordingly. If you're willing to experiment and consider potential initial side effects, this product could be a valuable addition to your skincare routine.

ReviewText: I started working out a few months ago and no matter what I did, I was ultra stinky after my elliptical sessions. I read on a website that toners with acid can help a lot--apply it once a week in areas that sweat and you'll be happy with the results since it helps odor control A LOT. I'm happy to report it totally works, and made it so even if I get sweaty, I'm not stinky (unless it's been 2 workouts in a row or something).

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I have huge pores. Forget Uber. Just climb into one of my massive pores and I’ll take you anywhere you need to go. HUGE pores. I’ve tried numerous chemical and physics exfoliants and numerous products to try and minimize my pores but I get stuck with products that don’t work or inflames the surface of my skin which makes my pores look even bigger! Just a little inflammation makes a pore stretch out an look worse. This toner is awesome!! No inflammarion whatsoever and although it seems impossible to notice a difference after 3 days, I absolutely have! I noticed it after I applied my foundation today, my pores looked blurred somehow. No primer used, same product routine as always except for this toner! No irritation or inflammation and my skin feels more hydrated. I use it once a day at night before bed. I’m also experimenting by using this on back of my arms (2x’s per day) instead of glycolic body lotion to see if it helps my KP. Lotions seem to make my problem worse although they are recommended to treat KP. I think this toner may be the answer! My arms are already sooo much softer! So so hopeful!! Highly recommend trying this!

ReviewText: I have noticed large pores on my face, so I tried to do more surface exfoliation. I only do this 2x per week so that I don’t irritate my skin too much with the retinol I also use. I started with one application per week on a small cotton pad, then I went to two times per week spaced out. With other changes I made to my skincare and diet, this is the best my skin has felt and looked since before puberty, and I’m 26. I know more than this product have made that possible, but I do think this one contributes. Just start slow and be patient!

ReviewText: This stuff is AMAZING and the price is unbeatable compared to similar toners. It also feels more gentle on my skin than Pixi Glow Tonic and I only have to use it once a day, which makes the product last long. I've been using it for 3 weeks now and have only used 1/7 of the bottle. It has faded MONTHS worth of my hyperpigmentation in just 1 week. It is by far the fastest product I've used to fade my marks. It is now one of my skincare holy grails and I am a customer for life! I was recently getting new cystic acne almost every day and nothing was working to combate it. It was leaving huge red marks after it went away that seemed neary impossible to fade. Using this in conjuction with Kate Somerville's Anti-bac, my cystic acne has cleared up by 90%. It has given me so much of my confidence and happiness back. If you or a loved one is struggling with hyperpigmentation from old acne, I HIGHLY recommend this product.

ReviewText:
This toner is exactly what I was looking for. I use this as part if my almost 10 step kbeauty routine. I use 3-4x week at night. It was recommended to me not to use every day and especially not 2x day. After using, my skin is softer, smoother, smaller pores, and overall brighter. The tiny little blackhead bumps/ dull skin are gone. This will sting my skin if I use after exfoliating with a Clarisonic, so I don’t do both in the same routine. Any stinging other than with physical exfoliating is fleeting and dissipates after a few seconds. My other toner I use for the rest of the time is Son & Park beauty water.

I’m a big fan of Charlotte Cho/ Soko Glam and would recommend anyone interested to read The Little Book of Skincare. Since transitioning over to kbeauty products and steps, my skin in clearer, brighter, softer, smaller pores, even tone and very hydrated. People comment on my skin looking really good. I am 36 with normal clear skin. Usually I’ll get one or two pimples around my period but since starting this toner, any zits I get are very small. Don’t forget SPF during the day :)

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I bought this after reading that glycolic acid can help remove milia. I had a stubborn milia right next to my tear duct of my left eye for years and thought it wouldn’t go away without surgical intervention. Along with a regimen of deep eye skin moisturizer, rosehip oil, lotion without dimethicone, an exfoliating microdelivery face wash & HUM vitamins for skin, I was able to get the persistent milia off in about a month and a half of consistent use! I was pleasantly surprised and it was worth the try as opposed to getting an expensive medical procedure! Just be extra careful not to get it in your eyes or any sensitive areas. It can sting, so start use gradually maybe every other day or two, then increase amount of nights per week as you see fit.

If you have dull skin, closed comedones, acne, enlarged pores, or fine lines, THIS IS THE PRODUCT FOR YOU! Do not use it without clean skin before, or moisturizing after. Use it at night, or when you won't be in the sun, because it makes your skin more prone to burning. This product is the CHEAPER and more SIMPLIFIED version of Glossier's "Solution" liquid toner. You'll basically have glowing skin after a week of using this chemical exfoliant, and it reduces redness and inflammation of my acne in hours.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I usually purchase on Sephora BUT! It was out of stock.. ran right over to Amazon! Love this brand!! Product. Actually works. Use it for my hyperpigmentation, does the job

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText:
Authentic. Ordered from here because Deciem was backordered. Got it in 2 days vs no idea when I would’ve gotten it direct from website. I figure with the wait + shipping costs this evens out.
This is my first glycolic. It tingles a little after several nights’ use, so I stretch it out to every other night. I can’t say I’ve seen a difference in my skin yet, i bought it for overall texture and pore size/prominence.
Does leave a slight stickiness/film, but I consider it an overnight treatment since it specifically says not to wash it off until morning. I moisturize over it and the film is not noticeable.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I really like this product. I was using it every night then was out in the sun one day and used SPF of 30 and got very sunburned on my face. I do notice a difference on my face. I have cut back to 3 times a week. I use this with other ordinary products and notice a glow on my cheeks. Very inexpensive too.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: Armpits don’t stink all day. It neutralizes the odor and I’ll post later if they lighten up. I use this on my face and neck and it cleans my skin better than face wash alone.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I would have paid $100 for this product. Last month my rosacea was so bad that I looked like a had a permanent sunburn on my face. Even with makeup on I couldn't hide the redness. I've been using this product for almost a month and it has been a miracle for my skin. Without makeup I have a light pink shade only in certain places and with makeup on its completely unnoticeable. To make things better, I had a minor forehead line that has softened as well. I will buying this for a long time.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating Toner, Brightening and Smoothing Daily Toner for More Even-Looking Skin Tone
ReviewText: I've used many toners in the past, but I've never seen one that contains Glycolic Acid; didn't even know something like this existed. My pores have visibly tightened and become much less visible since I've been using this product...after only one week! I've been using this toner with "The Ordinary Peeling Solution 30 ml AHA 30% + BHA 2%," so I'm not quite sure which product is responsible for the "miracle" of my closed pores. But I'm so glad I bought both products!

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Solution, Acne-Fighting Serum for Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: One use of this product caused a huge rash and swelling around my eyes. My skin is used to salicylic products so I thought it was strange. If you look at the review on the product website its a common occurrence. Do not recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Feels watery with a hint of oil. Did nothing positive for complexion , broke me out after two weeks of use.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I purchased this toner immediately when I first saw it. I was sooooooo excited to try it and had very high hopes… the first couple weeks it seemed to be going ok. After that second week things went south fast. All of a sudden I started getting all these little bumps ALL OVER my face. They were literally everywhere. Thousands of them! I NEVER break out!!!! At first I thought maybe I was “purging” so I gave it another 3 weeks. Now I know that was a big mistake. It never got better, it only got worse. So just beware when using it. Some fermented products can actually trigger fungal acne.

I’ll add that this was the ONLY thing in my skincare routine that was different. I have been using the same products for well over a year now, so I am 1000000000000% sure that this toner was the problem. Once I stopped using it the bumps started to disappear (THANK YOU GOD!)

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: When I bought it for the first time and it arrived, the toner was leaking, soaking up to the box, and there was a yellow mass on the lid

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've been using this milky toner for several weeks, and it's become a pleasant addition to my skincare routine. The lightweight, milky texture feels soothing upon application and absorbs quickly without leaving any residue. I've noticed a subtle improvement in my skin's hydration levels, and my complexion appears slightly brighter. However, I haven't observed significant changes in the appearance of dark spots or uneven texture. While it's a gentle option for those with sensitive skin, the results have been modest for me. I appreciate its affordability and the inclusion of beneficial ingredients, but I was hoping for more noticeable improvements.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Very high price for a product, yes good, but not much, not worth the money spent

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Good toner, has a really thin texture and isn't heavy on the skin but is really moisturizing. I agree with the reviews that say it has a yeasty smell but I think this is to be expected given this product is made from yeast. The smell definitely doesn't last and is preferable to artificial fragrance. The moisturizing effect doesn't last all day like you would expect with a cream or barrier which makes this suitable for layering. I wish it came with a pump like some other ordinary products did so that application would be easier but I still would probably get it again

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This is a pretty decent little toner! It's definitely interesting.
Zero scent and leaves zero residue or stickiness. It soaks into the skin quickly!
I will say, the bottle leaves something to be desired because it doesn't dispense as much as I would like.
I have to sit there and shake the bottle a bunch to even get a drop out.
I find that using it with a cotton round is a little easier than my fingers because it is a very watery toner, despite not looking like it would be.
I does leave my skin feeling soft and smooth! Very nice!

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Not bad

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is by far the best facial toner I have used I’m fair skinned and have minor rosacea. This toner leaves my skin hydrated and smooth. This will be my new staple. I’m very impressed.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Who doesn't want old milk on their face? I love the smell of this, I wish they made a cologne. Works great for my skin!

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: My 56 year old face loves this.

ReviewText: I've tried many skin toners over the years but this product works. Ensure you don't have any open areas on your skin because it will sting.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Leaves skin moisturized

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I'll be honest, I've never really understood the need for toner until I tried Ordinary's toner. I have combination skin that lately has been leaning towards more of the oily end of the spectrum. I've also been dealing with some breakouts that I can't get ahead of no matter what I try until I followed up washing with this toner.
After I wash and dry my face, I use a cotton round with this toner and wipe it across my face. While I wouldn't say that it makes my face feel super moisturized, it also doesn't leave it feeling tight and dry either. I also noticed that it does help remove dead skin and other things that are contributing to cloggedpores. I do follow this up with a moisturizer and feel like it helps my skin absorb more than sitting on top of all the gunk that used to get left behind when I was just washing alone.
I am scent sensitive and like that this isn't loaded with perfumes or other scent additives. There is a slight natural milk undertone but it's extremely faint and it's not foul smelling.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I remember I used to always see ads for this and I never really felt drawn to it but then one day I just decided to get it and honestly, I'm very impressed with it. It leaves my skin feeling really soft and moisturized. Honestly, I've been using this pretty much only I haven't really been using moisturizer because I feel like this does a good job with moisturizing my skin and my skin does look a lot better like my skin tone looks even and I honestly haven't really been using anything else just this and then sunscreen and that's it and I just washed my face that's that's all I do so I really like this and I would definitely recommend it. I really wasn't expecting much from this product, but honestly, it's really good. I've been using it for like about a month and I haven't really gone through much of it so I would highly recommend this toner.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I was very excited to receive this toner because many of my favorite skincare products are by The Ordinary. I have super sensitive combination skin: prone to both acne and dryness. This toner is my favorite toner--it's not at all irritating even to sensitive skin, and it does a good job of helping exfoliate and smooth my skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is a nice toner, my facial lady told me to try to switch to more milky cleansers and toners for winter to help with the dryness and irritation. This toner does it all because it's milky and softening but also exfoliating so it helps take off the old skin cells and leave the skin feeling soft and hydrated. Love it just hoping with long term use I don't break out but if that happens I think I'll alternate between my pore cleanser/toner and the milky ones to treat and prevent any pimples but still keep the hydration.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've heard of The Ordinary products and people usually rave about them but I'd never tried them before. After trying this toner, add me to the fan base. I was legitimately shocked that after one use I actually saw a visual difference in my skin. My skin felt clean but not dry and it was simply glowing, shining. I had to touch it because I thought maybe it was still wet, but no, the product had dried and my skin was looking so bright and shiny.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've only been using this for a short time, but so far I really like it. I don't know why even though it says "milky," I didn't expect it to actually look like milk. It absorbs into my skin and doesn't leave behind any residue. As I continue to use it I'll keep an eye out for any reactions and update here if so, but so far it's great!

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: It's been years since I've had nigori...and it's not something I usually think about or have cravings for (despite it's amazingness) but last night, applying this to my face, I had the distinct urge to drink this toner. Ha! It smells EXACTLY like nigori, and...despite not really drinking alcohol in a long time, I'm now reading up on health benefits of fermented rice drink and plan to order some soon. So, in addition to loving the smell - this made my face feel moisturized in an unusual way. My face glistened almost like I'd applied raspberry oil (or any facial oil) to it. Just heavenly!

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This The Ordinary saccharomyces ferment 30% milky toner is really nice. I have very dry skin so a lot of toners feel very drying but this one is very hydrating and soothing. It leaves my skin softer and brighter. It has a somewhat thin consistency but it can still be applied with my hands easily. The toner doesn't have a noticeable scent and it comes in a nice glass bottle.

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have really been enjoying this toner. My skin feels so hydrated and glowy after using and I’m already starting to notice a difference in my skin overall. Easy to use!

Product Name: The Ordinary Saccharomyces Ferment 30% Milky Toner, Exfoliating and Hydrating Toner for Smoother, Brighter Skin, 3.4 Fl Oz

ReviewText: This toner is absolutely amazing, so soothing yet cleans so perfectly! What I really love about it that it cleans my t zone incredibly well, picks up all the yuk that plugs my pores yet it’s not drying, I don’t feel an immediate need to use my moisturizer. Quality as i expected is amazing, works beautifully on my combination skin and just so fantastic, my skin feels and looks amazing, definitely fanatic addition to my skincare routine!

ReviewText: I bought this product because of the reviews in addition to my oily skin with acne, clogged pores, pimples, etc. I have been using it for a short time but I am delighted. This product is excellent for oily skin with those persistent blemishes. I am also delighted that the instructions are easy to follow. Thanks so much to the seller and to Amazon for this wonderful product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Anhydrous Solution, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Blemish-Prone Skin and Uneven Texture
ReviewText:
The product is not suitable for those with oily and mixed skin if they use other products to moisturize the skin because the product is exfoliating and moisturizing at the same time. Normal skin may need additional hydration with the product. As for the best method of use before bedtime, it is the first oil-based product in the daily care routine. The product is distributed to areas of acne and blackheads first and the residue is distributed throughout the skin.

Note: There is another version of the same product, but without any moisture

ReviewText:
I bought it without much hope but I did remove the blackheads from my face. Even those little ones that come to look like hair.
It smells like a guarded one. But do your research and they say it's normal because of the compound. It's not that it's that penetrating either. It's a matter of putting it on and after a few minutes the smell dissipates.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Anhydrous Solution, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Blemish-Prone Skin and Uneven Texture
ReviewText: I have the salicylic acid serum and it is very good for impure skin, especially on the nose and chin, but I had to put on a cream afterwards because it dries my face a lot. Intrigued I bought this anhydrous which is in squalane oil (one of the lightest, most absorbable and non-comedogenic cosmetic oils) and I feel much much better! After the niacinamide serum I apply it and voila, after a while it absorbs without leaving the skin greasy. I agree with those who say that the smell is not the best and, if it can be useful, I added 2 (but really two counted) drops of pure ylang-ylang essential oil and it has completely neutralized the aroma it has, without obviously making it fragrant.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Anhydrous Solution, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Blemish-Prone Skin and Uneven Texture

ReviewText: I've struggled with congested skin for a long time after years of scrubbing I thought I would try something else and this product has made a big difference. Been using it religiously for six weeks I can see results already. Still working on stubborn areas (like my nose) but the rest of my skin is softer and smoother to the touch and looks better too. The solution is mild and hasn't irritated my sensitive skin. I'll keep going with it and hoping my skin will get better and better.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Anhydrous Solution, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Blemish-Prone Skin and Uneven Texture
ReviewText:
I used the product for at least a month to see the results.
If it has an oily texture, however, the cleansing it has done on my skin is very remarkable. The sticks go away from one day to the next if you apply it at night. The texture, the sticks, have diminished a lot.
I have combination skin and it has worked very well for me, it has not left my skin more oily. I only supplement my routine with other products for combination to oily skin.

ReviewText:
I have largely dry acne prone skin and nothing has worked as well for calming it down as this!
Even after a day of using I can see the redness go down and friends have even said my skin looks better.
Only thing to bare in mind is the product is very oily, so if you already have oily skin you may not enjoy this serum. Otherwise I absolutely recommend it!

ReviewText: This product really surprised me. Its exfoliating power is amazing. For almost a year I had a grain of millet on my eyelid. Even though I exfoliated a lot it didn't go away so I had given up. I bought this product after using salicylic serums from various brands (I have a tendency to pimples and blackheads) and after only 5 applications the millet grain is gone. I am very happy. The only flaw is that it's oily, which I don't like. I'll buy it back for sure.

ReviewText: VERY sticky. Seems like a lot of the serums these days have something in them that makes them very sticky. So my hair sticks to my face, my glasses almost stick to my face, and it's just overall an unpleasant feeling.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Argireline has been touted as having a Botox-like effect on muscles under the skin. I happily use other products from the Ordinary and thought I’d give this a try. Their argireline solution is colorless, odorless, and extremely watery. It dries on the skin relatively quickly and leaves no residue. The effect? It makes no difference whatsoever. Except that the package was sealed, if someone had swapped the contents with water, I would not have known the difference. This is a huge disappointment and a waste of money from what I would otherwise consider to be a good brand. I don’t understand where the good reviews are coming from.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Wondering if this product pays for endorsements in blogs, etc. Was excited to try it. It’s watery, requires a lot of application to even “stick” to your skin, has zero smell, and I’ve noticed zero effect on my skin whatsoever. Feels like a waste of money.

ReviewText: This product caused me to have a bad skin reaction, with itchiness and red spots appearing on my face. Additionally, there was no visible seal on the outer packaging or the product itself when I received it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: It seems, over a month and using 2x a day to be lessening my forehead lines and they’re not as prominent. For me, though, the product seems to be causing headaches. Bad headaches. Maybe it’s my forehead’s inability to morph into a Transformers-type forehead with muscle superpowers that gives me horrible tension headaches. I found a thread online of people with similar issues. Maybe. So it’s not worth it to me to feel like this for days. I’ll stay wrinkly.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have eczema and combination skin (oily/dry). I usually just use the same products that are in my comfort zone, but I was influenced by TikTok to try this, as I’m in my late 20s and started noticing slight lines/creases appearing on my skin and thought this would help. I have small red bumps on my skin in the areas where I used this now, and hoping I can get them to go away before I go on a vacation next week. I don’t believe that it is a bad product, but I just have very sensitive skin so it wasn’t for my skin type

Again, I’m not sure if this is the actual argireline solution or not. I should have ordered from, “The Ordinary” directly instead of through a random seller.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I used this twice a day for over two months, along with the same brand's Matrixyl + HA, and saw zero difference with fine lines.

I gave two stars because I liked the "feel" of my skin when using this under moisturizer day & night--and it had no scent--but there's simply no reason to ever purchase these again. There was no visible difference *whatsoever* in wrinkles or fine lines.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I had some forehead lines I wanted to smooth out. After reading about Argireline Serum in a health magazine and reading all the rave reviews I decided to give it a try. It is supposed to target the appearance of dramatic lines. What a surprise when I opened the bottle and discovered the serum was nothing more than a watery, runny liquid. I used it sometimes twice a day for a month and no great transformation--no plumping, no smoothing, no improvement. At this point I am not kidding myself or anyone else for that matter that anything will happen. What a disappointment, especially after all the P.R. about the stuff! But I guess I am not alone in my outcome.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
The Ordinary as a company is a company that does things simply, transparently, and most importantly, how is your health at the forefront. Today, I will be reviewing one of their products, the argireline solution 10%. Someone who has been worrying more more about wrinkles over the years, and wanting to find a slightly quicker fix as opposed to jumping into Botox, I wanted to see what other products I could use on my face to try and gently prevent my face from aging just a little bit, I’m about 30 years old, and while I do look younger than my actual age, time will eventually catch up to me, and I just want to make sure that I am taking as best care of my looks while I still have them somewhat.

For those of you, who don’t know about the solution, the solution is supposed to target the appearances of dynamic facial lines. It’s recommended to apply a few drops on the forehead and around the eyes twice daily before applying heavier treatments. There is a possibility for some people, that your skin could get irritation. I can confirm in my case I did not receive any irritation after patch testing, and actually I felt my skin tightening whenever I’ve been using this product. The effects are not aggressive, and actually it felt quite light on my skin. Almost feels watery like in texture, which is a bit different to the hyralauric acid and the niacinamide. Makes a nice change, as some of the products I tend to put on my face seems to give off a sticky icky feeling.

The bottle is simple in design, which I appreciate as I am quite minimalistic as an individual and often feel guilty about throwing away product bottles that have a fancier design. It’s durable, and recyclable, so for those of you who are all about the eco-friendly culture, this is the bottle to get really. It’s very sturdy, and I’ve not had problems with leakages. The pippet used to grab some of the solution is not too tough to pinch, which I appreciate as my strength is not the best.

The ordinary provides high-quality products for a more affordable price, and I’m happy to say that this is worth the purchase for a wide variety of reasons. The solution its self is quality. The packaging too is also quality.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have been using it for 8 weeks now and have seen a change in my skin, especially around my mouth and eyebrows. I use it alone, then I add Matrixyl serum to this serum for a nice finish before my sunscreen/moisturizer. It's not overnight but well worth the low price if used religiously. I'm 69 and my skin looks great, but it requires a lot of work and consistency, no shortcuts.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: So this is my elixir . It takes about 6 weeks to see the results using twice daily . But once you see it , it hits you big time (I stopped using it for 3 months and I deeply regret it as I'm hideous looking now, it's all fell back down) , it creeps up so you won't see the changes till a few weeks . So it's water based , feels like water and has no scent , this is normal as I know some worry about this , but after application it will turn a tad tacky once it's onto the 3rd drying stage . I use this is on face , neck and decollete , and the back of my hands . Be careful around the eyes , it tightened me up to the point I was starting to look foxy eyed , so I lessened the amount at that section , it also might have been my sweeping motions while applying, who knows . This will last about 6 months for me ,you might differ . But you're gonny love it . And it's cheap as bloody hell . Just watch the temples and eyes , use less on those sections, unless the foxy look is the intended result .

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz

ReviewText: This product used to be a rich yellow tone, and the viscosity was somewhere between squalane and castor oil. It had a mild scent, and while it could be on the greasier side, it helped so much with long lasting moisture retention and healing injuries from picking/barrier damage. However, most recently the product I’ve received has been clear and very thin, almost akin to the amino acids formula. It doesn’t offer the same healing power and application as the original formula, and is easily outshined by squalane. Hoping this is a one off production error and not a permanent shift, otherwise I won’t be ordering rose hip oil (or whatever this substance is) anymore.

ReviewText: So I used this for awhile and had to stop because, for my skin, it ended up breaking me out slightly. I have dry leaning and sensitive skin. The oil was very nice on the skin though. However, after a little while, the squeeze part of the applicator started getting discolored and really soft. It was like it was decaying. I didn’t have this oil for more than a year, but I had to throw it out once the applicator tip started getting gross like that. Oil itself is great though.

ReviewText:

ReviewText: I have problems with my skin and GPT chat recommended it to me I just used it and the feeling was fresh and pleasant on my skin, not oily, very fresh, nourished and pleasant, I loved it was worth the wait I hope it will help me with my skin problems for years I have been thinking about buying but I didn't know which brand was very well recommended I didn't feel my skin burn since I have very sensitive skin Thank you very much 🙏🏻 absolutely recommended 💜💞

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: My sister introduced me to this Ordinary Oil, made from rose hips. It has replaced my usual face cream for everyday use. Just 5 drops, warmed in my palms and rubbed into my face, neck, and finally hands....soft skin for the rest of the day! No fragrance, just pure joy for dry skin! I highly recommend this product!

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Tried a ton of various oils to use as a 1st step prep in my a.m. routine. This stuff is amazing. no real major smell. Definitely no lingering smell or oiliness! Allows my cold tools to glide over my skin then absorbs right in. No shine or major oiliness. Perfect for gua Sha and other facial and neck massage techniques. Def recommend!!!!

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have dark acne scars (but not deep scars), and my friend recommended this to me. I've had this product for maybe 3 or 4 weeks. The reason I purchased this was specifically to reduce appearance of scaring. I have extremely oily skin, that is also extremely dry at the exact same time (flaky). Mosturizures don't work for me. I've tried tons of them. I also have relatively large pores around my nose. This oil has helped in so many ways that I didn't even know it would. My skin FINALLY has a great balance of oily and dry, my frowning wrinkles are significantly less noticable (I'm only 26 and had deep forehead wrinkles). And pores have gotten smaller! This oil DID NOT help as much as I wanted it to with scarring, but it has made a tiny difference! So I will keep using it because maybe after a year all of my scarring will be completely gone. As far as breakouts, I get random giant breakouts at least twice a month. I basically always have at least one giant pimple at all times. This oil has not impacted the amount or severity of my breakouts, but it has not helped my breakouts either. Overall, really loving this product so far.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have not been able to wear makeup for years due to how oily my face has been. Half way through my day my eyes would be burning. Even without makeup I would have to wash my face at least twice during the work day. I saw a You Tube video where she used this product on her oily face. Seems counter productive BUT dry skin over compensates and over produces oil throughout the day. I have been using this product for 5 days at night. I use three drops and pat this onto my clean face at bedtime. I have worn a full face of makeup everyday and today is day 5. On day 5 I have not had any need to wash my face during the day, no eye burning and here I set at the end of the day with a full face of makeup. I have had no breakouts. I am in love with this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I like to keep my beauty regime pretty simple and am always playing around with different plant oil moisturizers. The convenience of the rose hip oil with a dropper is awesome. Its small enough to go on a carry-on flight (I travel a lot for work) and sturdy enough glass bottle that I'm not afraid of it exploding. I have some chronically dry skin, so this oil is great. You really only need a few tiny drops to cover the entire face. Rub it in and let it soak up while you brush your teeth or something. Then its easy to apply primer and makeup or sunscreen or bareface. It doesn't seem to make the skin shiny or oily after the initial few minutes of absorption. I love it and the little bottle lasts a really long time when used appropriately, so that's a bonus too.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have sensitive, dry, getting older skin. I have been using this for 3-4 months now (good for me because I usually have to change what I'm using by now) and really like how this moisturizes my skin without clogging my pores. There is a light earthy scent that is not bad at all. I use this after I wash and spray toner with a barrier balm at night because my skin is so dry and we live in the north with the heat running nonstop. I use this in the morning under my makeup without the barrier balm and my foundation/tinted moisturizer smooths on nicely. The price is great and it lasts because you don't need much, maybe a couple drops per application. I have had absolutely no reaction to this product and would highly recommend.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: My favorite YouTuber recommended using this product while on accutane to help with hydration. I read up on it a good bit for purchasing and knew it was important to look for rose hip oil that is 100% organic and cold-pressed so i knew this was perfect to use. It’s not fragrances so some people don’t like the smell but just using a pea sized amount on my face was all I needed and I never noticed the smell once it was on. After, using this product a while and not seeing results in my skin my dermatologist advice me to discontinue use due to it being to heavy and clogging my pores. I recommend asking a dermatologist before using.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: People are complaining about the color and scent, but if you look up what a excellent quality, cold pressed rose hip oil is supposed to look/smell like, it is: deep golden yellow to reddish with a woodsy, earthy, no rose scent. If it's clear or has no scent, it has been over processed. My order is a golden yellow with the earthy scent. Perfect. It is supposed to be used at night because it is heavier, but my skin has never been clearer or more beautiful. I use it after I use the peel, and use the buffet every morning and the rest of the evenings. Totally not paid for my review, I'm just so excited to find an affordable skin care line that actually works

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Organic Cold-Pressed Rose Hip Seed Oil, Addresses Signs of Aging by Improving the Appearance of Uneven Skin Tone, Supporting Skin Elasticity, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've used it once and have noticed a huge difference. I love the moisture it gives to my skin. I will definitely be buying again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: The ordinary has a reputation of good product and that is the reason why I have decided to give it a try. However, the very first product arrived today but instead of 100ml as stated on this page, the product is actually 30 ml while interestingly, the label sticked on the packaging says 100 ml. I am pretty confused and I hope the customer service can contact me to solve the problem.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Been waiting over 3 weeks for this to arrive. Not good

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText:
Not sure which one of them is the culprit or maybe all. I started using the ordinary product three weeks ago, i ordered moisturizer, hyaluronic acid and the glycolic toner. Ive started to notice after 2 days of use that my face gets dark even though i used it as per instructed only and soooo oily. Then i got pimples which are huge and painful and followed by the blackheads and noticeable pigmentation. I tried only the ordinary line because
I was hearing good things about but its really not for my akin type.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: A seller who sends you a product in this condition is shameful to say the least! It comes to me with the damaged box without a seal... In addition, the cream was so hot that it makes me doubtful about the quality in general... First of all, quality is demonstrated in how it presents a product and how to make it arrive in excellent condition... this is my advice to the seller. I made the return. I obviously don't recommend it to anyone.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: So when I initially wear this moisturiser it feels nice, a little heavy but okay. 30 mins later my face feels really dry, I tried wearing this moisturiser on top of wet skin but still feels dry. Won’t buy again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration

What it didn't do was hydrate my skin and I didn't like how it left my skin feeling like there was a sort of tacky film for quite a while. Going back to La Roche Posay Toleraine Ultra Fluide.

ReviewText: Compared to other HA moisturizers, this one fell short. Very thick and chunky consistency, gel my skin very greasy looking and feeling. Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText:
It just doesn't blend in well like regular commerical creams does, and leaves white streaks behind on my face (takes a while for that to fade, and I have to rub in hands for a bit to help it to sink into skin better).

It has a paste-like consistency until you take time to warm it up in hands. On the positive it doesn't hurt my skin like a lot of commerical face creams do, and does moisturise ok once it blends. It's simply a shame that it doesn't blend in well. I probably won't buy it again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Love the Ordinary brand but this feels very oily and takes all morning to settle in

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Love the consistency (creamy) and the lack of scent but for some reason, my sensitive skin did not like this. Unexpectedly got a rash that I thought was due to a retinol I was using but even once I stopped that, this moisturizer was still irritating my skin. Wherever I put it, I could see and feel my skin burn and puff up. I never follow the "Try this on a small area first to see how you react" but this time I should have! So, sensitive skin havers beware - make sure you try it on a small area first if you've never used it before!

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I purchased this moisturizer because of the reviews. So far, I’m on the fence. The moisturizer does not go on well at first. Also, I’m not able to use the moisturizer with other products like primer or hydraulic acid without it peeling. Disappointed at the moment. Probably won’t buy again. Item shipped fast and packaged well.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I read on skin care websites that this moisturizer was supposed to be for oily skin. It was not. The moisturizer made my face look oily and it made me break out. They were times when I used she butter as a moisturizer instead of the moisturizer and then I will go back to the moisturizer, and the moisturizer made me break out so much! Pretty unhappy with this, so I went back to my yes to cucumber moisturizer and hoping for better results.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: If you're looking for a moisturizer that has no scent and isn't filled with 800 different chemicals this is for you. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because I don't love how thick it is, and also I don't love the container it comes in. I feel like I need to use a lot of this product to actually get the coverage I want because of how thick it is, but I will say there is no sticky feeling afterwards!

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Not a bad product, but when it comes to the light weigth... the cream is too heavy, sometimes I feel like I’m using some kind of sun cream protector. I always use it at night because of that...

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Not all that moisturizing. Its hydrating, but moisturizing it is not. Moisturizers help you both attain and retain and hydrates just help you attain. I have dry skin, so my face needs more help retaining moisture than attaining it. If yours is dehydrated this will work bc it will help you ATTAIN moisture more so than retain it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: The product itself is great. Mid weight moisturizer, no scent. Mine came in an open box and no cap. Is this seller a discounter? Was it returned? I wasn’t aware it wasn’t authentic or brand new.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: This product is okay. It kept my skin feeling moisturized but I felt it was a bit sticky.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: So H.A. is supposed to be applied as a serum/cream and then a moisturizer over the top. This is supposed to be an all in one so you don't have to buy the H.A. and moisturizer separate, but my skin felt really weird. I was super soft and it didn't make me break out but my skin felt drier? Like I had to keep applying this multiple times a day to feel soft and supple. Weird product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Although I like their other skin products and use them regularly. Not a big fan of this moisturiser.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText:
The cream is pleasantly moisturizing for combination - dry skin, the company is serious.
There is no added fragrance (I personally like perfumed cosmetics).
The INCI is of good quality.
Good fact that the package is 100 ml.
The only flaw is that it costs much more on Amazon than other e-commerce sites, and I don't understand why...

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Not enough moisturizing for my taste but that's pretty personal

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: This product really depends on it... sometimes the skin absorbs the cream super and is well hydrated, sometimes I feel I just push the product back and forth on the surface and it doesn't happen much with moisture. In itself, I would recommend the product, but rather for those who do not need much moisture and already have good skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Doesn’t affect much, maybe not for me

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I always have a sensitive combination skin and this one is just so heavy. I feel like it makes my face congested.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I really want to like this bc this feels nice and finishes off not too drying or too moisturizing for me. But unfortunately it clogged my pores after a period of use, so I don't think I'm going to continue using this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I am pretty sure I found this product when seeking a natural moisturiser suitable for sensitive skin and at first I was disappointed with results. At the end of the day all skin is different and what works for some wont work for others. I am a fair skinned red head with sensitive skin, prone to dryness in winter - and I can say for myself this product I started out too harsh. However over time it has become really gentle.. not sure why or how. But my skin feels nice and soft. When I first got product I asked my mum to try it who is dark skinned and oily complexion and she also felt like it "burned" when she applied it. So this is based on two opinions and skin types; it started out as a harsh product but once skin adapted it works very nicely… . Probably wouldn’t buy again though

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText:
It is a good moisturizing face cream, but after a while the skin is a bit “sweaty”.
Given the reviews, I trusted that this would not have happened, instead the usual problem.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I bought this cream blindly because of the good price, quantity and positive reviews: unfortunately, it doesn't work on my skin, it remains pasty and sticky and doesn't absorb well, leaving a shiny effect. I used it for more than 3 months until I finished it but it didn't satisfy me.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: It was neither good nor bad. Didn't feel a change. Used the whole bottle. No downside.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText:
The product feels rich when applying but it doesn't really absorb well. After applying I still feel some tightness on my cheeks and must add another cream there to properly moisturize. Maybe the product works better in the summertime when my skin doesn't get so dry. I will continue to use it combined with another moisturizer for my dry patches but I would not buy this moisturizer again. Even though I like the scent (almost scentless) and packaging.

I am 40+ in age and have combination skin type.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: My face just didn’t absorb this and I found it a pain that way - used it up on the back of my hands and it worked great

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: Bought it three different times, second time was a fake, I didn’t know until I nearly finished it and noticed flakes on my skin and the difference of the bottle after receiving the third order. Careful i read other reviews of receiving fake ordinary bottles that I didn’t believe until now

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText:
i have been using it for 3 months now, and i like and dislike it!
It flows on the skin so not really sure if it gets absorbed or just dry on ir after a while.
I use it morning and evening and it' s easy to wear make up as well but you do have to wait a bit as it stays on your skin a while. I have put 5 stars for the scent because it doesn't smell of anything.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I have tried and loved other products from The Ordinary, so I had high expectations for this one too. However, it is not for me. It's hard to spread and does not leave my skin feeling as moisturised as other products.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText:
Unfortunately for someone suffering with rosacea this cream was too harsh on my sensitive skin. I used it over the top of my medicated azelaic acid gel and it turned my face bright red and burned.
I'm sure on healthier skin this cream would be great though. I did think that the value was good for the size of the tube.

Product Name: The Ordinary Natural Moisturizing Factors + HA, Lightweight Hydrator for Skin Barrier Support & Hydration
ReviewText: I don’t love this stuff. I feel like it just sits on top of your skin. Great size, convenient packaging, price isn’t outrageous. I’m by no means a beauty connoisseur, and in fact own no other moisturizers, but I expected more.

ReviewText:
Play Video
I bought this because all of the other products that I have from this company are amazing, so I thought I’d give this a try. After purchasing, but prior to it arriving, I was told that it’s probably the only bad product this company had ever made, so I was a little disappointed, but I have been using it for 3 weeks now & I love it!! So maybe it just didn’t work for their skin type, I am a bit on the dryer side if that helps, but I think this is a wonderful moisturizer, it’s not thick or heavy feeling, but at the same time it makes my skin feel like it’s been soaked in water or something along those lines because of how hydrated & soft it leaves my skin feeling. I would definitely recommend this product to everyone!!

ReviewText:
I really like that this product is denatured alcohol free meaning that it won’t dehydrate your skin. It does have certyl alcohol and stearyl alcohol in it however these are good for soothing and healing dry skin.
I also really like the ingredient list, the hyaluronic acid help keeps the skin moisturised and the glycerin helps to attract water to the skin.
I really appreciate that it is vegan and oil free.
As I have dry skin that is easily irritated I also lime the fact that it is fragrance free.

Reasonably priced.

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: Fast delivery and product is remarkable!

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: Despite its name, this serum is no ordinary serum. It does wonders for my skin. I have heard many wonderful things about copper peptides and this serum is just as described. I use it as an anti-aging serum to reduce wrinkles. The copper peptide is supposed to help increase skin elasticity and even out skin tone. It also helps with skin hydration and to improve skin thickness. After applying the serum, there is no tacky feeling. The serum readily absorbs into my skin and does not irritate the skin. The serum is quite thin but it definitely packs a punch in hydration. After applying it for a few weeks, my skin texture feels smooth and even. The skin is well hydrated and nourished. I really like this serum!

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText:
I’ve been a big fan of The Ordinary for a long time, but this is my first time trying their copper peptide serum, which is known for its anti-aging properties.

First off, don’t be put off by the blue color of the serum—it’s not visible once applied to the skin. Like all products from this brand, it’s been gentle on my sensitive, mature skin, with no adverse reactions.

The serum is incredibly moisturizing, to the point where there are days I don’t feel the need to follow up with an additional moisturizer. After just a few days of daily use, my skin feels noticeably softer and well-nourished.

One of the standout features is that the serum is completely fragrance-free, which is a huge plus for me.

While the price might seem a bit high for the amount you’re getting, you’re paying for a high-quality, effective product that lasts a long time—since you only need to use a few drops each time. Overall, I think it’s a great investment for healthy, hydrated skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: I am just learning about peptides. To avoid an adverse reaction, I've been using once daily. In about two weeks, there's an improvement in my skin's texture. Application is quick and easy with the dropper, and it leaves a "tacky" feeling to the skin. I follow with moisturizer. The product is safe and effective, and as the clock seems to spin faster as we age, it's a good way to stem the tide. I recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText:
I use The Ordinary’s main HLA/squalene product for so many skin uses and love it… so tried this one based upon my love of the brand.

Can’t speak, yet, to efficacy, but it’s a similar thin, watery (in a good way) serum/liquid.

Makeup still smooths over it well and sure will be a nice addition to my results w my skincare routine!

Will update if any unexpected issues but doubt there will be. This is a great brand at an extremely reasonable price point!

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: This serum is really nice. It has a really pretty blue color that disappears on application. It has no scent and absorbs well. I’ve been using it for about a week and while I don’t notice any visible changes so far, I like how it makes my skin feel. It’s very moisturizing. I’m a fan of The Ordinary and I love that all of their products are cruelty-free and vegan.

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: Love this product (and the price point). My skin can be sensitive sometimes but this gave me no problems at all. I've been using it in the morning before my moisturizer and definitely notice a difference in my skin's texture after a few weeks.

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: I ordered this to try as I use other products from this company. I have been using it on my neck every day for almost a week. Takes just a tiny amount. No irritation. Skin feels a little tighter. I will continue to use. I like how simple the ingredients are by The Ordinary. You are getting just the stuff you need without all the toxic fillers.

ReviewText: This is an awesome serum - leaves my face feeling so moisturized.

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: This serum is a skin savior! It’s lightweight, absorbs quickly, and leaves my skin feeling smoother and more elastic. The copper peptides are a powerhouse ingredient, and I’ve noticed a difference in fine lines. It’s an affordable yet effective option for anti-aging skincare.

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: The Ordinary Copper Peptide Serum works well on my combination sensitive skin. It has a distinctive blue color but is gentle on the skin. It hydrates and nourishes the skin without feeling sticky or greasy. It helps smooth my skin and leaves my pores feeling tighter.

Product Name: The Ordinary Multi-Peptide + Copper Peptides 1%, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Skin Elasticity
ReviewText: This serum has a watery consistency. It comes in a small brown glass bottle with a dropper. The serum doesn't have any scent that I can tell, it absorbs well on the skin and doesn't cause any irritation. It keeps my skin feeling smooth and hydrated. For the price, it's a good serum to use regularly. I can't say much about treating fine lines since I don't have any yet but I'm hoping the serum will help with preventing it in the future.
