I stopped using it after 2 goes.

Product Name: The Ordinary Vitamin C Suspension 23% + HA Spheres 2%, Serum with Pure L-Ascorbic Acid
ReviewText: I’ve tried lots of vitamin c serums and this one is pretty gritty and burns a lot more than other ones I’ve tried. But the way I solved that is just adding moisturizer to it and put those both on my face at the same time, and it’s a lot better! And it leaves a really good healthy shine to the face! I’ve noticed that my complexion is more uniform and I have less dark spots!

Product Name: The Ordinary Vitamin C Suspension 23% + HA Spheres 2%, Serum with Pure L-Ascorbic Acid
ReviewText: I'm struggling on whether to give this 4 or 5 stars because this TRULY works well for dark spot correction. I had a giant breakout of eczema on my legs and used this is conjunction with Alpha Arbutin to make the resulting dark spots fade away. I went from looking like the entirety of my front shins were bruised to faint markings now (that would probably be gone if I consistently treated them again, but I'm lazy). The consistency is quite rough though and I hated that part. There's a new formulation with silicone that melds better. If using this formulation, mix with another product like Hyluronic Acid (I know that's what the HA spheres in this one are, but I'm pretty sure that's what gave it the awful gritty texture; use a serum instead) or another water-based serum with it for smoother application.

Product Name: The Ordinary Vitamin C Suspension 23% + HA Spheres 2%, Serum with Pure L-Ascorbic Acid
ReviewText: This is my first time using vitamin C and I think this one was a little bit too harsh for me. There is a tingling sensation but then it turns to burning. It is very moisturizing though and would be of quality to someone who is used to skincare and have used vitamin C before. I wouldn’t recommend it for first time users of vitamin C.

ReviewText: I have to mix this with my moisturizer....it's like grains of soft sand.

Product Name: The Ordinary Vitamin C Suspension 23% + HA Spheres 2%, Serum with Pure L-Ascorbic Acid
ReviewText:
When I first tried this Vitamin C product, I did not care for it at all. I've had great experiences with all of my other Ordinary products and know all skin is different so figured maybe it was user error or just not for my skin. I tried using it several times in several different ways - by itself without any other facial products, directly after cleansing, after each serum I use, and also at the very end of my routine. I tried 6 or 7 different times with no luck. No matter the experiment, the result was the same; peely on the skin, waxy/greasy feeling, weird gritty texture.. Despite my best efforts, I was just not a fan. I retired it and continued with my routine. A few weeks later, I had an idea to use the same damp facial sponge I use for my serums to apply the vitamin C, instead of my fingers like I had been doing previously... once I used it with a facial sponge, I found a new love for this product! Not sure if the sponge just picks up all the stuff that peels off or what, but it's a game changer, for sure! Now, I use the vitamin C suspension after all my other serums but before my oils and moisturizer. It works great and my skin looks flawless. The retinol serum is wonderful also. I haven't found a product that doesn't work for my sensitive skin, so far, some just take a little more "figuring out" than others.

I'd strongly recommend picking up some facial sponges (amazon has them pretty cheap) and trying this VC Suspension in combination with the retinol and cold pressed rose hip oil, if your skin can handle it. It makes my skin feel and look so dreamy.

Product Name: The Ordinary Vitamin C Suspension 23% + HA Spheres 2%, Serum with Pure L-Ascorbic Acid
ReviewText: I’m writing this off of my husband‘s account. I found this amazing. It is a little granular, but it disappears. I only use barely P size amount. I have pretty sensitive skin. It didn’t burn. My skin felt soft and moisturized the next morning. I’m new to this product so I don’t know the difference as people complain about it, not being the same looking forward to getting my 1% retinol with squalene. I have been using the hyaluronic for about three weeks now and like it very much as well. Looking forward to buying more products.

Product Name: The Ordinary Soothing & Barrier Support Serum, Redness-Reducing & Hydrating Solution for Skin Barrier Recovery
ReviewText: 1/4/2025- I got this product today, and used it this evening. I've been suffering a MAJOR skin barrier issue that resulted in a ton of flaking and acne and in general my face had every issue possible happening. I've had the same routine for several years but something changed I guess. Tonight I washed and toned as usual, then used this serum and sealed it with rose hip oil on my dry patches (because my normal moisturizer hurts my acne spots rn I'm usually bone dry). This product on first use feels very nice. The past few nights of just using rose hip oil on my dry patches left me feeling really tight and this kind of closed the gap. I will update in a week with hopefully great news and pictures 😍

ReviewText: Tengo la piel con tendencia acnéica y me está resultando un gran producto. Antes usaba retinol que me resultaba más irritante. Tiene una buena concentración de retinal para lo que hay en el mercado y el precio es muy competitivo. The Ordinary no suele fallar. Soy fiel a esta marca en muchos de sus productos. Nunca me defraudan. Con respecto a mi piel, la noto y me la notan muy mejorada. Menos brotes, más luminosa y con mejor calidad. Lo recomiendo sin duda.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinal 0.2% Emulsion, High-Strength Retinoid Serum for Advanced Anti-Aging Support, 0.5 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have been using the product for a few months. I have been a retinAL user for approximately 6 months. I have found that it is helpful for skin texture and fine lines. But I noticed my 0.1 retinAL (not regular retinol-which is much less potent) wasn’t giving me the desired effects anymore. So I bumped up to this 0.2 strength. I only use it every other or second day, and it works very well. It doesn’t appear greasy on my skin, and the thickness is not over dense, so it is easy to spread a small drop over a large area. RetinAL is short for retinaldehyde, which is one step away from being converted to regular prescription strength retin-A. I am getting prescription like results without the scorched face side effect as I did from Retin-A in the 1980’s.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: VERY sticky. Seems like a lot of the serums these days have something in them that makes them very sticky. So my hair sticks to my face, my glasses almost stick to my face, and it's just overall an unpleasant feeling.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Argireline has been touted as having a Botox-like effect on muscles under the skin. I happily use other products from the Ordinary and thought I’d give this a try. Their argireline solution is colorless, odorless, and extremely watery. It dries on the skin relatively quickly and leaves no residue. The effect? It makes no difference whatsoever. Except that the package was sealed, if someone had swapped the contents with water, I would not have known the difference. This is a huge disappointment and a waste of money from what I would otherwise consider to be a good brand. I don’t understand where the good reviews are coming from.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Wondering if this product pays for endorsements in blogs, etc. Was excited to try it. It’s watery, requires a lot of application to even “stick” to your skin, has zero smell, and I’ve noticed zero effect on my skin whatsoever. Feels like a waste of money.

ReviewText: It seems, over a month and using 2x a day to be lessening my forehead lines and they’re not as prominent. For me, though, the product seems to be causing headaches. Bad headaches. Maybe it’s my forehead’s inability to morph into a Transformers-type forehead with muscle superpowers that gives me horrible tension headaches. I found a thread online of people with similar issues. Maybe. So it’s not worth it to me to feel like this for days. I’ll stay wrinkly.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have eczema and combination skin (oily/dry). I usually just use the same products that are in my comfort zone, but I was influenced by TikTok to try this, as I’m in my late 20s and started noticing slight lines/creases appearing on my skin and thought this would help. I have small red bumps on my skin in the areas where I used this now, and hoping I can get them to go away before I go on a vacation next week. I don’t believe that it is a bad product, but I just have very sensitive skin so it wasn’t for my skin type

ReviewText:
I used this twice a day for over two months, along with the same brand's Matrixyl + HA, and saw zero difference with fine lines.

I gave two stars because I liked the "feel" of my skin when using this under moisturizer day & night--and it had no scent--but there's simply no reason to ever purchase these again. There was no visible difference *whatsoever* in wrinkles or fine lines.

ReviewText: I had some forehead lines I wanted to smooth out. After reading about Argireline Serum in a health magazine and reading all the rave reviews I decided to give it a try. It is supposed to target the appearance of dramatic lines. What a surprise when I opened the bottle and discovered the serum was nothing more than a watery, runny liquid. I used it sometimes twice a day for a month and no great transformation--no plumping, no smoothing, no improvement. At this point I am not kidding myself or anyone else for that matter that anything will happen. What a disappointment, especially after all the P.R. about the stuff! But I guess I am not alone in my outcome.

ReviewText: As a 30-year-old Asian female, I was curious to try The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10% after hearing it described as “Botox in a bottle” by dermatologists. Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is a product that I will never go without. It is a very thin serum that does not have a smell. It comes with a dropper so that you can drop the serum onto areas of your skin without having to use pumps which are known to become clogged or broken. The serum glides over your skin like silk. After a minute, you can see visible results. The facial skin looks tighter and brighter. It reduces the look of tired, puffy skin. It’s like a mini facelift in a bottle. And it is definitely worth the price.

ReviewText: The combination of these two products has made a huge difference in my skin. Im 60 and my skin was just dull and loose and old looking. In a few days I noticed a dramatic change. My skin was more supple/ plump! My daughter noticed the difference and ordered some for herself. Im sold!

ReviewText: I love that the consistency is not as viscous as other ordinary products. They tend to gum up on me under my tinted sunscreen or foundation, but this one is thin and absorbs quickly. I CAN still move my forehead etc however, my 11's do look significantly reduced with twice daily use. It could be placebo effect, but either way I definitely see improvement! My only complaint is that in using this I've noticed more congestion in my forehead and between my brows. No massive pimples or anything just a few clogged pores and nothing bad enough to stop using this solution. I'd recommend to anyone not wanting botox but desiring a similar more subtle effect.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
The Ordinary as a company is a company that does things simply, transparently, and most importantly, how is your health at the forefront. Today, I will be reviewing one of their products, the argireline solution 10%. Someone who has been worrying more more about wrinkles over the years, and wanting to find a slightly quicker fix as opposed to jumping into Botox, I wanted to see what other products I could use on my face to try and gently prevent my face from aging just a little bit, I’m about 30 years old, and while I do look younger than my actual age, time will eventually catch up to me, and I just want to make sure that I am taking as best care of my looks while I still have them somewhat.

For those of you, who don’t know about the solution, the solution is supposed to target the appearances of dynamic facial lines. It’s recommended to apply a few drops on the forehead and around the eyes twice daily before applying heavier treatments. There is a possibility for some people, that your skin could get irritation. I can confirm in my case I did not receive any irritation after patch testing, and actually I felt my skin tightening whenever I’ve been using this product. The effects are not aggressive, and actually it felt quite light on my skin. Almost feels watery like in texture, which is a bit different to the hyralauric acid and the niacinamide. Makes a nice change, as some of the products I tend to put on my face seems to give off a sticky icky feeling.

The bottle is simple in design, which I appreciate as I am quite minimalistic as an individual and often feel guilty about throwing away product bottles that have a fancier design. It’s durable, and recyclable, so for those of you who are all about the eco-friendly culture, this is the bottle to get really. It’s very sturdy, and I’ve not had problems with leakages. The pippet used to grab some of the solution is not too tough to pinch, which I appreciate as my strength is not the best.

The ordinary provides high-quality products for a more affordable price, and I’m happy to say that this is worth the purchase for a wide variety of reasons. The solution its self is quality. The packaging too is also quality.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have been using it for 8 weeks now and have seen a change in my skin, especially around my mouth and eyebrows. I use it alone, then I add Matrixyl serum to this serum for a nice finish before my sunscreen/moisturizer. It's not overnight but well worth the low price if used religiously. I'm 69 and my skin looks great, but it requires a lot of work and consistency, no shortcuts.

Product Name: The Ordinary Argireline Solution 10%, Serum Good for Reducing the Appearance of Fine Lines, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: So this is my elixir . It takes about 6 weeks to see the results using twice daily . But once you see it , it hits you big time (I stopped using it for 3 months and I deeply regret it as I'm hideous looking now, it's all fell back down) , it creeps up so you won't see the changes till a few weeks . So it's water based , feels like water and has no scent , this is normal as I know some worry about this , but after application it will turn a tad tacky once it's onto the 3rd drying stage . I use this is on face , neck and decollete , and the back of my hands . Be careful around the eyes , it tightened me up to the point I was starting to look foxy eyed , so I lessened the amount at that section , it also might have been my sweeping motions while applying, who knows . This will last about 6 months for me ,you might differ . But you're gonny love it . And it's cheap as bloody hell . Just watch the temples and eyes , use less on those sections, unless the foxy look is the intended result .

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I'm not convinced this is authentic. Compared to my first bottle (from the Ordinary's website) this oil absorbs into the skin immediately. Anyone that's used oil on their skin knows that it tends to sit on the surface for a while as it absorbs. The authentic Squalane did wonders for my skin and made my matte foundation sit beautifully. With this, my skin didn't look like it had been moisturized at all and had dry patches. I ordered from Amazon vs the Ordinary site directly because the Ordinary was running 10 days behind on fulfilling orders and I would run out before then. I will not make that mistake again.

ReviewText: Absolute garbage! Doesn't absorb into my skin at all! Tried morning and evening application times and had to wash my face after because of the greasy mess. Annoyed by the amount of time and effort I put in tryi g to love this product as much as everyone else does but nope. Complete waste of money, time, pillowcases and counterspace!

ReviewText:
Excellent. For the first time in my life I am moisturizing consistently without breakouts. For the first week, I used three drops because I scoffed at the idea that I could moisturize my whole face with two drops of oil. I think my skin was a little dehydrated so three drops was great until it wasn't, and I've since cut back to two drops. TWO DROPS. Great stuff, this is the best my skin has looked in years. Wouldn't buy it here, unless you're desperate. You can get it through Deciem's website for like seven bucks a bottle. They were out of stock when I ordered, so I will plan ahead when I need more.
update: I unfortunately had to stop using this product because it broke me out. Really bummed, because my skin looked great initially after using it. If you can tolerate oils, I highly recommend, though!

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Had big expectations for this product, having read glowing online reviews here and elsewhere. I have used Squalane for a week and unfortunately discovered that it has been the cause of new breakouts of my face. Further research led me to the discovery that certain types of skin are simply more sensitive to the ingredient. I would recommend patch testing with this.

I applied it at night, and I can vouch for its moisturizing power, as my skin was fairly hydrated the following morning. However, I personally did not like the consistency of this. It does not absorb completely, rather it has a tendency to sit on the skin, as noted by other reviewers. I have repurposed it for lip hydration but will altogether avoid application on the rest of my face. All in all, I would not repurchase.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz

I found with this product that less is more as it can easily leave ur skin very oily

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I've been wanting to try 100% squalane, and was happy to find The Ordinary's offering on Amazon. It would cost less to order from The Ordinary, but Amazon (prime) is move convenient and I feel sure I got it faster. The Ordinary is no longer carried by Sephora, so that makes it especially nice to see it on Amazon.

The Ordinary, even at Amazon Prime's price, is a way better value than some of other brands out there. One advantage of some of the more expensive brands, though, is that they disclose the source of the squalane, which is usually sugar cane or olives. I guess it shouldn't matter (as long as it's not from shark livers, whole other story there), but I would like to know.

Ok, about how the product performs: I wanted to add an oil to my skincare routine, to see if it would help with issues of aging. Normally, I use light gel-cream moisturizers and was thinking that, while I'm getting enough hydration, I may not be getting enough moisture. And squalane has a reputation for being a non-greasy oil, and it is often recommended for aging skin, as our skin supposedly make less and less of it as we age. So I tried it, pressing it into clean skin. It feels really nice, but is still a little too oily/heavy for me (it does seem to continue to absorb during the day, but not as much as I'd like). I am now experimenting with blending a little of it into some different serums and moisturizers.

Here is another way I am using the squlane oil, which is as a "carrier oil" : I have seborrhea (yuck!) in my eyebrows and am trying tea tree oil for that. But alone, tea tree oil is too strong and really needs to be mixed with a carrier oil. I had been using olive oil, which is very greasy. Now I'm mixing a about ten drops squalane with ten of tee tree oil (still pretty strong, you may wish to dilute the tea tree oil more than that). I like this!

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I am new to the whole good skin care routine. I have really dry skin and have been having a hard time wearing foundation because of my dry skin. I was told to try an oil. Went to Sephora and they gave me a facial and one product was Squalane oil. I LOVED it. Problem was the bottle was $60. Did some research online and found that this was a good dupe. Love the product. Soaks in my skin well, doesn't smell bad, and doesn't leave it uncomfortably greasy. Also for the price it's worth a good try!

However, i'll give it 4/5 just because I personally, need an oil that's a tad heavier. Won't be reordering this specific oil, but I Do like the product.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I kept hearing about this brand everywhere but I was cautious of the reviews because I have sensitive, oily skin with eczema but I love this product!

One thing I noticed about my skin is that since I started to use it not only is it baby butt soft but it has helped ease the redness in my face. In my first pic although I have makeup there is a lot of redness on my cheeks from leftover acne marks to inflammation (allergies) but taken today the second picture shows my skin with a more even texture/color.

I bought this to help moisturize my skin because I always slumped out on face lotion or sunscreen due to it feeling greasy on my face. The oil when applied to my greasy kitchen face feels a liiiiiittle bit heavy but it soaks in after you give it some time. I read online you are supposed to add 2-3 drops on your face. Well I have a fat face because that wasn’t enough so I take 4-5 drops in my hands and rub it in my face. The instructions also say to pat it on so it goes deep in your pores but I gently rubbed my face. I know rubbing your face causes wrinkles but rubbing it in for a good 30 secs really helped the oil soak into my skin. I use a mat tidying moisturizer after this and it helps my oily face soak up all the good stuff within ten mins. (Moisturizer is Origins Matte Moisturizer with Willowherb). It could be my combo of the oil and the lotion that makes my face absorb it all but I highly recommend both because I did not react at all to either.

Now usually my eczema reacts nasty to some skincare products but not this oil. The oil does not smell either. Before this I tried the Radha rosehip oil and that smells like moldy crayons but I cannot smell anything with this!

TIP: buy from the actual Deciem site or Sephora because it’s cheaper than Amazon. I paid 14$ for this because I desperately needed something to Moisturize my face and I have no regrets paying the extra money.

I do wish this company would come out with a 2-4 oz size of this bottle because I would definitely hand them more of my money. This product will make your skin softer and did not cause me to breakout (allergies or pimples). If you have oily skin I would really recommend a matte lotion on top of it or mixing some drops with your lotion in your hand or a cup then applying it. I have no patience and I do the oil first wait a minute for my face to take some of it in then apply my eye cream/lotion on top of that.

Good luck!

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The Ordinary has the best skin care line. Priced for the average person with great results

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’m always super worried about ordering skincare online but sometimes it’s just so much more convenient. The product was well packaged and I had no problems with the integrity of the product. This oil is amazing. I have tanned, dry, sensitive acne prone skin and this product does well to give me that surface hydration without being oily nor disturbing the makeup I layer on top. I’ve replaced this oil multiple times with other products and I always go back to this product. It takes a month of consistent use to see the effects :)

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I did not realize all of the great benefits of this oil, whatsoever, before I bought it. Mostly, I was looking for a reliable lip moisturizer that did not have anything extra in it like most products do. This also had strong recommendations for adding it to your skin care regimen as a facial oil so I thought those sound like pretty good reasons to try this stuff.... Well....I do have to admit I have also been using it on my God-awful sunburn I acquired several days ago. I should be peeling by now. I do not think that will be happening, and squalane oil was a major factor.

So not only does it keep your lips properly hydrated and helps restore the sebum of your skin and produces a lovely "facial glow"...it is very absorbent and will not clog your pores AT ALL. A very light but hardworking oil. You can also use it on your hair, which I have yet to try but I have no doubts thus far.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is my go to squalane oil. I’ve tried other brands but for some reason my skin loves this one (and so does my wallet)! Definitely recommend for extra hydration and that natural supple look!

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT THE ORDINARY'S SQUALANE OIL. I had ordered the trial sizes of the Biossance oil and I LOVED it, but it doesn't last very long considering I actually use the squalane oil for my hair and not my skin. The Biossance oil is fifty or sixty dollars and as a college student there is absolutely no way I can afford that without either saving up or living off of ramen for a month....or six. Biossance derives their squalane from cane sugar plants I believe, so I wanted to find a squalane oil brand that did the same, which was FAR harder than you would believe, since most companies get their squalane from olives (which kind of just seems like...milder olive oil to me). Well the ordinary doesn't have where their oil is derived from BUT they DO have a system for emailing them questions, so I asked, and lo and behold, they derive their squalane from cane sugar as well, so i figured it was a safe (and cheap) bet to order this in place of the Biossance oil. I have VERY curly, dry, split end prone hair and this oil helps keep it not only moisturized, but also helps keep my curls defined and looking nice instead of insanely unruly and frizzy for a fraction of the price that the Biossance oil does, and the point of this very long winded explanation is this; It is JUST as good (perhaps even better when factoring cost) as the Biossance 100% Squalane and I will forever buy this instead.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I just started using this product and like it. Very happy with customer service. Package arrived with loose lid and every bit spilled in the packaging. I reported it and a replacement was on my door step the next day.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I researched oils to use for seborrheic dermatitis. Carrier oils are needed to prevent Malassezia, a main source in seborrheic dermatitis. This oil is a carrier oil, I use. There are other carrier oils. If you are wanting to learn more about carrier oils, doctor google will help you. I have been to 2 dermatologists, Did NOT help me. I had to find information and answers on google and my pharmacist. I also take OTC Lysine.
Lysine is a tissue repairer. I take 1 a day. This is a great help for cold sores, etc
I hope this gives you hope and not feel alone with eczema. Good Day to all

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I'm almost superstitious about writing this review because I don't want to jinx my results. I've been using this oil at night 4-5 nights per week on top of another Vitamin C based serum on my face, neck, and chest for a couple of weeks (I use a retinal based product on the other nights). I generally have very dry, easily irritated skin, but I still normally have a couple of pimples before/during my period, especially if I'm also stressed - except for recently. I had my first break-out free cycle literally ever using this product. It feels a bit oily going on, then slightly sticky, but then it sinks in completely. Plus, it's unscented (as opposed to fragrance-free). One dropper is more than enough for my entire face, neck, and chest, with enough left to rub into my hands (which are also much more comfortable), although I have noticed that, after a couple of weeks, I seem to be needing to use less and less. I'm a big fan.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I can't express enough gratitude about this product. It's oil but doesn't leave my face oily. I apply it evening and next morning my face its not dry . I feel like I don't need to put any moisturizer. Skin looks stronger and healthier. I think I found the keeper.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I use this at night as the last step in my skincare routine. Feels great, no odor, and not greasy. My skin loves it.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Light serum in a dark bottle. Cold pressed and not animal derived, it can be marine derived, or olive oil, according to the company. I was a cosmetic formulator by trade and The Ordinary seems to be incredibly minimal, but dead on as to particular skin conditions. I have mature skin and acne, yuck. I am fifty three and no acne would be nice. I've tried other oils, but honestly they made me look dewy and drippy. Squalane is not like that. It's a little runny, be careful when you drop some, you don't need to squeeze the end, it will run into your hand, apply with clean fingers and allow to stay, or rinse with warm water, gently, then tone, non-alcohol, no drying, and sunscreen, or your nighttime routine. I love how this sinks into my skin, is not greasy and seems to be all in there before I rinse and use toner. I love it.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’ve been using this for years and my skin absolutely loves it… It’s very moisturizing, and the moisture stays without it being oily

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’m almost 30 years old now and this is the only product I’ve ever used that has started clearing up my keratosis pilaris that hasn’t also backfired later down the line and caused some sort of breakout. Absolutely miraculous stuff. My skin is slowly but surely clearing up nicely. As an added bonus, it seems to clear up redness & irritation much faster than normal.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have “normal” skin - not too oily or dry. I’d say I lean towards the dry side. This oil is perfect. It’s not thick or feels sticky on my face after using. I add a few drops to some moisturizer on my palm and rub into my face then use a jade roller to massage in. It soaks up easily and spreads well. It feels so good and leaves you with a sweet glow in the morning or night! Highly recommend. No smell or color - just simple!

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I revamped my skin care routine in March and bought this squalane to supplement my moisturizer. It’s very lightweight and absorbs quickly, and I haven’t had any issues with clogged pores or lingering oiliness. It does not play well with the Ordinary’s Hyaluronic Acid (2% + B5) or Niacinamide (10% + Zinc 1%) - layering them on top of one another - as directed by The Ordinary - often causes crazy pilling. I don’t think my skin is a huge fan of the Hyaluronic Acid or the Niacinamide anyways so I’ve eliminated them from my routine and haven’t had any issues with pilling since.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This product is gonna do what it says it will... are you gonna look 25 ? Well that depends, are you 25? Were you rode hard and put away wet? If so, then maybe you got a lot more magic to do but this is a GREAT start. This review is for the company. Stand up company, wonderful customer service (especially James-my Rep) who will deal with any issue in a timely and effective manner. This product( and this seller ) are stellar.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Once you try squalane you’ll never go back. This is my 3rd time purchasing this product. The value and quality are unbeatable and it’s ethically sourced. The last time I ran out, I tried to be lazy and substitute for another face oil. I tried rosehip, olive, and coconut, and nothing will hydrate my skin as well as squalane. It is the most gentle product I’ve ever used and I have highly sensitive acne prone skin with rosacea. Try it. You’ll love it.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I love this facial oil. It absorbs quickly and I noticed an immediate improvement in my skin.

ReviewText: I love the way this feels on my skin.

ReviewText: Very moisturizing and lightweight, and it absorbs into my skin. It doesn't just lay on the outer surface. I like that it isn't greasy and seems to help my skin tone appear healthier and more youthful at 56. Also, you don't need much. I've tried a lot of serums and this one will be my go to serum. Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz

ReviewText:

No breakouts, peeling skin was healed in 3 weeks, and my face is less oily than before. I wouldn’t wear it under makeup, but at night a few drops are pretty satisfying. I’ve been using instead of my moisturizer most nights.

ReviewText: So I recently have had trouble with acne. My previous moisturizer was too thick and was clogging my pores. Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is the greatest oil for the money you buy! I’ve been shelling out 3 times as much on another brand, and this one is so lightweight and non greasy. Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is one of the only oil products I have used that doesn’t flare my dermatitis. Supposedly it’s because it has a different number of carbon and hydrogen molecules that malessia fungus can’t digest. The fungus and digestion byproducts are what cause the autoimmune reactions for dermatitis so this stops the cycle.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Plant-Derived Squalane, for Skin and Hair, Lightweight Hydration, and Moisture Barrier Support, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have been struggling with fungal acne and the driest skin ever--I tried SO MANY oils and moisturizers and nothing works as well as this. I really had high hopes for this product. I used it diligently, 1-2x daily. I used this along with a natural blemish face wash to make sure my skin was clean before application. I also used foundation with sunscreen (SPF 15) to protect my skin during the day.

My outfit in the green is 1 month after daily use. Not only is there barely any difference, it also did not prevent my new scars from getting darker.

I would not recommend this for very dark acne scars.

ReviewText: I think it has helped with my hormonal/stress acne on my chin (which I've had for years, I'm in my 30s). I've been using it for about 3 months and I'm breaking out less, and the old red marks are improving. I also have been using Dema-E Hyaluronic ultra hydrating serum and occasionally the Derma-E blemish control treatment as well as prescription retinol on occasion and overall my skin has calmed down. It's cyclical so we'll see if the improvement holds, but overall I'd say it's worth a try, considering Azelaic acid has been recommended by some dermatologists for this sort of thing.

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: Before getting azelaic acid RX I wanted to test because my skin is EXTREMELY sensitive and reactive to just about everything nowadays. This is pretty great. Definitely soothing my skin more than just about anything else in recent years. I generally avoid silicones in skin care but harder in makeup, but this is not bothering me. Can't speak to long term exfoliating or pigment or clearing acne uses but as extended "patch test" I was pleasantly surprised. Silicone feel of a primer 'finish,' matte look but clear, no tint. I don't use primer much at my age but would likely work instead. More of an SPF tinted moisturizer/BB or green CC type now. Reminds me of Dr Brandt pores no more texture but more luscious (these days I'm more Dr Jart/Shisedo BB). Doesn't dry my tight, sensitive skin but no oil to absorb here. Compared to adalpene, gly/sal, lactic acid, etc. very comfortable, no problems after a week of use am/pm. I would definitely recommend trying for rosacea, acne, sensitivity, dullness, aging. By far my favorite product from TO. Paula's choice AA booster has SA which sensitizes my skin like crazy. Glad I tested it out, first product that is a keeper in a while, my skin has been so intolerant.

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: This stuff really worked on my horrid rosacea. I had blotchy red skin on both sides of my cheeks and bumps on the bridge of my nose and even along the nostrils (!) that made me look like a clown from a sci-fi horror flick. Well, maybe not that bad, but it was ugly. I was desperate, but didn't want to do the antibiotic treatment. Using this cream 2x/day had almost immediate effects: less redness and blotchiness within a week. It took longer for the nose bumps to go away, but I've been using it for about 6 months now and they are GONE! It's important to use it twice a day--I've forgotten a couple of times and the bumps start coming back. The first tube I bought lasted 5 months or so--you don't need to use a lot, but you do need use it consistently. I am SO RELIEVED my skin is back to normal!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: I’ve had bumpy skin around my nose and under eye since 4 years ago. I’ve just finished using the Paula’s Choice Azelaic Boost and that one didn’t have much effects after using it for 2 months. With this one, I was able to see results within 3-4 days by using it day and night. I’m so shocked and so happy my bumpy skin is much smoother! I highly recommend this!!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: I had redness on my cheeks and nose. I tried all the expensive products and products that claim to get red of redness on your face. None of them worked. This product did! It is amazing, works and affordable! Give it a try. You will be glad you did.

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: I’ve struggled with acne for a long time, as well as hyperpigmentation. I’ve only been using this cream for a few days, once in the morning and once at night, and I can already see the difference. The redness isn’t totally gone but it’s WAY more subdued than it was. It also makes my current breakouts look less red, which I’m grateful for. A little of this cream goes a long way - you don’t get much in the tube, so use it sparingly and only on the parts of your face that are red. It also leaves your skin butter-soft, which is really nice. I hope the tube lasts me a while, but over all it’s worth the money. If your skin affects your confidence the way mine does, you’ll be grateful to have invested in this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: I was hesitant to try this. But I love it! My skin is glowing! I put this on before my moisturizer and for the price- you can’t beat it!

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText:
Azelaic acid is a decent option for acne and hyperpigmentation, which is why I buy this. This is a lower percentage than the prescription formulations (which I believe run 15% or higher) but they are also about 5x cheaper (if insurance does not cover the prescription version). Also, I've heard this is less irritating to skin than the higher percentages from others who have tried both. I hope The Ordinary keeps making this without jacking up the price.

P.S. I usually don't write reviews unless I'm procrastinating, have strong feelings one way or another about a product, or when I remember that I rely on good reviews from real people to make purchase decisions (I always check amazon profiles of informative reviews to be sure it's not a one off bot / paid review).

ReviewText: My mom recently got diagnosed with rosacea after not going to the doctors when the first signs started showing d/t COVID, insurance, "not wanting to see a doctor for nothing," etc. It got to the point where her nose started to have a red, tender bulge that finally bothered her enough to go get seen. She was diagnosed and prescribed 15% azelaic acid and an antibiotic cream. The azelaic acid was rejected so I bought her this 10% one. Her bulge started to shrink in less than 24 hours. She was so elated. This stuff works!

I bought this on the recommendation of my dermatologist. It's not available locally (Honolulu, Hawaii) so I bought it online thru Amazon. One store was willing to order it for me, but it would have taken even longer to get here and I would have a long drive to get to the store!

This came in yesterday and the rash on my face is already better!!!! Hooray!!! And less itching/pain as well.

I'm SO glad I got this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText:
I am 26 and have had acne since I was 16, that turned into cystic hormonal acne in my 20's. I had deep cystic acne around the jaw and ears, along with mild redness and textured on the cheeks and nose. My mother has rosacea, and I have been under the assumption that I am probably developing it as well, but have never been formally diagnosed.

After trying a free one month curology trial that cured my acne with a 8% azelaic acid prescription cream, I decided to try this before renewing for another (25$) month of curology. After a 1 month on curology I had significant improvement in these areas but not full clearing. After one week on this cream, my acne was fully gone and redness is now only reappearing with hot weather or spicy food. I am using it currently with jan marini bioglycolic cleanser, which is excellent for gentle exfoliation, and a biossance moisturizer. I think the key to success with this product is using it at least once daily, twice if you can handle it without irritation, and a good moisturizer to prevent any dryness. This may not work for everyone, but you can't beat it for the price.

As a side note, I would buy this off Ulta or from deciem because it is cheaper and I'm unsure about the sellers on Amazon.

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText:
I recently starting getting rosacea. Mine is not severe, relative to some photos I've seen, but nevertheless gets out of control if not treated, especially my nose.

Last year I paid $354 for Finacea and it worked, but $354!? At that point the 15% generic was not on the market, and I was unaware of any other options.

More recently, I rolled the dice on this $14, 10% azelaic acid from The Ordinary and it works too. Happy with the results and I don't have to ration it (I made that little tube of Finacea last 6+ months!).

So, I definitely recommend trying it. I am so relieved I found this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Azelaic Acid Suspension 10%, Formula for Uneven and Blemish-Prone Skin
ReviewText: I've had rosacea for over 20 years. Have used many products, prescription and otherwise. This is the first OTC product that actually made a difference for me. I've used it for several years now. I no longer use prescription meds because of this cream. So thankful i found it.

ReviewText: The tube is small, however this stuff is amazing! It has been very instrumental in clearing up my rosacea. Highly recommend to those like myself with combo rosacea skin.

ReviewText: I've bought this item twice before and both times, its worked very well and is part of my regular daily skin care routine. However, this time when I bought it, it arrived an orange color...normally it is clear. I believe the reason for this is (this also applies to Vitamin C serum) that its because its old and has oxidized. In fact, the last bottle I had just long enough, before I used it up, that it started turning slightly orange because it had aged. When you use serum that has done this, its just not effective and doesn't work. So I'm returning and going to try buying from another seller. It looks like this is happening to a lot of people per the comments.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I put two drops of this into my skin lotion one night. That's it. I had no redness or stinging, and my skin is usually sensitive enough to tell me right away if something is too harsh for me, so I thought it was fine. Next day my skin looked totally normal. Until I went out into the sun ... literally 10 min on a cloudy day gave me the worst sunburn on my face and neck where I'd put this product. I completely stayed out of the sun for the next few weeks. But now it's three weeks later, once again I sat outside for lunch. Even though I was wearing a huge sun hat, within 5 minutes my face and neck erupted into burning redness, with a clear line on the side of face that shows where the product had been. Apparently my skin was so damaged by two drops of this product that I have now developed a sun allergy (polymorphic light eruption) where my skin breaks out into red, hot, inflamed, sunburn-like rash in the sun. I am beside myself, since I'm a gardener and hiker who loves to be outdoors. BE VERY CAREFUL WITH THIS PRODUCT IF YOU HAVE SENSITIVE SKIN.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Like most other reviewers, I was looking to replace my Sunday habit. After about two weeks of use this product has not had much of an effect on my skin (whereas SR was immediate). Also what really concerns me is that the item arrived with packaging stickers that had an Asian language on it. I would normally have no problems with this if I was buying say, some K-beauty, but I'm pretty sure I've seen somewhere The Ordinary is made in the USA. This makes me wonder if its a knock off, and I'm seeing this a lot more on Amazon now which is so concerning. I don't think I'll be buying beauty products off Amazon anymore and stick with more reputable retailers. Off to Revolve for more Good Genes!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I bought this because so many people have said it's a dupe for Good Genes. It may very well do the same job as Good Genes, I can't tell just yet, but it's so, so sticky. My makeup doesn't go on very smooth when I've used it, and I know it says it's a night product, but I used my Good Genes in the morning, so that's when I use this. My face just stays sticky until I wash it. If you don't touch your face at all, maybe you won't notice, but I can't stop touching it, it's just so sticky. Going to look for another dupe. This one is the right price, but the texture distracts me from my day. Too bad.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I am 35 with combination acne prone sensitive skin. (lucky me)
I rated this 3 stars only because I believe the product itself is good (honestly I'm basing that off watching several you-tubers opinions) However, if you have sensitive skin, it may just be too much for you. Plus I also use a retinA from the dermatologist. (oh and i recommend adding it to your moisturizer to dilute the potency, that's what I do and it doesn't burn) Plus I also have some HA in my serum and moisturizer. So for me it was just too much for my skin. I don't think it's bad, its just not for me. And if I learned anything, skincare is very personalized.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Alright, so I got this product to use before blackhead extractions on my nose and chin. It's hard to tell, but I think it does help soften my pores to be able to extract more. BUT afterwards my chin was destroyed both times! (see picture) My nose has some minor peeling, but my chin loses the entire outer layer of skin, oozes, then scans. It's very unattractive and painful. I will definitely not be using it on my chin anymore, but it's probably still okay for one application on stronger areas of skin. I do have very sensitive skin, so this probably isn't the same problem others have.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Have not noticed any difference using this item and isn't that why we purchase?

ReviewText: Too soft

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I love Sunday Riley Good Genes lactic acid treatment but yikes it's expensive. After reading some info on the internet, I decided to try this since it's about 10% of the cost of SRGG! The formula is very different. This one is watery whereas SRGG is a cream. SRGG "soaks in" and feels like a moisturizer while this one feels slightly tacky after it dries. I feel a little tingling sometimes with this one, but no tingling with SRGG. I think they have similar results - my skin feels really soft after both.

I love SRGG and also their Luna sleeping oil. If I had to choose which one to get the authentic one, I would choose Luna oil because the closest dupe out there isn't even close. The Ordinary Lactic Acid gets similar results as Good Genes. It's harder to apply and feels kind of sticky, but for the price difference I can deal with that.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Thin consistency. Slight tingle, so I know I am getting the exfoliation I want. This product can be used daily or every other day if your skin is familiar with lactic acid. I actually use the 30% peel for about 45 minutes once a week, then this about 4 - 5 times a week day + night (never with retinol) and I have noticed a difference in dark, purple acne scars. They have lightened to a more pink shade and are easier to cover with makeup. I have also noticed a significant difference in actual breakouts. I like to put this on first on clean, toned skin as I find the lactic acid allows my serum to absorb deeper. Then I use a few drops of oil on top before doing makeup. This is decent and does the job.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: So I’ve been trying this product for over a month now and I haven’t seen really much difference in my skin. It is a good product but not for my personal concerns. I have keratosis pilaris on my face, and I had read this was good for it. It did make the texture of my skin a little smoother but other then that, not much. It does make my skin feel tight/dry after I put it on and I have dry skin already so I add a serum on top and a moisturizer.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I first tried 1x a week and it seemed good. At an every other day interval I did experience skin sensitivity similar to a sun burn. I do not have sensitive skin and almost never experience problems. Same time being sure to protect my skin with sunblock due to the increased risk of sun damage with a sensitizing product such as this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I use this product every night in combination with Estée Lauder Advanced Night Repair Synchronized Recovery Complex II and it does produce good results on my face. I also add it to my lotion and my skin is lighter compared to before. You just have to use it regularly to see results. I gave it 4 stars because I prefer something that has most of the things I need in 1 bottle.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have been using this product for 3-weeks. My face is noticeably softer and acne scars and diminished slightly. It seems to have diminished the degree new acne scaring, but not eliminated it. No adverse effects and no smell. A little goes a long way.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I really like this product... started using this after my Sunday Good Genes sample ran out. I notice how bright my skin is, however, still have the same small acne issues with large pores but having brighter even toned skin really makes a difference..,

ReviewText:
Purchased from Sephora and used for the first time last night. I have 33 year old oily/combo skin, some hyperpigmentation and blotchy patches. No acne. Looking to reduce pore size and even skin tone, and maybe smooth out a few minor forehead wrinkles. Had slight tingling, but nothing terrible. Put on after cleansing and toning. Before moisturizer. This morning I definitely noticed a smoother, more even looking complexion. Hoping with continued use I’ll see more + results!

FYI... THIS IS *MUCH* cheaper purchased through Sephora or directly from The Ordinary website. I paid $6.80 from Sephora for this lactic acid.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
In my opinion, the product I received does not work after a fake.

The product is the right color and the packaging has no flaws or doubts. The quality and workmanship also seems to be correct.

However, for some people in the reviews, the product clearly shows a fake, so it may occasionally be able to stay fake.

The price is very overpriced though, you can easily get this product from other retailers for under €8.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Well, you can't really beat The Ordinary for great products at really low prices, and this (to me) has been one of the best I've ever bought from them. I'm 49 and desperately looking for non-surgical ways to reverse time which is obviously ridiculous, but I suppose we all live in hope. That said, I've been using this product nightly for about a month now and my skin definitely looks better. I've still got a few lines and it hasn't reduced them, but the clarity and texture of my skin has absolutely changed for the better. If you look at this as a preventative step, rather than something that will reverse time, you can't really go wrong. I do wish I'd started using stuff like this 10 years ago, but hey ho, live and learn. And you don't need to use much of it - I've still got a bit more than half the bottle left and I've probably been a bit heavy handed with it. A little really does go a long way with this stuff. This is definitely going on my list of 'must haves' for the future.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Still waiting for the effect

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I had tingling so I melanded it with my night cream... Then I put it on with a cotton pad soaked... always slight tingling. Then I apply my Cixabio restor cream from bioderma... After 3 weeks my complexion is much less term and a reduction of my pigment spots (they were brown, they are coffee with milk... but every night two pipettes and meals on Sundays... I think to make a time of rest qd the bottle will be finished
Big downside Amazon sells this product 16 or 17€... Sephora sells it at 7 €10 but in Paris it is often out of stock but it is still a real difference!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Being an acid, however, it is always important to be careful if you have delicate skin. Applied consistently as indicated, I noticed that in the early days my skin had blackheads and pimples under the skin that were more obvious but also easier to clean. I occasionally do spot on treatments on the areas that interest me, such as the nose and chin, because I avoid areas that are already healthy and can still get irritated. I noticed a good improvement on the dark areas of old acne scars, but not so much on the narrowing of the pores.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I’ve seen a lot of reviews suggesting this product is fake, due to the color. I have since started purchasing the product in store and have found the same color variations. The bottle I purchased here seemed to work great and just as well as the in store purchases. Only problem is that the price here is almost twice what you would pay compared to buying from most brick and mortar options.

I have had excellent results in seeing a smoothing of my skin, reduction of black heads, and an overall improvement in color consistency in my skin (reduced redness around nose and on forehead). I would consider myself to have sensitive skin and I didn’t have any issues with this product. Of course, it’s impossible to predict how each individual would react.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It works like a category, in the first few days of applying it to the skin of my beard I already noticed a reduction in my seborrheic dermatitis, but beware, on Amazon it is literally twice its price, it's not worth buying it here, let's be warned

ReviewText: This is a must, especially at this price. Lactic acid helps thicken skin that's thinning out. I use this under The Ordinary's copper peptide serum. It is very gentle, and I do not feel any stinging as I might with other acids. Highly recommended!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Made my face feel awesome but it kinda burnt the first few days I used it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: If you have adult acne or just sensitive skin and you never get to use products that benefit your skin. You will LOVE this acid. It will change your skins texture, appearance and pores are tight. My acne is clearing up. It happened extremely fast. I had a really bad break out for months from trying to get in a tretinoin/ retin A routine. My face looked worse than ever and I'm in my 30's. Adult breakouts suck. These acids all the AHA's lactic acid, glycolic acid in combo with a benzol peroxide acne free line have changed my skin. I apply the acid at night with a hydroquinone 2% lightening cream that also has small amounts of lactic and glycolic acid. If you also get the acnefree system DONT USE STEP 4 OF THE ACNE FREE. it is retinol and if you have sensitive skin like me it will destroy you. This combination is amazing for me because I have sensitive skin that easily has a breakout. These together almost immediately did what I have tried to use retin A for almost a year. My skin is dewy, tight and clear. I'm so thankful I did some research and found out about using acids. It has saved my skin. I hope this can help someone who is tired of dealing with the depressive self conscious feeling from the breakout.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: It does xactly what it is supposed to do at a reasonable price.

ReviewText: Good value and nice product. I would recommend

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This did great things for my skin and I love using it. Adds moisture and helps exfoliate. My skin is much improved

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: If you want a product that would lighten your acne scars, keep acne at bay, and brighten your dull complexion, this is it! I’ve tried multiple skincare products from brands such as Paula’s Choice, CosRX, Timeless, Missha, La Roche Posay, and much more ranging to $50 max. This is definitely a multitasker for my combination, acne-prone, sensitive, and redness-prone teenage skin. I just use this one product every night and I put the amount of AHA liquid concentrate from one whole pipette because I slowly adapted my skin to this serum. Then I topped the serum off with a gentle lotion (I use Bioderma Intensive) and that’s it. I find myself not reaching for other facial products I have in hand because this is all I need every night. When I wake up in the morning, my complexion is bright and I my pimples are kept at bay. Because this serum makes the skin sensitive to the sun, I put some light sunscreen from La Roche Posay, Innisfree, or Apieu during the day.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I used this product every night, and it had such an impact on my skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Everything to satisfaction

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I really love this product. I was looking for something that would be hydrating for my skin and help with redness. It is very moisturizing, doesn't dry out my skin, and I like mixing a couple drops with my vitamin c serum when I put it on my face. I noticed that the properties help with dry rough skin and I tend to get some ezcema-like patches on the backs of my hands; when I put this on them, I usually notice the redness quiets down significantly within the next day or so. It does have a burning sensation sometimes when I put it on, but it's acid so that's to be expected. I will definitely continue to buy this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I use it daily now

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I'm 34 years old and my skin looks textured and red! No amount of toning or moisturizing has changed that so I decided to buy this. I've used this product one time so far and my face already feels smoother and fresher. I use to get dry ice treatments at my dermatologist's office and this is what my face felt like afterwards! My skin feels cleaner, tighter, and soft as silk. My skin doesn't look so "tired" anymore. It's only a slight difference so far but I'm hoping after a week or two my skin will look even better. I'll update my review if anything changes but so far I am very happy with this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This is my favorite lactic acid formula from any brand. I have tried much more expensive formulas and I always go back to this one. I alternate it with retinol. Amazing anti aging results

ReviewText: Love the ordinary and this was sold out everywhere and could only find it on Amazon. I didn’t get to use it for long before stripping down my skincare routine to the basics because of acne forming from wearing a mask. It wasn’t due to this product but I look forward to giving it a real try later on. The Consistency was a little thicker than water and sunk right into my skin which was great. Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
My skin has always been fine (no breakouts or anything like that) but the area on my cheeks would get a tiny bit oily and my nose skin dry.

I have been using this product for literally less than a year and while my skin is and looks GREAT I actually started seeing a change after only 2-3 weeks, super fast if you're consistent.

My routine is once a day (normally in the morning): wash skin, use the Lactic Acid and then use a normal facial moisturizer after. That easy.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I was a sample of this product in my Birch Box and after using it for a few days, I LOVED the way my face felt. It was soft, the black heads were cleared up and my skin had no more acne. It may take time for me to see any results regarding wrinkles and the fine lines my forty something skin has collected over the years, but I really like this product and would recommend it to anyone that struggles with blackheads and or acne.

I noticed a big difference after just one use. I had little bumps on my forehead- gone in one night. Noticeable diminishing of fine lines on my forehead. Even the broken capillaries on my forehead looked less irritated. (My forehead is my problem area, haha!) over all my skin is softer and has a better level of clarity. Highly, highly recommend!

ReviewText: Start with a bottle of 5%, then bump up to 10% for your next bottle. This is an exfoliating serum so everyday your face gets exfoliated.works great on my sensitive skin. I use it in the morning after my Vitamin C serum. Then continue with Coenzyme Q10 serum, a moisturizer & of course SUNSCREEN! If your mouisturizer contains sunscreen, you can skip Sunscreen.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This stuff is overpriced on Amazon, but I was in a pinch. I use this every other night and mix it with my Curology (if you have ance/skin issues, look up this service!!!) and it gives the greatest chemical exfoliation I've had. A dupe for Sunday Riley's Good Genes. I will keep using this as long as they make it. Finally, a company that charges fair prices for their skin care products! Google and find this for $6.75 through a different website (though it's $5 shipping, so just order a couple!)

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I originally got this because I ran out of my other chemical exfoliant and thought I'd try this after reading so many rave reviews. I was a little worried about it being too harsh for my skin (I have sensitive skin) but it was only tingling for 20 seconds max. It does say on the packaging that it's normal to feel a tingling sensation and it should go away. I love this product and I can see why it's gotten such great reviews.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I have really large pores and this took close to 3 weeks of using nightly to see a change. But now it's amazing the difference it has made. It does sting a little when you put it on so not sure how it may be on sensitive skin?

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This product is incredible. Within a few days of use, I have noticeably softer, clearer skin. I use a few drops nightly on my neck and chest. Even with sensitive skin, the formulation is gentle enough that it doesn’t irritate me, and the addition of HA helps my skin retain moisture throughout the day. My friends have commented on the almost immediate change in my complexion. I do pair this with sunscreen as summer is now approaching.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Good

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Exelente

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: This stuff tingles a little kinda like if you put lemon juice on your face but it dries quickly and is very gentle but very effective, after the second or third time I used this I noticed my face was baby butt smooth and my makeup looked more natural after applying, I would suggest exfoliating your face with a wash cloth before you use and then use a high quality face oil after you wash the peel off for amazing results

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Has no harsh chemicals and applied to face very nicely. I use mine with witch hazel to dilute it some but you can use it alone. Works great on my skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: After receiving a sample of Good Genes and loving that but realizing I didn't really want to spend 100 bucks for a full size bottle I discovered this product. For 13 bucks I am HIGHLY impressed. It is a bit "sticky" but the results amaze me as much as Good Genes - and I save a ton of dough.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I just started implementing acids into my skincare routine and had never used lactic acid before but my skin is not particularly sensitive and I have no problem using this every other night before bed. It makes my skin feel fabulous and I wake up with a glow in the morning. It also cleared up a persistent dry patch I've had on my forehead. Highly recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I've been using this about a week now and it is amazing, texture is already better, my face is super soft, can't wait to see more results with longer use. Great price point, great product. I've used high end products that cost quadruple the price, that don't hold a candle to this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Still making a decision while I strive to use it consistently to see if it will remove age spots. I am pleased with the product but I am hopeful that this product will eventually remove age spots.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: I could never imagine NOT using this product now. It's transformed my skin, it's so much cleaner and glowy. The first few times u use it I'd recommend using a small amount until your skin gets used to it, but it's amazing.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText:
I've tried everything for my KP and nothing was working. Everything was making it worse.
This stuff right here is magic in a bottle for my tricky rare severity. It doesn't give me acne while treating the KP either, like everything else I tried.
I like to use it daily and scrub my face in a hot shower once a week to reveal the fresh skin underneath :)

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: Good product. But pay attention to what other face products your going to be using with this. I used tea tree oil and the interaction caused a chemical burn.

ReviewText: This was a pleasant surprise because I wanted to buy the Sunday Riley version of this that is $80+ but then I read somewhere that this is the same ingredient! It works very well and my complexion is more even.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: You got acne? But this! You got oily skin? But this! You got tiny bumps and uneven skin tone? But this!! It works, been using it for 3 or 4 months all together and out 8 REALLY has change my oily, cystic acne, tiny bumps skin.

ReviewText: The Ordinary lactic acid treatment is a FANTASTIC dupe for Sunday Riley’s Good Genes. It does sting a little on blemishes but no visible irritation shows up. However, no idea where Amazon gets off charging $18 for this. It’s under $7 at Sephora.....Sephora, for crying out loud :)

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 10% + HA 2%, High-Strength Exfoliating Serum for Smoother, Brighter Skin
ReviewText: LIFE CHANGING! I have really bad acne scars and after ONE use, this faded them. I cannot believe the results. I have tried everything and nothing has helped me like this stuff. I use it at night. Did not wake up feeling oily at all. My pores are a lot smaller too. Highly recommended.

Product Name: The Ordinary Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA, Brightens Skin and Targets Dark Spots
ReviewText:
My first product by the ordinary and man its been a huge mistake.
I dont know what it is about this product that my skin hates so much because before using it i used to get maybe 4-5 pimples a month totally at most but the problem was scarring and I wanted to use this to deal with that.
Once I started using it though, my skin was like a cobblestone foot path in terms of bumpiness in a matter of days.
I took to the internet to see if others were in the same boat and was informed of the term "purging" which means it can take upto to months for my skin to purge all the acne deep under my skin to the surface and get rid of them once and for all.
So despite my best judgement, I stuck with it afterall I am no expert but 3 months and no signs of stopping, I officially give up. I have way more acne scars now than when I started :(
Im going to try Niacinamide next, and I suggest you do so too! No purging bs with that one, Ive read.

ReviewText:
I'm so conflicted with how many stars to give this. I need to say - I LOVE how this feels. It feels super hydrating while being really light, I put it on usually right after I wash my face, and while it's slightly sticky, as soon as I put some lotion over top of it that goes away. It has a very mild and unoffensive smell.

However. It didn't do much for evening out or brightening my problem areas, but I'm not sure the marks I have are marks that alpha arbutin would work on anyway, so it's not entirely fair to rate it on that. That said, I would like to see it be a little higher percentage as some other products have.

Even despite that though, I'm tempted to repurchase it anyway just because I like it so much.

Product Name: The Ordinary Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA, Brightens Skin and Targets Dark Spots
ReviewText: When used with other The Ordinary products I have seen much improvement in my hyperpigmentation over the course of the past 2 months!! Use with vitamin c (I use Timeless brand for c but the rest is The Ordinary), niacinamide, and azelic acid for awesome results!!! Don't forget the high SPF while using all of these products or you will end up worse than you started!!! If you need this product, you also need to wear high physical (not chemical) spf on your face 24/7/365...unless you are inside and there is no light coming in from any windows!!!! Hyperpigmentation is all about sun exposure and heat in the skin. Chemical sunscreens react in your skin creating heat which can also make hyperpigmentation worse, which is what I experienced...just like the research says. Also, chemical sunscreens allow sun to absorb into your skin, but physical sunscreen reflects the sun. As soon as I started with religious application of 30-50spf in only physical sunscreen form, all hyperpigmentation stopped getting worse. Now The Ordinary is helping me correct the damage that was done before my new sunscreen rituals!!!!
