Product Name: The Ordinary Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA, Brightens Skin and Targets Dark Spots
ReviewText: On the recommendation of the Gothemista from Youtube (skincare product reviews and advice Vlogger) I started this product January 24th. Today is valentines day and all my spots are starting to fade. I initially dabbed on a thin layer a bit here and there for about a week. The second week I looked in my high magnification mirror Conair Oval Shaped Double-Sided Lighted Makeup Mirror; 1x/7x magnification; Oiled Bronze Finish and immediately noticed several of my sun spots and hyperpigmentation areas were shades lighter and starting to break up. Some spots are shrinking around the edges as well as becoming lighter. The vlogger I follow used it for several months and found significant improvement on her own complexion. If your not ready to shell out the money for the fraxel laser then pick up one of these nifty bottles and make it part of your daily skin care practice.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Box arrived a little crumpled, but came in its own soft envelope so I get that.

The actual real concern is that there’s no safety seal on the box, nor on the bottle. The bottle dropper opened/“unscrewed” with zero resistance or “click” like most products do. Unsure if that’s an Ordinary brand standard or what… but that is weird and definitely doesn’t make me confident to use the product. First impressions are that since there’s no safety seals at all anywhere on the product, that it’s not tamper proof, it could have been bought then used then returned, or even refilled with any oil then returned to be re-shelved and resold, or what have you. I contacted customer service and while they were so helpful, they weren’t sure about product seals either. I’ll continue to search for an answer from The Ordinary company themselves.

This is my first experience and purchase with The Ordinary ever, so I’m not super impressed right off the bat. But I got this retinol .5% on a little sale, so I may try it as a “patch test” first and go from there.

I’m hoping that The Ordinary will start to seal up their packages for better product integrity and costumer confidence!! It’s not *ordinary* for non-tamper-proof skincare or cosmetic products at all!! Not sure if they have me as a repeat customer yet.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
EDIT: I really dislike this product. It gave me way more acne than i started with. What I mean is, before I used this, I had 1 or 2 pimples. After using it for 6 weeks, I got rather severe acne. Breaks outs everywhere. Not a purge, but a full on breakout. I got acne on areas of my face that I never got acne before. It was a nightmare. I am now using Curology, and that seems to be taking my newly severe acne down a notch.

I am uncertain about this product. I have been using it for almost 3 weeks now. My pores might look a little smaller, but other than that I am not too sure if it is working. I use it every other night. If i use it every night, I break out more. Every other night doesn't make me break out more than usual, but i still have acne in my troubled areas. I don't have any redness or irritation though. If there are any great changes in the future, I'll come back and edit my review

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This is not a serum, but an OIL, which is not at all used in the same way in a beauty routine. A serum should be applied after a toner and before a moisturizer. An oil is put on very last and you can't put anything on top of it. It's not the first time I've ordered a so-called serum from The Ordinary and received an oil, I'm sick of it.

Besides that, I didn't notice any big changes in my skin thanks to this oil, I think I need 1% instead.

On the other hand warning: every time I use it, I have a migraine. Migraine sufferers, beware. For my part, I'm going to give it away, I don't want it anymore.

ReviewText:
Play Video
I bought second bottle with higher retinol percentage which is this but both 0.2 and this make my skin to have some big bumps under the skin that hurted a lot. They were so big and because lasted me for more than 2 weeks I went to dermatologist to check my self for cancer. I did not knew this product is causing me this untill i stopped using it. Face looks much better with retinol but the bumps that appeared are something that I never experienced in my life. Trust me I tried a lot of products but I never experienced something that painfull, sored and scary. Last time I used this after a 2 months break and one bump appeared on my eyebrow. My eye was swollen and red and the next thay blueish. U can try it cause its really cheap but stop immediately if u notice something painfull, otherwise u will be left will scars on your face from those scary bumps.
Ps: No other retinol caused me this reaction.

ReviewText:
Packaging indicates how and when to use. NOT ENOUGH.
Manufacturer website provides barely anything more.
However one must study a dermatologist’s analysis to evaluate the real possible dangers IN RELATION TO YOUR PARTICULAR SKIN. One must understand all retinoids FORMS, TYPES and STRENGTHS to see if this one is the right choice before using as per the manufacturer recommendations!
Manufacturer website completely insufficient in this domain and provides no warning “how to use (depending on…), why and what to watch for”.

ReviewText:
I thought that being a well-known brand it would not have components harmful to the body.
When I arrived I saw first of all its components.
If you want to check the sources of why BHT is an endocrine disruptor, you can use the Yuka app to scan the QR of the product and see the studies of each component of this retinol.

However, the seller was quick and the product arrived in normal condition.

I will proceed with your return.

ReviewText: The product box arrived without a seal and, what is more serious, so did the bottle cap, so it is not possible to know if the composition of the serum is maintained by the pharmaceutical company or has been altered. Nor does it have an expiration date, which may be on the outer seal, because somewhere it has to come. Therefore, using this product, in the condition in which it arrived and without clarifying the expiration date, is a lottery and if it goes wrong the consequences for the skin can be disastrous. You'd better think of other options.

ReviewText: Honestly it’s not the best retinol product out there but it definitely gets the job done. May cause you to breakout for the first 2-3 weeks but that’s only because it’s bringing all those hidden pimples to the surface, but after that I saw a noticeable difference in the evenness of my skin tone. It does feel very oily on the skin though so I would not suggest this particular product if you have already oily skin. I would say the only major downside is that it has a very strange smell? It’s not strong or anything but when I put it on my face I can definitely smell it and I would not describe it as pleasant. It goes away after rubbing it into the skin but I figure for those that are sensitive to smells it would be good to know.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
My skin type: mixed (oily T-zone, with slightly open pores in front and nose); first wrinkles.

Goal I was looking for: smooth wrinkles, close pores, improve overall skin appearance.

Application of the product: every night after cleansing and tonic, adding moisturizer after.

Results: after only a week using it I can say that the appearance of the skin has improved considerably (more radiance, the complexion seems thinner); wrinkles have not disappeared but they do look less (because the skin is softer); the pores of the forehead have been slightly reduced. When I apply it to the skin I notice a VERY slight burning sensation (but there is no reddening at the moment or posteriori, nor peeling).

Opinion: The product seems to work after 1 week of application (better looking skin, less visibility wrinkles, closer pores); the application is comfortable by the dispenser; the product is very oily and leaves the feeling of wearing oil on your face when you use it (but it has not caused me pimples or fat bounces).

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I wanted to give the brand a try not only because of the good reviews, but because the info that the brand itself offers says that it is for all skin types, I have oily skin. Spoiler alert, it's not for all skin types, it was very DISAPPOINTING.
The Retinol 5% is supposed to work to regulate the sebum of the skin but the oily consistency of the serum, which had already improved a lot using another brand, produced the appearance of pimples, blackheads and worsened the appearance of the sebaceous filaments .
Niasinamide 10% and Zinc 1% have a hated, soapy consistency. After a week my skin became very irritated and I had to suspend it. Looking for more information I came to learn that this percentage of Niasinamide with Zinc can cause the opposite of what it should, it breaks the normal protective barrier of the skin.
I do not intend to use this brand again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane is an effective, budget-friendly retinol product that has delivered noticeable results for my skin, but there’s one big drawback that keeps it from being perfect.

Pros:

Affordable: High-quality retinol at a fraction of the cost of similar products.
Effective: Helped smooth my skin texture and reduce the appearance of fine lines over time.
Gentle formula: The squalane base is hydrating and minimizes irritation compared to other retinol products.

Cons:

Ingredient concern: The inclusion of BHT (a preservative) is disappointing. I prefer products without this additive, as there’s some debate about its safety in skincare and ability to disrupt the endocrine system.

Overall, while the performance and price are excellent, I’m hesitant to repurchase due to the BHT. If this doesn’t concern you, it’s a fantastic choice for incorporating retinol into your routine.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’d like this product I use it daily

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I had a reaction to this product. I applied to my face for a week or so, and at first, it seemed to cause a healing reaction where my skin was cleansing, pushing things out and it actually caused some acne. But I knew this was part of the process and it was for the better. My skin did improve and seemed to tighten and firm just like I wanted it to, but the unfortunate part was that I began to experience pretty pronounced dry eye symptoms.

These symptoms lasted a few weeks and went away. I was worried that I had permanently harmed my meibomian glands (the oil glands in your eyelids that moisturize your eyes.) This is apparently a side effect that a certain percent of people experience with retinoids.

I have to say, I'm upset that I can't use this product because I understand the mechanism that makes it effective. I must be one of the people who don't tolerate it well. I am considering grabbing the 0.1% retinol from The Ordinary and trying that some day in the future.

For those who are experiencing dry eye from retinol and are worried that it'll last forever like I was... for me, it did not! I STOPPED the retinol immediately when I realized what was happening. It took about 2-3 weeks for the symptoms to go away. I also apply castor oil to my face and my eyelashes, so I think that kind of helped moisturize my eyes to deal with the dry eye temporarily. Now I'm back to normal!

4/5 for the product, I just wish I could tolerate it!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I really love this formula, the squalane gives it a nice silky texture. I have combination mature skin, however I think someone with very oily skin may find this product oily and will not appreciate the squalene I think Combination and drier skin types will like this formula. When I started using this product I knew it would come with its side effects.(Hence why I prefer the Niacinamide no side effects)
I use this 3 times for the week once a day. To be very honest I cannot bear the side effects of mild tingling and sensitivity, even though I cover with Cerave Moisterizing cream after ON THE FACE AND NECK AREA. Applying Niacinamide before will help but I am 1 serum girl, I really don’t want to have to apply more than 1 at a time. As well cutting down on how often you use it will cut down side effects, but call me fussy I want something I can apply nightly with no problem. However with that being said, I have Keratosis Pilaris on my arms and loving it on that area. After only after 2 weeks of using this at night on my arms there was a mild improvement and with continued use just got better. Also I have used this on my stretch marks and have brightened the area So while I am not sure I will use this on my face I am loving it on my KP on arms feels comfortable and stretch marks

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: If you have sensitive skin or rosacea this maybe isn’t the product for you. Even though the retinol dose is so small, it’s a little irritating even in slowly onboarding it. HOWEVER, you have regular skin this would probably be a super affordable go to!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I went from using a retinol serum that was more like a lotion, this is more like an oil and that's just not for me. No complaints about the quality of the product, it seems to work, I just don't like the way it feels like the oil is sitting on the surface of my face and I will probably go back to the lotion type serum I was using before.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've been wanting to try retinol for a long time and decided to try this product. I followed the instructions carefully since I knew retinol could cause some skin irritations. I did experience a very mild sting with my first application but no other problems with the subsequent nightly applications. I didn't notice immediate changes in my skin but after numerous weeks of using it I believe my skin looks smoother with the wrinkles not as noticeable. I'm in my early 60's so I use the retinol with other products to help my skin and I believe it's an ongoing process to fight aging.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I came to love this product after having a reaction to it! Please be careful! If you have never tried retinol before, read the instructions carefully (i did not) & test it out and DO NOT GET IT NEAR YOUR EYES! I accidentally rubbed it in too close and my eyes became very irritated. I waited about 2 weeks and tried it again and it's worked out really well since.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Sooo I know the lighting of the photos isn’t the best but they are all before then after, after about 2 weeks. The last one is me made up. I feel like my pores and overall texture of my skin is improved.
I was able to go into using this basically once a day immediately because I was using Olays purple rentiol night cream prior to(idk how much retinol is in that product but it may help to transition into actual rentiol treatment). I had no dryness, peeling or serious breakouts. No complaints on scent either.
I have to say I’m not the best at washing my face if I’m not showering so my nightly routine at bare minimum(cuz working 2 jobs as a single mom means we ain’t got time for much more than that) is remove the makeup, rentiol oil to soak in for about 15 min, then moisturize(store brand cetaphil). Always making sure to put spf primer on in the am before makeup as well(elf suntouchable).
I’m about a month into this routine with no complaints. Hope this review helps y’all!

ReviewText: I love everything this company offers and my dermatologist had to agree, their products are amazing. I use the Retinol on my body and it helps with keeping my skin looking young. It is unscented which is nice bc some products have a strange smell.

ReviewText: seen a difference in my skin within a few days.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Writing this now with the intention to update in a few months as I get further into using it. Great product so far that hasn't caused me any irritation. I was expecting this to be harsh for my skin because I've never used a retinol before and after buying it I read that you're really supposed to start with the 0.2% retinol solution. Even though I jumped to this one and I have dry skin, I haven't noticed significant irritation. I use a light moisturizer before I use this at night and then a deeper moisturizer after to be safe. What I have noticed is that after a week's use (every 3 days at night) along with vitamin c+e (every morning), is that my skin feels softer and pores seem much smaller already. Serums like this are the only products where I seem to see almost instant results. Definitely worth the money.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is the best retinol I’ve ever ever used. It almost feels like an oil-based so obviously when it goes on my skin, it feels super super hydrating. The only thing I would say is that it takes a long time to actually absorb into my skin and then put moisturizer as my last step. It takes a while in between I can do those but for the price and for everything else, I don’t think I’m gonna be looking for another retinol for quite some time.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz

ReviewText: I've used this retinol for a few years. It's very light oil that absorbs well. I originally purchased it to get rid of dark spots on my aging face, but it didn't do a thing. I continue to use it as it just feels good and hopefully does some good to my skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I'm 46 and born and raised in the south Coast Sun of Texas. No sunscreen and living by the pool and at the beach so I have to really try to find affordable skincare products. The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% product is thick and leaves my skin dewy and vibrant and my 18 yr old daughter who takes very good care of her skin said she wanted her skin to look like mine. I thought I was hearing things. But she said mom whatever your doing is working I highly recommend this product I use it on my chest hands are and sometimes on my legs and tummy after a bath it's very thick and only takes a small amount so I once a week use it on my body it fells so good. Everyone should give it a try it's affordable come on

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Retinols take TIME to work, which is why I used this product every other night for 6 months to really see the results. I just finished the bottle, so it lasted a long time.

As you can see, my red spots have faded DRAMATICALLY! I don’t get cystic acne anymore because of this product, however I still have some texture and white heads. This is a lower strength retinol, so now that I have finished this product I am graduating to the 1% version of this product to really target the texture.

I did purge at the beginning but it was SO worth it! Sunscreen is a MUST with any retinol and I found that to be true with this product, my skin would get red on days I forgot sunscreen. Amazing product and results I can't wait to use the 1%.

Would recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: As far as retinol serums go, this one is very inexpensive. I wasn't sure what to expect, but this product feels luxurious going on, and I definitely saw results from nightly use of it. I just bought a second bottle. Highly recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Great

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Take it from someone who has struggled with acne literally their entire life. I have tried many many different topical creams, face washes, toners, masques, etc. you name it I have more than likely tried it. I've given myself numerous chemical burns because my skin is very sensitive. I have taken EVERYTHING out of my daily/ nightly routine because this bad boy works so well. My pores have shrunk, my skin is much softer, my skin actually glows, and not from it being oily, it really is a great product overall. I use to have about an 8-10 step nightly routine and now it's a 3 step process. I use micellar water, The Ordinary toner, and retinol before I go to bed. I HIGHLY recommend using this if you struggle with hormonal or cystic acne.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I ordered this retinol after seeing great reviews on YouTube and boy were they right. I received my package yesterday and put the retinol to use last night. The second picture is what my face looked like 10 minutes ago. I’m excited to see the long term results.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: when I tell you this product works right away it works RIGHT AWAY!! I put this product on about twice every week and the results are AMAZING! I put it on every night before bed and when i wake up i see that there is a very noticeable difference in my acne!! amazing product!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: LOVE THIS. Started off using it once every 3 days (at night only). Now I use it every night. It’s important to start slow cos everyone’s skin is different. My face looks better when I wake up. I’m glowing, my closed comedomes are smaller in size, I have no redness. Keep it in the fridge. I guess the ordinary doesn’t put a seal on their products, which weirded me out at first. Be aware that these do not have a protection seal.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.5% in Squalane, Intermediate Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I do not leave a lot of skincare reviews because sometimes the results are rather subjective.
However, I thought this was a good value, the retinal did not irritate my skin and I use it every night, I have had it for nearly a month now and I can tell that my skin tone looks more even and smooth. I use a variety of products so its hard to say which is responsible for that, however I like the squalane in this formula and I find it moisturizing. I still top with a rich moisturizer and eye cream

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is not from The Ordinary. It tries hard to be, but it’s not the real product. It even says “test on humans” on the bottle. Do not buy. I regret my purchase bc I stored it away and no longer can get a refund.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I really wanted to like this product since I’ve been hearing so many good things about it. But, stupid me so excited to try it that I didn’t even do a patch test, and got myself an allergy reaction. I did everything besides the patch test and put it on my face and waited 10 min. And mind you it was the longest 10 minutes ever! I started noticing some slight discomfort maybe 3 minutes after I put it on. I thought it was just the products itself working you know, since it’s Salicylic Acid. 5-6 minutes past and my skin is really tingling, burning and itching so bad and again I ignored it and thought maybe the product is really strong (wrong decision). 10 minutes is finally up and I couldn’t run fast enough to the bathroom to get it off my face. It was itching and burning so bad that I was scrubbing my face hard to get it off, and bam! both of my cheeks is really swollen and red 😞 I’d never have any allergy reaction before and since I’d read so many good reviews that I thought it’s going to be one of those perfect skin care products for me, sadly that’s not the case. So, please do a patch test first before you use it just to make sure! I love The Ordinary but this one is not just for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: DO NOT BUY! I saw the reviews about half-filled bottles. I was hoping I would be lucky and not get one of the defective items...wrong! It literally has not been opened because I have been so angry at the lack of product actually in the container. Did not realize there were no returns prior to purchase otherwise I would not have taken the gamble. Clearly there is a quality control issue that they are not willing to address so now I am not willing to risk putting it on my face.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I do not recommend this product as a face mask as it burns your skin. I tried it 4 times. The first time I used it I loved it and it felt refreshing. I used it for the 4th time in about 3 months and my skin was left BURNING. It was so painful as I rinsed it off. Quality skin care products do not burn you. Spot treatments for bad acne I’m sure would be fine but not a full mask.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Just received this in the mail and I was very excited to use it. I opened the bottle and kept squeezing, waiting for something to come out but ... nothing came out. I’m not sure if this is a joke or not, but this was a waste of my money and time. You’ll be lucky if you get one use out of this bottle.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I was surprised to see that this product is a charcoal black because I don’t recall seeing that anywhere on the packaging but I do really like this mask for the evenings. I’m happy it’s clay and not a peel off so it feels nice and gentle when applying and removing the mask also I ONLY applied on my problem areas rather than my entire face. I made sure to not leave it on for more than 10 minutes so I didn’t have any redness or irritation! I LOVE how this product does not have any harsh chemicals in the ingredients but it does have a very mild off-scent - it’s nothing “fresh” per say which I don’t mind because this kind of product doesn’t need any kind of fragrance added to it. I followed up with vitamin E oil for extra motorization and hydration.

ReviewText: I think it's an amazing product but i dont think it's worth it for it's price. Sure it gets blackheads and such sebaceous filaments out my nose but speaking from my experience, it didnt get much out. It left many blackheads and filaments and also left my nose extremely textured. I used it after a gentle cleanser that was pretty good at handling my blackheads and filaments but just not to the desired extent but it still wasnt as good as i heard. I kind of wish i could go back in time and stop myself and look for different solutions and methods but i guess this is ok for now.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The utility of this product is reasonable but it works very slowly. You use it once every week, so don't expect to get the result drastically. One tube can be used for approximately 8 weeks. As the process is slow, you don't know how many of these you need before you can see improvement. If you have very sensitive skin, the process might be even slower for you. Also, it doesn't do a very good job for moisturizing. In a nutshell, you can use it but you have to be patient with it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: One use and my skin is silky smooth to touch and has a light shiny glow. I have mild adult acne, mostly around mu chin and cheeks and its hormonally based and sometimes cystic. I tend to get black heads or pimples deep under the skin. Up Until now I have used the Murad Intensive-C Radiance glycolic gel cream peel to exfoliate once a week. That works ok but its $50 and I researched that Salicylic acid delves deeper into oily/acne prone pores to clean them out. I love alot of the Ordinary's products and this is a HIT! I've used this twice and its been a dream. My skin is already showing less and less black heads, texture and those under the skin pimples that havent quite come up yet. I was a little nervous at first at the idea of using a clay mask. I have used them in the past and they really do bring acne up and out to the surface. This mask seems to do the opposite! Skin is so SOFT, SUPPLE AND GLOWY! I realize that the Ordinary is known for using natural moisturizing factors like Squalene, glycerine and hyaluronic acid- all known for hydration. This mask has the first two, so skin doesnt feel tight or dry after washing off. When using this its a black creamy consistency and over the ten minutes it tightens on the face only to leave it soft and moisturized after washing off. Over all I LOVE THE PRICE, just PLEASE MAKE THIS IN A LARGER SIZE!!!!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I got my boyfriend to start using it as well.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
How product worked with my skin:
I’m 14 and I have acne around the contour of my cheeks and get black/white heads on my nose. I don’t have have sensitive skin I have oily dehydrated skin. Took me 3min to apply. It has a grainy texture. Feels cool on the skin. Has a faint smell. Gets tight as it drys but will still be able to eat while wearing it. Melts right off with lukewarm water. Leaves skin feeling instantly soft must moisturize after not because is drying but because your skin must be moisturized no matter what. Skin looked dewy after moisturizer was applied.
Package review:
Product came with 80% of product and 20% air as some reviewers said but is fine with me. Has foil sealing which prevents from tampering and spillage. Box came with a dent but did not harm product inside. Box also has a velvet texture which is nice. ◞(⚭⃚⃙͐·̫⚭⃚⃙͐)˩✧

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This mask works great. I've been doing a number of things to treat face mask acne on my chin (sigh, a sign of the covid times), and this acne mask really did the trick. I've only used it once so far, but it penetrated deeply and dried out some cystic stuff that's been giving me woes. It's drying, so only apply where needed, I did it from nose to chin and left my blemish free forehead alone. My cons are that it's not free, and the weight of the fill seems light to me. A lot of extra space in the tube. Pro is that it works! And it can be used sparingly. Good stuff. Have your moisurizer ready, you will experience some peeling the next day.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’ve only used it a couple of times, but I like it so far. I hope it will make a difference in my complexion over time.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: makes my skin super soft, use this 1-2x a week, idk if this is the BEST brand, but it’s a good beginner skincare item everyone should use if they want soft skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I use this as a spot treatment most of the time but it’s amazing as an all over mask. It does leave my skin very very red so I have to use it at night but that’s the only downfall. Helps keep my acne away. I know to use it on my normal breakout spots right before Mother Nature visits and it helps tremendously!! I use it as a mask when my whole face needs some extra loving. I really enjoy this and will be purchasing again. The thickness is just as expected.

Product Name: The Ordinary Salicylic Acid 2% Masque, Clarifying Charcoal & Clay Mask for Blemish-Prone Skin, 1.7 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I haven’t been using this for long and I’m already noticing a difference! I’ve always had a problem with dark pores on my nose and no matter what I’ve done, painful (and damaging) prior treatments such as the blackhead suction machines and pore strips, nothing has worked as well as this mask is so far. I apply it to my problem area as directed, no more than 10-15min twice a week and I’ve experienced no negative reactions and I’m satisfied with my clearing skin

Much better, so much smoother and the tone is all one!!! Fast shipping and great packaging. Will be buying again from this seller.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser, Gentle Makeup Removal with Plant-Derived Glycolipid Agents, 5.1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I've never tried The Ordinary brand of skin care, so I was really curious about this cleanser. With cleansers I prefer ones that leave my skin clean with a fresh feeling but without dryness or tightness. This one delivered on most of those.

This cleanser goes on creamy. It isn't one to lather or foam. It didn't take very much product to do the job, which is good as it makes it a better value. There was a cooling sensation while using. It went on evenly and smoothly and rinsed off well.

My face felt clean and refreshed immediately after using. It had a coolness to it. I wasn't wearing any make-up, so I can't say whether it removes makeup residue easily or not. However, shortly after use and for the next hour or so my face felt tight. I purposely did not use any moisturizer to see what the effect would be, so this tightening is contributed solely to the cleanser. It doesn't necessarily feel dry, but I didn't care for the tightness which happened with or without moving my face; it's like a slight pulling.

Overall, it's a fairly decent value considering it doesn't take a lot of product. It does cleanse well and leaves the face feeling refreshed. Sadly, it did have significant tightening after use on my normal to dry skin. Oily skin may have a different result.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser, Gentle Makeup Removal with Plant-Derived Glycolipid Agents, 5.1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I love the price compared to the results. Such a clean feeling, goes on smooth, wipes off easily and feels good to the skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser, Gentle Makeup Removal with Plant-Derived Glycolipid Agents, 5.1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser is absolutely fantastic! This cleanser has become an essential part of my skincare routine. It’s incredibly gentle yet effective at removing makeup and impurities without stripping my skin. The plant-derived glycolipid agents work wonders – my skin feels soft, clean, and refreshed after every use. As someone who has started developing rosy cheeks due to Rosacea, cleansers tend to make the redness flare up. After using this cleanser I've noticed the usual redness several shades paler. The more I use it the paler it gets. While not gone entirely it is FAR better than it was. It may not work on everyone, but for me, that alone is worth the investment. And it's not even that much since The Ordinary is fantastically affordable. I have several of their products already and am happy to add this one to the lineup.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser, Gentle Makeup Removal with Plant-Derived Glycolipid Agents, 5.1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Play Video
I have very sensitive skin and used to have the hardest time finding products that agree with my face, then I found The Ordinary.
I have so many products of theirs and this one is just as amazing as the others.
It’s my first time using face wash on dry skin and I was worried that it might not remove all the dirt and make up but I was mistaken, it gently cleanses my face and leaves my face feeling soft and clean.
Usually when I wash my face, my face would feel extremely dry after and my rosacea would flare up, but this face wash calms my skin and makes it less red and look and feel healthy!
The bottle itself is very large and you only need a little bit of product so this will last you a while plus, like so many other The Ordinary products, the price for this face wash is extremely reasonable but will give you major effects!

Love!

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser, Gentle Makeup Removal with Plant-Derived Glycolipid Agents, 5.1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This is a creamy cleanser. It does not foam but feels more like an old-fashioned cold cream when I apply to my dry face (per package directions). However, it feels much lighter/less greasy than a cold cream. It has enough moisturizers to be gentle on my somewhat sensitive and now winter-dry skin. It rinses off easily with a few splashes of warm water. My combination type skin is left feeling thoroughly cleansed but not too dry. I also have never had any kind of irritation or reaction after using this.

This cleanser does its job well at a value price.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser, Gentle Makeup Removal with Plant-Derived Glycolipid Agents, 5.1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Left my skin feeling clean and soft. The bottle is a good size and value for money.

Product Name: The Ordinary Glycolipid Cream Cleanser, Gentle Makeup Removal with Plant-Derived Glycolipid Agents, 5.1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This is my first time ever hearing of "The Ordinary" skin care brand, but I have to say I'm impressed.

It felt cooling on the skin, did not leave any type of irritation/redness, and after several days of use my skin feels noticeably more clear while not being dried out. I'm really happy with this, and think I've finally found my replacement for my discontinued go to cleanser (Neutrogena pore reduction cleanser).

5/5. I love this and will be purchasing it at full price in the future. I plan on adding this to my subscribe and save.

ReviewText: This is an incredibly gentle cream cleanser. I did try it with water and it does not lather, but it has a nice lightweight sort of creaminess that still feels like it's doing a cleansing job. A tiny bit goes a long way and rinses off clean, and it left my face so soft and glowing.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This serum by The Ordinary has been working really well on my skin. It's supposed to help balance and clarify the skin and refine pores and I think it's helping with that. It's a gentle formula so you probably won't notice dramatic changes after one use, but after multiple uses I do find that my skin is less oily and my pores are looking less congested. I use this as part of a multi-step routine and find that it works well with other my products.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This serum is really nice. I like how it feels on my skin and it absorbs quickly. It layers really nicely with my other products and it has been helping my oily areas. I don't get as shiny throughout the day and my pores look great.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The serum feels a semi thick when applying to the skin, but after application and spreading over the skin, it feels light and airy. The serum has not caused any breakouts yet but did help control my oil better than other serums I've tried (I have an oily face). The serum works great by itself already but definitely works best if followed up by moisturizer. So far after a week of use it has controlled my breakouts pretty good and hopefully it will continue to work as time goes on.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I love The Ordinary's products. I love this serum, and have noticed a decrease in active breakouts, oil production, and congestion! A little goes a long way - only a few drops is needed for my entire face.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Like every other product from The Ordinary that I've tried, this one also is excellent. Lightweight and absorbs quickly. I use this serum under my daily moisturizer. Their products cost a fraction of what other companies charge. Overall I really like this brand and will continue to purchase!

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum is made for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, as well as finding areas of your skin where you could have some issues, or congestion. The formula is light, goes on smoothly and dries down to create a light blanket of protection as it does work throughout the day. Although I rarely get breakouts, it came in time to help me treat one at the moment, and I appreciate how gentle it is so I look forward to clearer skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This facial serum is great! I would say it has worked really well for me to help unclog my pores and to help reduce oiliness, which is exactly what it says it would do. It feels nice on my skin. It didn’t feel sticky or tacky at all to me. It has amazing ingredients in it which are all really great for your skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Great balancing oil! I love the lightness of this oil. It’s not all thick and sticky. It’s very nice. It has virtually no scent and it absorbs really well.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The balancing and clarifying serum is easy to apply and absorbs quickly into the skin. It feels lightweight and comfortable. I like the hydration it provides without the greasiness. It also gently exfoliates and makes my skin look smoother. It has a clean mild scent that is not overpowering. I like it so far and will most possibly order again. Good value for the price.

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum is Great!
It soaks into my skin fast and feels weightless.
My skin feels soft, smooth, and moisturized.
I love it!
Great Value!

Product Name: The Ordinary Balancing & Clarifying Serum, Multi-Active Solution for Oil Control and Pore Refinement, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: My combination skin have a lot of issues, and this serum to be completely honest addresses most of them really, takes care of dryness but also controls oils especially on my t zone, where I have bumps and dots and lots of yuk. Absolutely fantastic, absorbs fairly quickly and works well with my moisturizer. Definitely amazing and I’m super happy with it, no issues or irritations!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Well, with this product, personally, it doesn't work for me at all, literally anything, and if they say it first, but that doesn't work miracles, you have to be constant if people were all that and nothing, it doesn't work for me like that, well, that's why I'll give it 1 ⭐

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
I really wanted to love this product. It’s so lightweight and easy to apply. I am in my mid 40s, fair-skin and prone to mild redness particularly after drinking alcohol or with heat. The lactic acid product is less than amazing. No reduced redness and no brightening of my skin or evened out skin tone as product claims.
What it did do, it broke me out all over my face and I never had pimples anywhere except my forehead in the past in my 20’s..

Definitely do not recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Either this isn't actually The Ordinary's product, or it has been corrupted in some manner. I noticed immediately that the liquid was way too watery compared with the product I usually got (I have only ever bought TO from their site). I tried to apply it and it was literally like dry water. No substance to it whatsoever. I couldn't even spread it across my face, it dried immediately. The smell was off for what it is normally as well. Save yourself the trouble and just buy from TO themselves, they ship fast.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Terrible! Will never order from here again. The box was beat up, looked old, and the bottle had no plastic seal. I don’t trust the product. Next time I will run in and buy at Ulta instead.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: The product came with no tamper seal. I used it at night with no other products, other than my normal lotion. The next morning I woke up with patches of red and itchy skin, and little red bumps all over my face. My eyes burned and my lips were very dry.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin

ReviewText: I've been using Good Genes by Sunday Riley and wanted something that works as well but doesn't cost $80. Based on reviews, I purchased this product but the jury is still out. Good Genes is thick, white and moisturizing. This product is more like an oil and doesn't seem to moisturize as well. I will continue using it but I am not impressed with the hype.

ReviewText:
Don’t see any difference but maybe you will. I’m giving it a neutral rating for that reason.
What I can say is that I have sensitive skin and did not have any burning or peeling after using this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I've heard great things about this lactic acid serum from the ordinary, but I don't think my skin likes it or agrees with it. I have sensitive skin so I started out using this only once a week because I didn't want it to cause redness or peeling. Within the first week of using it I started noticing I was breaking out in acne. I thought maybe it was hormonal acne or just a coincidence so I kept using it, but I continued to notice more and more bumps. Once I stopped using it, my skin started clearing up. I guess my skin just doesn't like it. I've seen amazing results using a Retinol though so I'll just stick to that. I also really love the Nip+Fab glycolic extreme night pads. They are gentle and effective. Highly recommend those.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This might be the "holy grail" but returning for lack of information on how long to leave on & more

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I bought this not really knowing what to expect, but It has the consistency and smell of water. I used it after watching Hot and Flashy, and most of her recommendations are excellent. However, this product seemed pretty useless, and hard to apply. It did not cause any harm, and I have no frame of reference for this product, so I really can't say if it is a fake or not. That being said, I will not purchase it again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Your mileage may vary. Used this for a few months every other night and I couldn't tell if it was even doing anything. I've used heavier retinoids like prescription tretinoin gel, so my face is pretty resilient already, so I had to move up to 10% to feel any effect and even then I'm not sure it is doing anything.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
I have used this serum for a few months and at first it definitely cleared up some of my acne but it can only do so much. Lactic acid brings the acne up faster so I never don’t have acne. I still have black heads and my pores got bigger. There was less redness in my skin but after a day of walking around I still get red anyways. Overall, it helped my skin to a certain extent but I could live without it.

Also, they recommend you dilute it first in order for your skin to get used to it. It didn’t take me long to get used to it but that just meant that I used up the tiny bottle faster. It’s also very watery. I really loved it at first but I’ve become pretty disappointed. It’s good for less Oily skin types and it’s best if you already have clear skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: The product works just fine. I do think it's a little more watery than normally. I bought the same product from The Ordinary website, it was $6.50 and thicker. I would probably just stick to ordering from the site rather than amazon. Took a couple days longer to ship but it was worth it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Product feels very nice on my skin However I have not really seen any difference yet. I’ve been using it for about six weeks now. I’m hoping for better results soon

ReviewText: Very good

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I have bad skin that's dry and lots of acne. I would sometimes get flaky skin on my nose in the winter I always use salicylic acid every day but it only helps my acne and isn't too effective for exfoliating i thought lactic acid would help get rid of the flakes. It did work well with the flakes but it made my acne worse so I stopped using it. A few weeks ago I decided I would see if it did anything to my ingrown hairs. It works very well as a gentle exfoliator down there I use it the day before I shave and have noticed a significant reduction of ingrowns! Yay! Glad I found a use for it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I bought this for my skin after my 2nd pregnancy, I noticed postpartum my skin had more of those weird bumps that aren’t pimples but add texture to your skin. I’ve always had clear skin so I noticed these bumps and researched exfoliation serums I had them on my cheeks, and the back of my arms. I used this serum on my face one night and the next day 90% of the bumps were gone. I tried it on the back of my arms where the bumps were, and next day I showered and so much skin flaked off and most of the bumps are gone. It’s pretty incredible. I’m also using it on my postpartum belly and stretch marks to help regenerate the skin alongside retinol (not at the same time.) I have also used it on my foot calluses which are not severe. I do use an SPF of 45 with these products.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 1 oz/30 mL has been a game-changer in my skincare routine, offering gentle yet effective exfoliation and hydration.

What sets this product apart is its formulation: the 5% lactic acid concentration provides a mild exfoliation that helps to improve skin texture and tone without causing irritation. Lactic acid is known for its ability to gently slough off dead skin cells, revealing smoother and brighter skin underneath.

The addition of hyaluronic acid (HA) further enhances its benefits by attracting and retaining moisture, keeping my skin hydrated and plump after exfoliation. This combination makes it suitable for those with dry or dehydrated skin looking to improve overall skin health.

I've noticed visible improvements in the appearance of my skin since incorporating this product into my routine. My complexion appears more even, with reduced dullness and fewer texture issues over time.

The packaging is practical and hygienic, with a dropper that dispenses the perfect amount of product. It's also fragrance-free, which is ideal for sensitive skin types.

While it's important to start slowly with exfoliating products to avoid over-exfoliation, I've experienced no adverse reactions with this formula.

Overall, The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA is a fantastic option for anyone seeking a gentle yet effective exfoliating treatment that delivers noticeable results. It's affordable, easy to incorporate into a skincare regimen, and backed by The Ordinary's commitment to simplicity and transparency in skincare.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I used this product the first night!! Let me tell you... the next morning I could tell the refreshes of my face. My face was a Lil red, but it's always that way. My face was bright for most of the day. You dont want to use this any other acid products. Make sure to Moisturize after you wash ur face, from having the acid toner on... that's very important. Using a V-C serum is good. That's what I use the next day, and a good moisturizer. Also you shouldn't use this acid toner every night. I guess yourself can be the judge. It's a really good product I think. Oh Lil goes a long way.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: Love this latic acid. It's gentle yet effective and at its price point, it's 5 stars 🌟. Use it on damp skin and follow the directions. If you aren't used to exfoliaters like this- start at once or 2xs a week. I use it 3xs sometimes 4xs a week usually in the winter I use it more. Depending on how my skin is that week. I even use this woth retinol. Only bc I'm used to it. Don't do this if you,never used retinol or haven't built up the tolerance. I looked it up, you can do this only if it's a gentle latic acid and your skin,has built up a tolerance for both retinol and this. I use the latic acid and retinol only once* a week together** That's it! I see people spending so much on latic acid when I think it's better spend on your retinol/vitamin c or a good moisturizer/ eye cream. Don't mix with other aha/bha obviously or retinol (only if you built up a tolerance you can use together once a week) use this after your toner and or essence. After the latic acid use something that's hydrating like: ceramide serum like coco kind - panthenol serum from some by mi- Vichy 89- the purito centella serum - cosrx propolis serum- naturium barrier support serum-( i think thats what the name is) these are some of what I use after the latic acid to protect and hydrate my skin barrier, then top it with a hydrating moisturizer. You'll have the most plump and glowy skin in the morning. It's insane how it helps with texture, it exfoliates while leaving your skin so soft and no bad reactions since latic acid is the gentlest of acids✨️🌟✨️🌟✨️

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I have been struggling with tretinoin for years. Everyone says how important it is, but I was frustrated with the constant flaking, which I called "face dandruff." Not appealing! Well, it was a-peeling. I tried many exfoliants, including enzymes, scrubs, and a glycolic toner, but the toner was too harsh to use daily and the flaking persisted. My esthetician suggested a lactic acid, as it targets the surface skin and is gentler, so it could be used daily. Familiar with the Ordinary, I purchased this and have been using six nights per week, about an hour before applying the Retin-A. Flaking is gone and my skin is smooth!! I was about ready to give up on Retin-A, but this has fixed the problem. Already ordered another bottle.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText:
I've struggled with acne for decades now. It took me about that long to figure out that no soap or cleanser was ever going to work on my face and it took me just a little bit longer than that to figure out physical exfoliators were not the way to go.

As someone with acne, of course I've tried special cleansers and benzoyl peroxide and salicylic acid and retinoid cream and basically all the normal suspects. My face always feels like it's flaking and cracking apart after only one use, even with the lowest concentration products I can find. It turns out using lactic acid really makes a difference. I can use this 2-3 times a week and my skin stays clearer, doesn't get dried out, and doesn't have flakes of dead skin everywhere.

I even discovered that if I spot treat a cystic pimple I can feel coming up with this 5-6 times a day, the pimple will retreat within a couple days instead of taking weeks to heal. I take oral medication for the acne, but it hasn't worked at the same concentration since my pregnancy and I still get the cystic suckers once or twice every month. This is the only external thing I've ever found that can actually help once they start forming.

These days I wash only with water and a gentle once-over with a cloth. I use this exfoliator every 2-3 days all over my face just before bed. I follow up with a drop or two of jojoba oil as a moisturizing barrier after every wash, except for under my eyes where lotion works much better. My skin looks as good as it probably ever will and I don't have to ride such a crazy rollercoaster of emotions about my acne.

It may not be the conventional advice or routine, but apparently my skin is a sensitive mf and it works for me. Something finally works for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I’ve repurchased this a few times so I’m familiar with this product. It does a wonderful job at exfoliating my skin. I used this one day and the next I use a glycolic acid and continue this process everyday. This helps my skin turnover rate and my skin is so clear and smooth. I like that this has no scent and when I run out and stop using it my skin changes back to being clogged.

ReviewText:
I usually only buy directly from deciem.com which is considerably a better price, more information and all of the ordinary products on the website. My toddler had gotten ahold of my previous bottle and dumped it, i needed more asap and didn’t want to wait for shipping. Going against my better judgment and fear after reading the other comments, i jumped the gun and ordered off amazon.
I am very happy i did and was overwhelmed with joy when my face felt instantly softer than before. I missed using it in my routine only 4 days, and after one use could tell the difference the next morning. Don’t listen to the negative reviews. This is 100% the real ordinary product and imo worth the extra money for the faster delivery not buying direct.

TLDR- 100% the deal

I use it a few times (maybe 3-4 times a week) as the first layer and then use serums and moisturiser on my face and neck. I try to use it at night, but i have used it in the morning too but i definitely use plenty spf idf i do!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: This works great! It's great quality and does everything lactic acid should. It helps to lighten the dark marks I have and softens my skins appearance and feel. It has helped me get my adult acne under control. I absolutely would recommend!

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: I suffer with PCOS and 2 weeks out of each month I have hard cysts and bumps on my face & chest. My anxiety pushes me to pop and try to squeeze them. Then comes the black marks that never go away. I’ve been using Sulfur to bring them to a head, Oshun black soap to cleanse, ordinary lactic acid and rose hip oil. No more itchy face , I’ve only gotten 1 cyst this month prior to period ! 1 compared to 50 ! I believe the Acid helps to keep my skin clear and free of bacteria. The acid doesn’t really help my chest though, the bumps are still there but my face is clear.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin
ReviewText: It's mild, just as the reviews mentioned, not irritating to my skin at all and not causing any hyper-pigmentation if I get sun exposure (i'm extra careful though). I have dry skin and was concerned that it would burn and dry out my skin even more, but not using it every night and using a moisturizer after it has dried/before i go to bed, seems to be working well for me. About 2 or 3 days after using it (2 nights in a row), i used cotton with a few drops of baby oil on it (coconut oil may be better) to gently exfoliate and the dead skin came of easily, leaving my face feeling nice and smooth. I plan on continuing this way until/unless the results change.

Product Name: The Ordinary Lactic Acid 5% + HA 2%, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Smoother Skin

Be aware it's an exfoliator so it will dry out the skin to some degree and needs to be used with a moisturizer or serum for best effects.

I gave 1 star for this product because I was so desperate to get this cleanser after running out & Ulta in my area not having it. I broke down & ordered even though Amazon only offered 1 option to buy. It was the smallest bottle for $15 when the bigger one is literally about $18 in stores. So after spending the most for this little bottle, I take it out the package, remove the seal for me to basically to see half the bottle was air!! Came back to check the reviews annnnd what do you know, first one was saying the same thing. SMH Wish that was there when I ordered! Never again

ReviewText: This Hass to go to the list of the biggest let downs I’ve had so far with facial products. I have heard so many amazing things about this cleanser. And I’m thinking like OK this is gonna be gray, it might fill them up a little bit, it might be pretty thick to really do it’s job. It did the complete opposite. My skin has been so irritated for like the longest now since I’ve been using it. My skin burns in certain areas because of it. It does not so much one bit at all. And on top of that too it is so freaking sad that it literally just runs out of your hands. I am so disappointed. Do not get this item

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I like the product but unfortunately this container does not contain the 50ml. I used it once then on my second use tonight I had to squeeze the tube almost to the bottom to get even a tiny squirt out! Very disappointed.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I wanted to try this so bad and when I got it I was like what the hell I'm going to just stick to cetaphil or carave because it felt like lotion, STICKY LOTION I honestly can't I don't get the hype I'm almost wondering if I bought the correct product maybe I got a default because so many people can't all be wrong rite??

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I have acne prone skin, and purchased this product because the description lists it as being "non comedogenic." However, the product itself has no mention of being non comedogenic. After using it for a little less than a week, my acne is considerably worse.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I love this product and have been buying it for over a year. But with my recent order, there was barely anything in the tube. Picture shows how little is inside before even using it. All mostly air. Extremely disappointed!

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I'm not sure if it's normal but when I opened it and squized the contents out and so much air came out it was half empty. I think the product itself is great but maybe don't by it from amazon.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: The container was empty. I was very surprised

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I’m pretty sure this was the source of my super clogged pores. I wanted to try this because I love the ordinary products but this definitely was not something I would recommend. It was definitely clogging my pores

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Not what I was expecting and didn’t really cleanse face.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: A very “meh” product from a brand I normally love! Pass!

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: This tube I received was half full!

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Not a good value... I unsealed the bottle, so I know this is the way they are filling it and not that some product was lost in shipping. They give you a large tube to make you feel like you are getting more than you are. From the first squeeze, I had to go down to the bottom quarter of the tube to get any product to come out. Even at that... It whistled at me (just the way it would when you are trying to get the last bits out of something almost empty.) Although I love the way this cleans, I will not buy it again.... There are better values out there. The Ordinary has really lost their identity and I hope they get it back. Providing quality ingredients at a great value and not chincing out on what they give the customer. Literally less than 10 washes in the tube...

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I love The ordinary products, especially the serums and thats why I tried the face wash for the first time. however I was disappointed as it didn't do anything for my skin. After the first use my skin felt very dry although its combination skin. the formula is almost runny in consistency and feels like it has stripped the skin of necessary moisture. first and last purchase of the face wash for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText:
As the name suggests, it cleans quite well, no smell. But I rather regret my purchase:
- already, for the price and quantity that it is! 30.36 euros an order for 150 ml is nothing at all. I thought it was a lot more mastoc, like in the photo!
- With 30.36 euros I do a lot of things in my life, I offer sushi to a Polish person, I take him camping with wild boars 🤡. It's way too expensive for what it is, even if quality can be an argument but all the same.
- the delivery time: I was supposed to receive it at the end of March, so that in the end I was told that I was going to have it a little late, with no fixed date. For 30.36 euros the order it was better to come quickly! SHAME! Then no message to know that it was delivered too...
If you are not a pigeon and you respect yourself, your person and your money at least, beware.
#Je_suis_pas_un_pigeon #gardez_votre_argent_parce_que_c is_the_crisis

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: The product was open when I received.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I really feel cheated by the little product this can has, I don't know if they all come with such a small amount. In case the bottle is small and I can assure you that it does not have half the product. This won't last me even 2 weeks.

ReviewText: Look for something else

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: the bottle felt half full when I received it

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Poor value for money

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I usually use Burts Bees Soapbark face wash which is a miracle product for combination skin with an oily T zone. But I got bored so I tried this after hearing that squalene is a gentle cleanser. It works ok and IS gentle. Not sure it works as well as Burts Bees soapbark and there is less of it at about the same price. It feels like washing my face with oil and is less creamy. If your face is reacting to products or you think you should be using moisturizing oil on your skin, this is worth a try. If you have skin redness or breakage or crusty flakes around an oily nose, and boy do I ever, the Burts Bees facewash is creamier and heals my skin and lasts a long time. But The Ordinary Squalene Cleanser is a good moisturizer. Might use both as phases in a Korean skincare inspired routine. Burts Bees wins if I can have just one.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Not good for seniors. Drying.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Not the best wash in my opinion. It does not lather, even a little, and I have noticed no change in the appearance of my skin. Also, you can not use this cleaner as a make up remover at all! I would not recommended or buy this face wash again. I do own the toner and zinc from the same company; I love those! Shipping was fast and efficient.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I love this line of skin care but honestly this cleanser leaves a lot to be desired. I never quite felt like my skin was clean and I found I had more clogged pies than usual. Won’t purchase again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: This face wash is so good for my face but as I opened the bottle to use for the first time, a bunch of air came out as I squeezed the bottle which meant the bottle had very little product in it! Was it just my bottle or did anyone experience this also?!? I’m so disappointed with the amount of product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I’m not sure if this product is supposed to have a center now but from what I have to been able to tell it doesn’t and I really love that, however I will say read the directions before you actually use it and it doesn’t work that great as make make up remover but works wonderful and was a facial cleanser

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Leaves my face feeling unclean due to the oil base and does not remove my eye make up very well. Kind of disappointing. I do like the toner, hyaluronic(not sure if I spelled that right) acid serum and moisturizer that I purchased at the same time.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText:
there was very little product in the bottle. i'm not sure if this is normal or not, but i was suprised how empty the tube was.

i do love this product, i just feel like i might have gotten a defective product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: This is a very mild cleanser that leaves your face feeling clean and your skin feeling hydrated. I love the product but it's a fraction of the price, $7, at your local Ulta store. That's where i will get mine from now on.

ReviewText: For some reason I assumed this was a bigger bottle for the price. It’s not. You can get it a little cheaper through the company.

ReviewText: Wasn’t that impressed with this product. It cleans your face fairly well but it is a very thin cleanser and it doesn’t feel like it’s doing much.

ReviewText: Although my skin was soft and moisturized, there isn't much in this bottle at all. It also left a lot of make-up & dirt on my skin. It's a no for me.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: This cleanser is a bit pricey. The small tube can go very fast if used daily.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I love The Ordinary brand proposition, and have been looking for a less expensive alternative to the sensitive skin care brands that I normally use. So far my skin is not reacting, but the product takes ages to absorb properly and leaves a weird residue on the surface of my skin. So sadly, not for me, but worth a try at the price.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I have combination skin and this was an okay cleanser. It felt nice and you don't need that much to clean your face, but I also felt like it didn't clean my face well enough, especially eye makeup. I was a little disappointed because I'd heard so much about The Ordinary and was expecting something better than just okay. Still, I plan to continue using it in the morning until it's gone, but will definitely buy a different cleanser later.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: An amazing product that has helped my skin so much, highly recommended! HOWEVER you can get the same product, double the size, for half the price if you shop directly from their store.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier

ReviewText: Great cleanser for the price. I use it for my morning cleanser. It is tacky and bleh until you warm it up with your hands/face. Once you do, tho, it is a good consistency. I am super sensitive to most skin products and it doesn't irritate my skin - a huge win.

fantastic cleanser, for anyone, anything.
feels a lil oily at first but washes off easily and cleans well.

ReviewText: I was recommended this product by a skin care professional because I struggle with dark spots and dry skin so I gave it a try and I noticed the clean feeling I felt after using, the moisturizing action and gentleness of the product.

ReviewText: Not bad. Not great. Leaves my skin looking good, but not a great facial cleaner.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Product helps to remove any oil or makeup very well! I recommend!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: This is one of my favorite face care products.

ReviewText: Amazing product, love it!!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: It arrived well sealed and on time, I'll see this week how it works on my skin and if it really works.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: I was a bit surprised at first because it is a cream-like substance that you rub into your hands and then apply to dry face and rub until the consistency changes to oily. But I'm thrilled. I've never used a better makeup remover than this cleanser. It does not sting the eyes, it cleanses the skin deep into the pores without creating a feeling of tightness and even the deposits on the nose are gone. I've never done that with any other means before. Not even with peel-off masks.

Product Name: The Ordinary Squalane Cleanser, Hydrating Makeup Remover, Supports Moisture Barrier
ReviewText: Its good mix of cleaning and still not stripping the skin of moisture. In love with this product
