Product Name: The Ordinary Matrixyl 10% + HA, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Wrinkles, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This goes after your fine lines and wrinkles. I especially use it on my forehead, eyes and around my lips, it makes a noticeable difference! I have used it in both my am & pm routines and like to pair it with Argireline - the 2 together are just a power house against signs of aging! Both of these serums are water based and should be used towards the beginning of your routine for your face and neck.

Product Name: The Ordinary Matrixyl 10% + HA, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Wrinkles, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Been using this for a little over a month and my "turkey neck" has noticably firmed up and my face is tighter. Hasn't erased my wrinkles but a very nice improvement much better than other products I've tried. Just ordered my second bottle. Can't wait to see how another 30 days looks

Product Name: The Ordinary Matrixyl 10% + HA, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Wrinkles, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is a must have serum to keep your skin supple and youthful. I use just a couple of drops at night after cleaning. They offer the best products for amazing prices. Try the other ones, and the salicylate acid if you have any blemishes. I use that to reduce my pores and keep down any oily areas.

Product Name: The Ordinary Matrixyl 10% + HA, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Wrinkles, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I switched to Ordinary Matrixyl about a year ago. I really try to take good care of my skin especially now that I’m almost 80. Sun damage, living in high altitude, dryness and air pollution needs attention. I believe along with good exercise, nutritious food and skin products, this has helped make my skin smoother. Ordinary is not expensive. Many believe the more expensive products are better. Not necessarily so.

Product Name: The Ordinary Matrixyl 10% + HA, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Wrinkles, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Ok there is no better value on peptides out there. Now will peptides work for you? This is the product to buy to find out. I actually think I do see a little lifting. But I sometimes feel a little sticky. Well I use a lot...because it's so inexpensive. I use this during the day and hyalauric acid at night. I'm 70. My skin looks better than most 50 year olds. No wrinkles at all, but it's really hard to combat the sag, especially at the jawline.

Product Name: The Ordinary Matrixyl 10% + HA, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Wrinkles, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Too early to know for sure as I’ve been using for just a few weeks, first bottle about half used. It’s thick and kindof sticky, so I follow it up with some Aureuvedic oil blend at nighttime get everything pressed in. I use it in conjunction with the copper serum because I hear both are good at night and can be used together. I’ll update more later if there’s more to add!

ReviewText:
THIS STUFF IS AMAZING! I absolutely saw benefits from the very first use, but of course it only got better over time. I didn’t order it from Amazon, as I got it straight from The Ordinary, but figured it didn’t hurt to come here & leave an honest review anyway. I’m turning 40 in a couple weeks & began noticing wrinkles appearing over the past year, specifically between my eyebrows & laugh lines. The line between my eyebrows is pretty much GONE, I can just see a faintly discolored line where the wrinkle was. As far as the laugh lines, they’re less noticeable but more difficult to get rid of since I try to laugh everyday 😏.

This is a must buy if you’re seeing wrinkles that you want to banish before they get worse. I can’t speak for anyone who’s had wrinkles for a while or have deep folds, but I do think this would help that also.

Product Name: The Ordinary Matrixyl 10% + HA, Anti-Aging Serum for Fine Lines and Wrinkles, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’m 43. I smoke. I like the sun. I was seriously starting to research alternatives. This stuff in conjunction w the ordinarys argireline , and their hylauronic acid 2 % 2x a day has saved my face! Lol. Seriously. I wish I took before pics. Its softened ALL of my lines a noticeable amount! And given my skin a long forgotten glow. It’s cheap enough that I don’t care if I have to use it all forever. So happy. (I do give credit to using these 3 products together)

ReviewText:
Without a doubt, the best skin care product I’ve ever used. I previously tried The Ordinary’s HA and retinol products buy wasn’t that impressed. I’d read about matrixyl and thought I’d give this a go. I’m so glad I did as my skin has never looked or felt better.

If you’re noticing the first signs of ageing or just feel like your skin needs a pick-me-up, this product is highly recommended.

ReviewText: I have just left a review lamenting how this products more expensive sister 'Buffet left me with a constellation of spots across my face for the 4 weeks I experimented with it for. I finished up the bottle of acne and have come back to my old faithful. Matrixyl and HA is amazing. It moisturiser, softens lines and leaves my skin clear and smooth. It works better than some £60 serums I have purchased. Nice texture, slightly tacky which is a good base for make up. I use it every morning and night and a bottle lasts about a month. I will be buying again and again..

It absorbs well and a couple of drops go a long way, with no residual oiliness and no spots.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This is my first time buying a cosmetic with retinol, and according to my information, some of the things you might notice after use were irritation and peeling. Something normal.

After having used it for a month progressively, I haven't noticed anything at all. Basically it's an oil. It's not worth it. It doesn't have the effect you'd expect from a product with retinol.

I waited to write this review after trying another serum. And in this case, with two applications separated by a week, the skin has started to flake in some areas.

So I confirm my suspicions. I will not buy this product again. And I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Applied this once and l ended up with a very itchy face some stinging and a poor night of sleep. I have tried tretinoin (0.025) in the past and never had that problem. I had to stop using tretinoin because after a few weeks of use it caused rashes on my cheeks; l have mild rosacea. I thought that maybe l should have started with retinol first and decided to give this a go, but the weird stingy, itchy reaction was enough for me. Never again. Mild strength tretinoin and retinol are apparently quite beneficial to rosacea sufferers, but after these experiences l would recommend forking out the money and seeing a dermatologist first. If you have sensitive skin or issues with inflammatory skin problems proceed with caution. I reckon if l had used the ordinary product a second night then l might have ended up with a rash.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Avoid at all costs if you have sensitive dry skin. I tried this product for about a month to try and minimise wrinkles and it left hyperpigmentation and dark marks on my upper cheeks and forehead. At first I thought this was just signs of purging but by week 5 now it is only getting worse and I have decided to stop using the product. I am still wondering if the dark patches and redness will fade. It's frustrating when you've spent so long dealing with skin issues only to go back the way.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Update: This is my 3rd bottle that I’ve ordered from them. This oil was not the same color as the previous 2 bottles. It has a bad odor and it is not working. It leaves my face feeling oily. I have read on other reviews of similar situations but I thought maybe they were just complainers. Nope! I absolutely loved my first two bottles but this 3rd bottle was a waste of money. I lowered it from my original 5 star review to 3 stars.

I’ve been using this product every night before bed for about 3 weeks. It is oily going on, which made me nervous at first. With other oil based products I usually get breakouts. This did not cause a breakout. It seems to soak in within about a half hour.

Result: I have been very happy with the results. I was getting pretty significant wrinkles around me eyes. They seemed to have really gotten deeper in the past few months. That is why I decided to try this. I wish I had done before and after pictures. Those deep wrinkles are much softer. They are not gone but soft enough that I don’t feel self conscious about them.

Advice: do a before and after picture.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Love the original squalane oil, but this has a lot of additives that I did not realize. It is not fungal acne safe and cause me to breakout a bunch. Please do not use if you have fungal acne!

ReviewText: I don't feel I used it long enough. Not a huge difference but there is an ever so slight one.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
A great product to get you started with retinol. I’d heard lots of good things about The Ordinary and I wasn’t disappointed.

The product goes on nicely. The moisturising effect of squalane balances out the drying effect of retinol so I had no problems with dryness or redness. I use jojoba oil as my moisturiser so used this on top as normal, and also an SPF during the day.

I definitely noticed my skin looked clearer and brighter after a few weeks of use, however I felt my skin could tolerate a bit more so I have recently started using the 0.5 version, which is incredible!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: As usual with the ordinary there is no BS with this product, it does exactly what it says it does. The only problem I have with this product is that it makes your skin feel very heavy on the night you put it on as it doesn't absorb as well as other retinol products I have tried, it's by no means unbearable but it is a bit off putting when you are trying to sleep and rest your face on the pillow

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: It is a very hydrating oil but I get pimples with it, the first time I stopped using it and they were removed, I tried it again and again my forehead with small pimples, so I will use it only in the cheekbone area... I will not buy it again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: After integrating retinol into my skincare routine, I initially didn't notice significant changes. However, over time, I've observed that my skin has become noticeably more radiant and firmer. While I can't pinpoint whether these improvements are solely due to the retinol or the overall routine, I'm impressed with the results and plan to continue using it. One standout feature is the applicator, which I love for its ease of use and precision

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I wish I had taken some before and afters so I could show how much this helps! For context, I’m 30 and have some age appropriate wrinkles on my forehead and between my eyebrows, even without frowning. This retinol has made them completely go away with just a few uses! I’m not super consistent with my skincare (I get laaazy at night) but applying this every other day for a few weeks made a huge difference.
The mix is pretty light (not oily at all) and applies easily! You need very little to cover your whole face so it lasts a while. I haven’t noticed any strong scent when applying.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: A friend of mine introduced me to The Ordinary. I decided to try the retinol and I have seen great results. I have had comments on it skin glowing and some of my sun spots of lightened or disappeared. The price is very reasonable and I love that dermatologists recommend this. It has been the best retinol product I have tried. I have used higher priced products and they haven’t compared. At 54, I have tried many products and this one impresses me!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
So far I have used it for 4 days and yes there is a noticeable difference. Not crazy but i have been waking up with super smooth clean. (Also, to be transparent, I did just start a whole new skincare routine). This retinol I use at night after my cleanse and moisturiser.

I added the cerave SA cleaner, and the Paula’s Choice, Verse Dew point moisturiser in the morning. At night I do my regular cleaner, retinol, and my moisturiser :) that way you can see what else I am adding. I can’t 100% attribute my clearer skin to this but I can attribute my smooth AM “I woke up like this” to the retinol.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have sensitive skin, but this product gently exfoliates and deeply moisturizes my face. LOVE it…. This is my second jar. Completely endorse.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
really dislike this product. It gave me way more acne than i started with. What I mean is, before I used this, I had 1 or 2 pimples. After using it for 6 weeks, I got rather severe acne. Breaks outs everywhere. Not a purge, but a full on breakout. I got acne on areas of my face that I never got acne before. It was a nightmare. I am now using Curology, and that seems to be taking my newly severe acne down a notch.

I am uncertain about this product. I have been using it for almost 3 weeks now. My pores might look a little smaller, but other than that I am not too sure if it is working. I use it every other night. If i use it every night, I break out more. Every other night doesn't make me break out more than usual, but i still have acne in my troubled areas. I don't have any redness or irritation though. If there are any great changes in the future, I'll come back and edit my review

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I really didn’t know what to expect with this product and now I am in love! It leaves my skin feeling so soft and healthy, like my skin has a nice bounce. Really helps control my acne and my face has been really improving! Super gentle on my sensitive skin. Everyone needs this in their life. Don’t forget to use an SPF during the day if you use this product!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Im in my late 20s and I just started using retinol. Have no idea why i waited so long to try this! It doesn’t help with my blackheads but this product has helped me a lot with dark spots on my face! I don’t have sensitive skin so it doesn’t cause any irritation in my face! I like the ordinary in general! This retinol is worth trying!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I love this product! I noticed improvement within the first few days. I use the product every other day and I can tell my skin loves it. Before using, I had so many breakouts but especially around my cycle. But since I’ve started using, my acne dark spots have lightened and I have had very minimal breakouts.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’m 31 and started noticing under my eyes were looking a little dark. I researched and researched all the top brands and kept coming across this product. After trying some higher end brand and eye creams I have to say this stuff is by far the best product and has really helped to brighten under my eyes significantly. I am so glad I went with the product and this brand!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’ve used it nightly for four months. It works. Cheeks are more bouncy. Skin looks a decade younger. Many fine lines have left. Some deeper ones still there but less visible. No irritation. Even use under eyes - an area most needing this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The Ordinary brands are awesome delivering the chemical you need without the marketing and high price-tag. It comes in a small bottle and delivers on the promise. This Retinol is a great one to start with - no irritation or redness. The skin is smoother and clearer. Fine lines are less noticeable.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: If I could give this six stars I would. Literally cleared up my acne and VISIBLY reduced fine lines in 2 weeks. Best skincare purchase of my life. This a permanent part of my routine now.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This is the first anti age product I buy for myself (I'm 26). I was super confused about retinol, retinoids, hyaluronic acid etc. and was doing my own research on pros, cons and what to start with. Then I came across someone's review on Amazon for this precise product, who also seemed to have started with this serum and seemed very satisfied, so I gave it a go.
I had no redness nor peeling as the label warns you might experience. I use 5 drops in the evening before going to bed on my face (avoiding the soft skin under the eyes) and neck. Of course it's a little oily (duh it's a serum), but by the morning it's all been absorbed.
Ok: effects. My skin feels amazing. Soft, dewy, clear... It looks *great*. And the two fine lines I had on my forehead which I was obsessing over have started to look much more fine and kind of 'blended in my forehead' (ok that sounds weird, but their appearance has much improved - aka I can't notice them as much as before). There's no getting rid of wrinkles you already have, that much I know, but this product is great for starting the lifelong battle with age, making you feel like 'yep I'm an adult now and dealing with it', and it works really really well at making my complexion look healthy, moist and firm.
There's no good age to start using antiage products, but there definitely is in my experience a good product to start with :)

ReviewText: I liked it so far... and it’s too early to say anything..but yeah I can see some positive difference on my skin..smooth and soft

ReviewText: I can't recommend this enough. I was worried at first that it was retinol rather than the alternatives which are better for sensitive skin. But my skin is fine. I do feel that the day after applying I need not only suncream but a hat too as I can feel the skin a little tender put the results are amazing. I have seen a huge change in my skin. More smooth, more glow, the wrinkles are less noticeable. Only use on and off during the week. 4 applications in total.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I am 26 and this is my first Retinol product, it has 0.2% concentration, one of the lowest available. It is based in Squalane, which is a light non-comedogenic oil that prevents oxidation (retinol losing its effectiveness). Additionally it comes in a dark bottle which protects it from light.

I use it once a week on completely dry skin after cleansing (using it on wet could cause irritation) and only at night, because it makes skin more sensitive to UV lights and is therefore not recommended in the mornings. I usually wait 5-7 mins before applying a moisturiser to let it absorb fully. I have noticed my skin feels drier and tighter (normal side effects). I will continue to use it and slowly increase the frequency for my skin to get used to it. So far I am satisfied with the product.

UPDATE 28/11
I have now been using this for well over 6 months and whilst my skin was okay to start with, I have noticed some changes. My complexion is more dewy and I feel more comfortable without makeup. I have increased the frequency and I am now using this product 4-5 times a week. There was some redness at the beginning and my cheeks peeled slightly but apparently this is to be expected whilst the skin gets adjusted. I use about 1/3 of the dropper with each application and so far I have used about 3/4 of the bottle. Overall I am happy with this product and would recommend it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I arrive very well sealed!

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I bought this for some KP bumps on the back of my arms. I've been using it for about a month now, every night (bar the odd night where I forget). I also apply it to my face. On my arms, I can see a slow change, although this is probably not the only product to use for KP. As for my face, I've seen a change, again, not as fast as some of the other reviewers here have. It hasn't helped by acne and spots completely, but it has definitely changed the quality of my skin; it's more radiant and noticeably smoother. I have sensitive skin and yet apply this every night, so maybe I will consider increasing the strength for my next bottle.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: First time using retinol and so far so good

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This product was recommended to me by a friend. He advised me to start with a low strength and build up if I needed to, which is why I opted for 0.2%. The product is easy to apply and after one week of use I have noticed an improvement, especially on a stubborn patch of eczema that umpteen other products have failed to help. It acts like a peel so lots of little blemishes and blockages that have been under my skin for ages are now beginning to clear. I would definitely recommend this product 😊

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Very pleased with this product, using 0,2% for a start. I am new to The Ordinary as I was skeptical first of it but now it's my primary cosmetic. I used 30 day AM&PM different treatment-combinations of buffet+copper, H. acid +B5, Caffeine, retinol 0,2% and rose hip oil and could see the difference on my skin (reduction of redness & wrinkles, spots, black heads). Caffeine is the only product which I think didn’t do any difference. Skin adapted to the products in within a week.

Product Name: The Ordinary Retinol 0.2% in Squalane, Gentle Retinol Serum for the Face That Is Anti-Aging and Skin Smoothing, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have had really bad acne since last June when suffered berevement. Tried everything high street product. Bought this to add to the collection. Applied not expecting anything. 3 days later I could see a difference. My skin looked cool & not angry sore. My skin tone looked like me again. I cant tell you how pleased I am. Its a dripper with a light oil texture and I dont wear make up these days so wouldnt be able to tell you how good it is as a base but it absorbs beautifully.

ReviewText:

Since I expected some irritation that comes with retinol products I started with a low percentage like this. Happy to report I didn't have any irritation whatsoever (my skin did go through the purging part of it all, but that's to be expected with first time retinol use). I think irritation didn't occur because of squalane which has certain anti-inflammatory properties. All in all, I'm very happy with this product.
Seller has been extremely professional and polite and I definitely recommend buying from them.

Will give it a warm water bath as the website says to and if that does not work I will be returning this item.

ReviewText: It’s nice, consistency isn’t too thick unlike the Rose hip oil they offer and it doesn’t stink. Does a good job of moisturising. Can’t say I’ve noticed a difference in my skin though, I wouldn’t buy it again. Recently discovered how these natural oils can go rancid pretty quickly (as soon as six months) and I have very sensitive acne prone skin so I’m phasing this out, will still use as a body/hair oil though. I really recommend the squalane oil as it’s got more fatty acids that will help restore damaged skin moisture barriers, doesn’t go rancid and has more antioxidants properties from what I’ve read.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Cold-Pressed Virgin Marula Oil, Antioxidant-Rich, Unrefined Oil for Radiant Skin, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: THIS IS AN EXCELLENT OIL. IT HAS MANY BENEFICIAL SKIN PROPERTIES. I AM VERY PLEASED HOW WELL IT ABSORBS, DEEP INTO THE SKIN. I USE AN EXPENSIVE SUPERFOOD FACE OIL, BUT IT IS TOO GREASY FOR ME, AND SITS ON MY FACE, WITH A SHINY FILM. I USED THE ORGANIC MARULA OIL, TO DILUTE THE EXPENSIVE OIL, AND IT WORKS PERFECTLY. IT ABSORBS MUCH BETTER, AND MY FACE FEELS WELL HYDRATED, AND MUCH LESS GREASY.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Cold-Pressed Virgin Marula Oil, Antioxidant-Rich, Unrefined Oil for Radiant Skin, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I like this oil very much. I have bought much more expensive marula oils in the past. I saw this on Amazon and thought I would try it, and it as good if not better than any of them. It absorbs quickly into the skin and leaves your face with a satin finish. I have been happily using it for the last few months and will continue to do so.

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Cold-Pressed Virgin Marula Oil, Antioxidant-Rich, Unrefined Oil for Radiant Skin, 1 Fl Oz

Product Name: The Ordinary 100% Cold-Pressed Virgin Marula Oil, Antioxidant-Rich, Unrefined Oil for Radiant Skin, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I'm prone to VERY dry skin, and this has done it wonders. It's much thicker than some of the other oils I've previously used from the Ordinary (Chia and Rosehip) and this one so far is my favourite. Although it's heavier and richer, it absorbs much faster than the previous two, leaves almost no residue and has helped with my dry skin drastically. Very Happy

ReviewText: The mandelic acid I received from this seller/ amazon was expired. The bottle itself had a very pungent smell unlike previous bottles I have bought in store. Moreover, the consistency of the formula is very gooey instead of watery (which is the normal consistency for ordinary mandelic acid). Had I not known this before, I probably would have ruined my skin. Please save your bucks and buy from their website or in store, its also way cheaper.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I know about peeling and this is not a peel it's oil!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Received on time, opened and used it once. Very thin runny and greasy, made my face break out immediately the next morning. I washed it off my fingers after applying and it was so oily feeling i had to use extra soap a couple times just to get the feel off. Returned this the next day, not worth buying. Going back to my regular more expensive one that goes on clean feeling, it's true you get what you pay for. :(

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I didn't think to check the bottle for contents until I ran out of my other products. Last night I went and pulled out the bottle, excited to use my new product. Then I pulled out the bottle and found it not only unsealed, but EMPTY! Are you kidding me?! What a horrible mistake or fraudulent product. I can't tell which, but either way I'm annoyed.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I am a person who has a skin care routine and very sensitive skin so this was recommend to me. I also have eczema. If you are someone like me, DO NOT purchase. This product is not for sensitive skin.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I had been using mandelic acid by another company and decided to try this. It does absolutely nothing for my face. My cystic acne on my chin has reappeared in full force. That's what I get for trying to save some money.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Unable to use as the product does not come with soecific instructions. For a complete novice to acid peels.."Use once daily and ideally in the pm"...is not sufficient. Nothing about how to apply? how long to leave it on for? does it need a neutralizer?... Dangerous to Google generically for this type of thing when it's your face! Emailed the company for instructions but no response so it's just sat there. Better safe than sorry. Hiwever, reached out to an Ordinary YouTuber and she promises to upload a video next week. So I'll be patient until then.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I knew i had sensitive skin and was under the impression that mandealic acid would be for that compared to gylcolic or lactic. I used 3 or 4 times over a month period and slowly got red rash almost mimicing rosacea and hives on cheeks and then breakout red rash on chin area. Again, it wasnt immediate it slowly crept in and got worse and worse.
It has taken me a week of skipping this and using aveeno calm and restore lotion and my skin is finally starting to get back to normal.
Guess if your skin is sensitive enough, mandelic is also too harsh.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Trying to give this product time to work it’s magic but it’s really hard… it’s been almost 4 weeks and my face is breaking out more than it has in a very very long time. Not sure if I need to stop the product or if it’s “purging”. So far not so good 🥴

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I read reviews before I purchased this serum. I was excited to receive it and I followed the directions. I only used it at night but unfortunately after the first night I woke up with zips on my face😑. I decided to continue using this product and unfortunately I continued to break out. I used it without my night cream thinking that would help and I broke out still. Some products work well for us and I’m sorry to say this wasn’t a match made in heaven🙃.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: When I first bought this, it was really slimy. Mine had mineral oil in it for some reason. I bought the real thing from Sephora; it’s a slightly different ingredient list fortunately. Mind you, this was relatively close together. I wouldn’t buy this product from this seller again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
MAY 2020: I am disappointed in this product a bit. I've used acids in the past with great results. I bought this with the intention to add it to my night routine for smoothing and resurfacing texture in my skin. But I find the the consistency to not layer well with my other serums. This has an oil like feeling that causes my hyaluronic acid serum (also from The Ordinary) to roll really badly. I have to almost pat this in completely to even make it work which takes up a ton of time. I usually like to feel a bit of a tingle when applying acids, but with this I feel nothing at all. I think Id have better luck with the lactic acid serum from The Ordinary for night time. I also experienced a breakout after the second night of using this product. I cannot say if it was the product that caused it or my own hormones. All in all I give this product a 3 star rating because I haven't used it long enough to feel or see a difference, but so far am not impressed with its texture.

*UPDATE* July 2020
This stuff is way better than I originally thought, it just needs time to work! My overall texture and tone has much improved. I pair it exclusively with Rosehip seed oil. I included a photo with no makeup

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I bought the Amazon product first I never peeled or felt anywork being done on my skin so I felt it was fake. I then ordered Sephora’s. After trying Sephora’s product, I feelt both were the same product , identical. I have not peeled or felt any peeling sensation with any of them. I feel the Amazon product is genuine. I am keeping both products to to see how it goes and hoping the dark spots improve.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've used almost the whole bottle and yes it does make my skin slightly clearer and is good for exfoliating it has my chin and forehead lighter than my other parts and did absolutely nothing to hyperpigmentation I don't recommend this if that's what your looking for to help with dark spots

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I just used this product for the first time so obviously I can't comment on how well it works. But this stuff is *WITHOUT A DOUBT* OILY. I'm hoping that maybe I just used a little too much and next time it won't be as greasy, but I will be happy to review again later and let you all know how it goes! I'm really hoping it works as well as the reviews say and that I can get over the greasiness.

Update:
I have been using this product for about 5 weeks now and I have not noticed any change in the appearance or texture of my skin. I have acne and hyperpigmentation/melasma. The product is oily and feels greasy, even after rubbing it in. I would not buy this again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This 10% Mandelic is not irritating on my sensitive skin, but the formula seems to contain a high % of glycerine (?) or an ingredient that leaves a wet greasy look on the face that doesn't dry or absorb. It sits on my skin and smears on contact, long after it's been applied. Perhaps in a dry environment it works out better?? I was excited to find it at a price much lower than another brand, but dislike the formula at any price. I did a patch test with this compared to 5% TCA peel and it turned out that I can tolerate this but not the TCA. I have extremely sensitive however I'll try another brand and discard this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have used 10+ products from the ordinary and have liked many of them, but this one was just okay. I’d read a lot about mandelic acid for acne improvement, pore refinement, and brightening skin tone so I was very excited to try this (I have large pores and hyperpigmentation from acne). This was... alright. I haven’t noticed any lightening of my scars or improvement in my skin texture. It helps a little with active acne, and it’s not irritating to my sensitive skin, but it’s nothing to write home about and I have five or six other products that I like much better for blemishes. The price was very reasonable, so it was worth trying, but I wouldn’t purchase this item again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I bought this product thinking it solve my acne prob but it didnt help a lot coz i have diff skin prob.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I get Mandelic acid for acne, it's the only thing that seems to work. This product however doesn't seem to work very well at all. It leaves a oily layer on your skin and didn't seem to help keep my acne away or make them go away like other products. In fact, I am pretty sure it's drying my face out and making it worse. I would not recommend this product to anyone, maybe it just didn't work for me but you know how it goes. This stuff is not cheap but it was cheaper than what I usually get, which is why I gave it a try.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
The product is very gentle. You can use every day because works 0 irritation. I just finish my bottle and I am still thinking is a real acid o something different. It's like a toner my skin looks more clean but no visually better. The formula is oily but you can remove with water easily, fast.
I suffer Melasma and some sun spots they are there with the same shape and color now. Perhaps I have to buy 4 extra bottles to see results.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: If you have sensitive skin I'd keep looking sis and I wouldn't go with this, long term it's just not worth it when you could get something even better from the ordinary. If I use this more than twice a month on my normal/sensitive skin I experience dry patches and breakouts. I mostly use it for my tzone when I have a lot of build up and I blot one a single drop and that's it, and at that pace I'll have this stuff for years.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I used this for 2 days, had a minor breakout and stopped using it. A week later I tried it again for 2 days with similar results. That said, I do not think it is a bad product. I think I am just allergic to one of the ingreidnets in it. i might try a different mandelic acid product in the future.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Bought this because of the good reviews but I must be one of the very few it causes to break out. Can't give it a negative review since it clearly works for most people but I would get just a minor red rash and very small surface acne the next day after using specifically where I put it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Overall I’m really satisfied with this product. Saw almost immediate results in my skin after one use.

My only advise is to purchase from Ulta or alternate site — amazon hiked the price up. Much cheaper buy elsewhere

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’m not sure this is doing anything but making my face itchy. If you have sensitive skin this is not for you. I think buying this from amazon is a bad idea. Just buy it from the website.

ReviewText: Not sure if this product actually works. Unfortunately, I waited too long to return it. Its oily and leaves my skin feeling sticky. My previous Mandelic acid serum was more of a gel and worked so well. This one not too great.

ReviewText: It's not a serum, it should be used to do a peeling. The contents are a bit oily and you need to be careful about the pipette when you pull it out because it drips and you lose the contents. I put it on pose all night, as I had read, but I sincerely advise against it because in the morning I was reddened. Better leave it on for 40 minutes and remove it. The product seems to work, used consistently, helps to improve the skin. I do it once a week, my skin becomes softer and smoother, although personally I have tried even better peels, but this is also good. The percentage of acid is not very high, so it is gentle, it penetrates gradually, but if left all night it does not convince me.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
The Ordinary’s Mandelic acid formula seemed a bit oily/slick at first, but it still works pretty well. I wouldn’t use it for daily use, but it works well for 2-4 times a week (maybe every other day). It doesn’t cause lots of visible peeling, which is good for me, but does cause a very slight tingly burn so you know it is working.

I think the 5% Lactic Acid formula with HA is slightly better in general, and makes the skin nice and soft, and less dry. But, this one is pretty good too. Be careful if using more than one irritating/acid based product at a time. (If you use one on a given day, don’t use the other.)

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I ordered this awhile back and honestly any time I had alittle bit of acne id apply this and my face the next morning would be glowing with absolutely no pimples . It’s hydrating too

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have religiously been using the Face Reality Mandelic serum and decided to try The Ordinary's mandelic to incorporate into my skincare routine. This mandelic is pretty strong and you have to ease into using it. it feels a bit oily but I mix it in with my nighttime gel. make sure to use sunscreen in the mornings as the mandelic increases sun sensitivity. I did notice that my face was breaking out from using this but you have to let your face get adjusted.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: In emergency and to learn to swim remove dark spots on face.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have been using this product for about 2-3 weeks now. I have seen a drastic improvement in my hyperpigmentation and texture of my skin. I use it daily at night after cleaning my face. I have peeled about twice but I exfoliate every morning so that’s not a big deal. A lot of people said it’s oily, but I wouldn’t really describe it as that. It’s deifnitely lightweight. Has no strong odor. Overall I like the product and plan to continue to use it.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I started using this product because I have fairly sensitive skin and other harsher chemicals would irritate it. The mandelic acid has been great for my skin and helped clear up my acne and hyperpigmentation. Be sure to follow the advice on the box and use spf during the day.

I see gradual improvements. I apply it at night as it is a bit "greasy" feeling, however, it will absorb in your skin. It comes with a bottle dropper which made me feel very scientific.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Mandelic acid is the most delicate of all acids that perform an exfoliating function. The brand says it can also be used daily as it is not photosensitizing. Actually, although I have a mixed/oily skin, after two days I had very dry areas and the sebum in the T zone had increased. I recommend using it max once a week and not in combination with other exfoliating products. Used sparingly (one evening a week in my case) is really an effective product. And anyway, in doubt I always use sunscreen the day after application.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I recommend it for weekly care, the consistency is oily but easy to wash off, the effect is very gentle, I think it is suitable for sensitive skin, even too gentle for me. I've used another brand of almond scrub before and it was more effective. but the effect is still visible, the skin is shinier and smoother

ReviewText: To try really good!!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: moisturising

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Skin type: 30s, cystic acne prone, hyperpigmentation, redness, combination skin, CANNOT use salicylic acid, glycolic or lactic acid.
I never thought I had sensitive skin until a product with salicylic acid broke me really badly a month before my wedding. Curse you, salicylic acid, you are not for me. But this product is - mandelic acid. I can't remember how I heard about it, but what really got me interested was the fact that's is recommended for Skin of Colour, like mine :D
FIRST USE: I applied four drops on my face (forehead, cheeks, nose/chin) after cleansing (oil and foam), then allowed it to sink in before continuing with the rest of my routine (toner, serum, moisturiser). Honestly, it takes a little while to sink in your skin, don't use too much, you'll be waiting a LONG time.
The next morning I was washing my face and I was like, omg, my cheeks are baby soft. So soft, my skin was legit renewed, it felt like a miracle was happening. Basically, any sort of decongestion was dissolved and I was left with smooth skin. Yes, it works , if you need an acid that won't irritate your skin, this may be the one for you.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: After doing some research and with thee suggestion from others I decided to add a chemical exfoliator to my skin care routine. This was one of my options and I liked how easy and clear it is to see what the product is made from as I am very new to this whole ordeal. After adjusting my skin to it, and slowly adding it to my routine I have to say that I am seeing incredibly clearer skin on my face in just 2 months. There was about a 3 week period of breakouts as the product worked to clear out what was already in my skin, but after the initial worsening things have gotten better and now my skin is very clear and smooth. I am so impressed that I decided to see if it would help to clear my shoulders as well. It has only been a few weeks but so far so good! I will certainly continue to use this in the future, and am considering getting it for my brother as well.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The very best serum for acne-prone women of color. My adult acne simmers on but Mandelic acid fades dark spots gently and thoroughly. I used a very expensive Mandelic acid serum for years until I found this great product. I'm now a huge fan of this affordable but high quality brand. Thank you, The Ordinary!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Great product. Be careful not to use too much or u get a greasy feeling. No concerns and works well.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Ok, to start I was disappointed in just one thing: no directions or literature or anything. I had to go online to figure out what to do (how much to use, when to use, how often, etc). But a little bit of Googling solved that.

Honestly, after just a few days I started seeing my skin gradually clear up and dark spots lighten. I have some problem areas on my chin with lots of small bumps and scars and on my cheeks. I've been using this for about 3 or 4 weeks now and I've only had one PMS zit and it went away super fast. Like 24 hrs fast. And the dark spots are getting lighter and lighter.

Plus, just a few drops go a long way. This stuff is seriously worth it. Love it!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: The skin feels very fresh

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Love this, wish it were more widely available. Thanks!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I first bought this back in 2019! And I'm just now writing a review. I don't have problems with my skin at all. I used this for exfoliation. Over the years I noticed that if I were to have a slight reaction to something (a new lotion or oil) this will clear me up by the next morning. I don't use it as regularly as I tell myself too but I can't not have it in my skin care arsenal.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: In 1 week I saw a huge difference my dark spots were lighter and some gone completely. Want a skin purge use this . My skin is softer and clearer. Will continue to use product until it’s all gone .

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: It’s cheep, it’s simple, it does what it’s supposed to. Worth the cheep price vs other brands

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I don't know why mandelic acid isn't in more products, but it should be! From the very first use, it just begins shedding the old dull skin on your face. I was surprised to see my cystic acne on my chin drying out over night, and the skin peeling off any beginning scars around it - this stuff is amazing! I am a darker skin tone, and worry about products bleaching my skin, so far, I'm not seeing this to be an issue, it does exactly what it says - a gentler peel for a more even skin tone, and great for dark skin tones. This is a great AHA to add to any beauty regimen, just follow the instructions to avoid over sensitivity to the skin, and SPF is a must in the daytime! Definitely a part of my skincare regimen from now on!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Saw this on TikTok and had to try! It’s worked so well and my acne has been reduced, often completely gone! It did take my skin a week or two to get used to it, but I use it every day now.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Simple product design and ingredients to keep it affordable. Did find it much cheaper elsewhere after I ordered on here but I will no longer use any other brand of similar skin products. This works great for KP (the dry bumps on the back of your arms) and for acne. I mix it with "rough and bumpy skin" lotion and massage it in and it makes a drastic difference overnight. Even without the added lotion. My toddler also occasionally gets little red bumps on her face/arms and putting this on every night clears them up in as little as 2 days. I plan to buy pretty much the whole line.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Amazingly got effect in 3 days.
I’m oily face. Originally there were 5-6 dark acne scars. They are much faded in the forth day which is today.

My steps:
1. wash face with cleanser

2. wash with scrub to thin the horny layer(uppermost of skin)

3. Slightly wipe out water spots on skin with towel, but leave your skin with moist

4. Get 3-4 drops of this product on left hand, use 1 or 2 fingers on right hand to dip and apply on your face, 3-4 drops are enough to cover whole face

5. Basic steps you usually do, Toner, serum, then cream(or lotion)

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've been using this product every other day and alternating it opposite retinol. I have not experienced any irritation and have noticed an improvement in my enlarged pores on my t-zone.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I am a darker skinned black woman and I have always had hyperpigmentation on my knuckles due to a lichen simplex condition. I’ve had lichen simplex simplex since I was a child. The skin in that area had always been dark, scaly and dry. I could never ever not feel embarrassed by the way it looked as it’s much darker than the rest of my hand. I’ve only been using this product for about two weeks now faithfully every night before bed on the darker area and it’s already significantly improved on both of my hands. It hasn’t peeled drastically too much and the appearance of my skin is softer and smoother. I have no complaints.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This product is amazing...I have been using it since Oct. 2019. I had severe hyperpigmantation from years of acne scars that would not fade. I used this product every night before I go to sleep and I wear sunscreen (I use Black Girl Sunscreen) everyday. My skin would peel gently peel about every 3 days. I have had amazing results. I have clear skin for the first time in about ten years. I would recommend this product to dark skin women especially to those who have sensitive skin. I still have a little product left...so the value for money is amazing

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Incredible for my dry combo skin. Huge difference in one month and still going. mostly just reduced whitehead that would appear every morning. HOWEVER, it must be combined with a moistureizer, while humectant it doesnt stand on its own for a moisturizer having mixed with hyaluronic acid(not a big issue as its not its intended purpose)

ALSO last thing

the price is a bit pricey for its size, or I am simply unsure of how much I should be using every night. I find 3-4 drops sufficient, but uncertain exactly. ymmv. Yes it is new which is understandable. overall great for dry skin

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I purchased this after doing some research on what particular acid is good for african american skin tones, without causing more hyper pigmentation. This showed up and I decided to make a purchase. When I tell you I noticed a difference in my skin after a week of daily use! All of my extremely dark spots lightened up to the point its like it was never there. I only apply 4 drops on my face along with one of my face moisturizers and that's it. Don't forget when going out into the sun to use sunscreen on your face.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
I felt the need to write this short review just to point out the absurdity of the directions. It says "do not use on sensitive skin".
Ironic, since mandelic acid is essentially for sensitive skin types.
Nevertheless, it didn't cause a reaction when I patch tested it on my forearm overnight. I have the most sensitive skin in the world, products made for sensitive skin generally cause me chemical burns or a rash.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This has been great for managing my “mascne” and helping to clear up scars from teenage breakouts. My pores are also noticeably smaller and it’s been pulling crap out of them that I didn’t even know was there! I have to be careful because it can easily dry out my skin and cause peeling if I don’t moisturize well, but I apply it before bed several nights a week and my skin has never looked better! It even speeds up the clearing time for new breakouts!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I love this serum! I don’t have sensitive skin but I feel like this would not be harsh on any skin type. I got this to replace my face scrub, wanted to get into chemical peels. Leaves my face feeling so soft and I feel like it gets rid of texture. It has gotten rid of minor breakouts over night. I use this alternating nights with a moisturizer afterward. I never experienced any physical peeling. Works great, would recommend this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Having fried, destroyed my face using glycolic acid products, I was happy to find this product. I have very dry, aged, sensitive skin, and rosacea. This product has smoothed my skin and and leaves it glowing. I use CE ferulic acid in the morning, this in the evening, and my skin has never looked better. The price point makes this a steal!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
This saved my skin! Please make sure you wear sunscreen everyday. that seemed to speed up the process for me.
I used this solution on my skin every night for 6 nights and this huge dark mark on my chin has disappeared. I recommend this product to women who suffer from hyperpigmentation and tend to get crazy dark marks after picking skin. bad habits die hard lol!

Wishing everyone happiness in their skin care journey!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This product helps so much with preventing breakouts. It will always prevent me from getting any texture on my skin. My main skin concern was bumps on my forehead. My skin has been clear for as long as I’ve been using this product. I use this product once a day at night. At first this product dried out my skin and would peel in certain areas but I didn’t mind it because it was working I was supplementing my skin with moisture, as you should. I totally recommend this product.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I've had cystic acne for a few years. I joined a "bootcamp" that was extremely helpful and cleared up my face. It has kinda started back up. What's worked best for me is mandelic serum. The one I had was not potent enough. I've been using this ordinary product for about 5 days and my redness is going away and skin is healing. I LOVE THIS stuff. I use this with their squalane oil to combat dryness. Will purchase again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’ve dealt with moderate acne for 25 years. I’ve tried EVERYTHING on the market. I’ve tried aestheticians. I still had breakouts. As I’ve gotten older my skin became dull and my cute freckles morphed into age spots. This product changed all of that. My skin is clear! My spots are fading and my skin is bright! I wake up with soft skin every morning. This product is amazing!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is hands down the best product in my beauty cabinet. I've tried other chemical exfoliants and nothing makes my skin glow like this serum. It not only smooths my skin texture and lightens old acne scars but if I so much as have a bump on my chin after wearing makeup it will be gone overnight when I use this before bed. It saves your skin from the sebum, make up, dirt and any acne causing debris that'll stay in your pores even after cleansing thoroughly.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I hadn't ever used an AHA before and I wanted something gentle, so I did some research and settled on mandelic acid from a well-regarded brand. I didn't know what to expect, but my skin has never been healthier. It's helped to clear the little bumps on my jawline and temples, plus it's making my skin nice and smooth! A tip to everyone new to the product: give it a few days before your pores stop looking dilated. The product makes them look expanded because it's clearing them out from the exfoliation.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: It helps fade blemishes on skin of color without irritation, due to its big molecules, it takes about 3 weeks to start seem some results. Because it doesn’t burn and causes on skin of color like glycolic acid, The Ordinary Mandelic acid is extremely effective but it takes time. Be consistent on application at night them moisturized.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Very gentle for sensitive skin but effective. I have oily skin that becomes textured very easily and cannot use mechanical exfoliation very often as it’s too irritating. After using this for a month I’ve noticed a definite improvement in the overall smoothness of my skin and less random irritation overall. I use about maybe 5 drops for my whole face and neck at night on freshly cleaned skin, leave it for a minute and follow with moisturizer.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Went to the dermatologist for hyperpigmentation and overall my face just looked dirty/bumpy no matter what I used. When I tell you this CHANGED MY LIFE. My whole face is clear clear clear. It looks like it has a filter on now. Acne scars? Gone. Red spots? Gonnnnne. I’m in love.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have, according to my dermatologist, some of the most sensitive skin he's ever seen. I gave this serum a shot, and low and behold, I passed with flying colors. Acne reduction was phenomenal. Toning was even better. He, as well as I, were astonished. Give this a shot. The word "acid" carries a negative connotation. This "acid", however, will surprise you.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have suffered from hormonal acne for years where I would always break out on my right jaw line and ever since the day I’ve been using this product I have no more breakouts and my spots are starting to clear up and this was only in March and we are in April . The chemical peel is also great !

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This is my new must have. I’m prone to acne of all kinds, clogged pores, and folliculitis on my forehead. I’ve gotten a handle on all of these in part to this product. I was worried about the oiliness at first, but it gave me zero problems. I glow right after, and it’s just the right amount of gentle exfoliation.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Wow! Bought at the suggestion of my aesthetician who is treating my rosacea with laser therapy. This works so well! After it sits on the skin for 20 minutes, I can SEE the dirt and dead skin cells come off on the wipes I use to remove it. Be sure to moisturize afterwards!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I’m so glad I bought this. It has greatly improved the tone and texture of my skin. No more redness. Can’t beat the price. I apply it after my Alori beauty spray and before my cerave cream. Great combination.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have woken up with multiple whiteheads on my nose every day for years. All acne cleansers and exfoliants never worked. This seriously worked the very first time i ised it and i hve had no white heads at all on my face since i started it- for the first time in the last 3 years !

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText:
Got this for my mother for Christmas. She loved Artistry's alphahydroxy which has been discontinued. She loves it, it keeps her skin so soft and I can't help but "borrow"

She spilled a bit and has been complaining for days

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have terrible skin. Some adult acne, pigmentation issues and texture issues. I’ve been using this for just over a week and already see a different. I love it so much I just bought 5 more of the ordinary products!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Great product. I have used other acids, glycolic and lactic, but this one works best for me. My skin glows but is definitely not irritated. Absolutely a great find for me and I will continue to use this.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Good service

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This has been an absolute holy Grail product for me. I had a lot of congestion and slow exfoliation happening. It was making my skin feel clogged and gross. I started using the mandelic acid and it cleared my skin up in about two weeks. I love it!

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: This acid is gentle, effective and super affordable. The formula contains hyaluronic acid which makes it somewhat hydrating but also gives a bit of a greasy texture. I like to swipe it on and let it sit for 30-45 minutes and then proceed with the rest of my routine. I will definitely buy this again.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Have suffered with acne since I was about 12 and I am currently 29. This and nip and fab sensitive glycolic pads have been the only thing to help me see real results besides changing my diet for months and antibiotics. Will never be without.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I got this because of my sensitive skin and I wanted to work up to the stronger formula. I think works really well and a good addition to my skin routine.

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: Can’t find this at any stores near me and it works wonders on my combination skin and acne discoloration spots. Thank you :))

Product Name: The Ordinary Mandelic Acid 10% + HA, Gentle Exfoliating Serum for Clarity and Hydration, 1 Fl Oz
ReviewText: I have sensitive acne prone skin. I use this at night on active acne and it reduces the size and irritation by morning. This is helping to manage and clear my acne.

ReviewText: It’s the best product I’ve found with Mandelic that I can use in my face for night time! I love it and it makes your sling brighter and also softer (benefits from this acid)!
